loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PHP 30,000, which she used to repair two washing machines and dryers for business.

Priscilla's laundry shop is doing well. She was able to pay her loan on time as well as increase her income. The revenue from her income was used to pay her children's school expenses for the semester and pay for two of her employee's children's school items and projects.

Today Priscilla is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy laundry soaps, detergents, fabric softeners, and additional irons, as well as to expand her business to buy piglets to start a piggery.

Priscilla's goal of giving the best service is now realized. Priscilla is determined to work hard to see her children finish their schooling as well as helping her employees to have a better life for their families.

loans.use: To buy laundry soaps, detergents, fabric softeners, and additional irons, as well as to expand her business to buy piglets to start a piggery.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a 47-year-old, married Lebanese woman, living with her husband and two children. She is a housewife, taking care of her children and her husband by meeting their needs. Her husband is an employee in a hotel. Due to their hard financial situation, and the fact that the new school year is near, she needs to borrow from Kiva Partner, Vitas s.a.l, to pay for her children's school fees. She said that she is very happy and eager to always borrow additional loans to help her children continue their education properly.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es de la ciudad de Villarrica, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y tanto ella como su esposo se dedican al comercio. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros, accesorios como  bijouteries y carteras en general, empezó vendiendo prendas que ella misma confeccionaba ya que desde jovencita trabajaba con su madre en las confecciones de todo tipo, las más vendidas son para damas y carteras.
Ella solicita este préstamo para la compra de ropas de la temporada como blusas, vestidos, pantalones y otros.
texts.en:
Graciela is from the city of Villarrica and is 28 years old. She is married, and both she and her husband work in trade. She dedicates herself to selling clothing for men and women, accessories such as costume jewelry and a range of purses/wallets. She started by selling garments that she made herself, since she worked with her mother since she was a young girl making clothing of all types. The items she sells most are women's clothing and purses.

She is requesting this loan to buy seasonal clothing such as blouses, dresses, pants and other items.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing such as blouses, dresses, pants and other items.

loans.name: Oelon Group

texts.en:
Yuliana (in the middle) and two other additional members have joined in the Oelon group. The group aims to get a loan from Kiva via TLM for the improvement of their own businesses. Yuliana, a 59-year-old woman, is the representative to Kiva. 

Yulian and Simson, 67 years old and retired, have 11 children; 8 of whom are married, two are working and the last one is enrolled at college. Now Yuliana and Simson focus on one child, but even so, the education requires money. Fortunately, she has a kiosk business at home that she has been running for 10 years. Besides daily needs, she also sells vegetables and cakes. The income from her business enables her to manage her family’s daily living and education costs for her child. 

So far the business is going well and she has planned to enhance it by providing rice, instant noodles, cooking oil, wheat, sugar, etc. Therefore she needs more money to do so. After they got information about the TLM loan product, Yuliana and two other women joined the Oelon group and requested a loan of  IDR 6,000,000 from TLM. She is thankful that Kiva is willing to support the poor people in the world.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks and supplies such as; rice, instant noodles, cooking oil, wheat, sugar, etc

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a 63-year-old married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mercedes has a business buying and selling rice grain in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

Mercedes has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 49 years old and married with one child. Mercedita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Mercedita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Mercedita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 40 years old and married with five children, three of whom are still in school. Myra works very hard to provide for them.

Myra runs a business buying and selling salt in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of salt to sell.

Myra has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Myra would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of salt to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Narcisa is 54 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Narcisa has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Narcisa requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of vegetables such as potatoes, onions, garlic, spices, carrots, etc. to sell to her local market.

Narcisa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of vegetables such as potatoes, onions, garlic, spices, carrots, etc. to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nelda is 46 years old and has one child still in school.

Nelda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nelda requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair.

Nelda has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 40 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Rosemarie has a business selling salted eggs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to ferment and then sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to ferment then sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rowena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, spices, pork and other materials for her food production business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, spices, pork and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en: Van’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Van makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Srey’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Srey makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Victory Group

texts.en:
This is the Victory Group, of five members, which are all connected to their field of business within the localities of Chorkor, in the Greater Accra region of Ghana.

Talaata is the group leader, who is an enterprising woman dedicated to commerce. Her main source of income is her business, which is the sale of charcoal. She works in her business by herself.

Talaata has had this business for 12 years. Her customers are mainly the neighbors in her community.

She is requesting the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal, to stock her store.

Talaata dreams of expanding her business so it becomes the best-stocked store in the community.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to stock her store.

loans.name: Barrio Obrero Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres BARRIO OBRERO se proyecta a alcanzar sus metas trazadas con el entusiasmo de seguir progresando y eliminar la pobreza de su diario vivir. 
La Señora Hilda es una de las que integra este grupo, ella tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta tarde en la noche. Ella comenta que con sacrificio ha ido creciendo y  ayudando a sus seres queridos para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos variados para su negocio, como ser verduras, carnes, bebidas, panificados y otros. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Barrio Obrero aims to achieve its established goals driven by the enthusiasm to continue advancing and to eliminate poverty from their daily lives.  

Hilda is one of the group's members.  She has a small grocery store where she works from very early in the morning until late at night.  She says that with self-sacrifice she has been growing and helping her loved ones in order to be able to give them a better quality of life.  

Hilda is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of assorted supplies for her store such as vegetables, meats, drinks and baked goods among others.  She is thankful for this opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her store such as:  vegetables, meats, drinks and baked goods among others.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en:
Hugo is 18 years old and he works as a DJ. He is hired to go to parties. Hugo has his own equipment, as you can see in the picture. He is living with his parents and he helps them with the expenses. 

Hugo needs a loan to buy new speakers for his business. He hopes you can help him because he works hard, he is a young entrepreneur, and he has plans for his business

loans.use: to buy new speakers for his business.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедчон шустрый и отзывчивый парень. Он из Сарбандского района, женат и отец двоих замечательных детей. Умедчон работает таксистом и одновременно занимается животноводством. Он хороший и опытный шофер. У него много клиентов, однако, его доход не достаточен для обеспечения семьи. Поэтому Умедчон решил расширить бизнес в сфере животноводства. Но для этого ему необходимо купить несколько голов телят. По этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Он верит, что Вы поддержите его в трудную минуту. Спасибо!
texts.en:
Umedjon is a bright and kind-hearted young man. He is from the Sarband region. He's married, and is the father of two wonderful children. Umedjon works as a taxi driver, and he also raises livestock. He is a good and responsible driver, and he has many clients. However, his income is not sufficient to provide for a family.

Therefore, Umedjon has decided to expand his livestock raising business. However, in order to do this he needs to buy a few head of calves. For this reason, he has applied for a loan. He believes that you will support him in this difficult moment. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase a few calves.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, is aged 46, married to a farmer and they're blessed with two children. For almost ten years, she has owned and managed a retail store in their village and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income is usually spent on their daily expenses at home.

Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan, amounting to PHP 10,000, to purchase coffee, sugar, rice grains, cooking oil, canned goods, and noodles to sell.

Vilma's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, rice grains, cooking oil, canned goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Haleema Bibi

texts.en:
Haleema is a 52-year-old married woman living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children. Her daughter is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. She has been running an embroidery business for the past seven years in order to meet the family’s expenses. Her embroidery business is very famous in the area, and that is the reason her business runs well. Due to good relations, her business has increased. She is a brave girl.

Haleema’s daughter wants to buy embroidery raw materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbon, needles, and an embroidery machine from the market. Haleema handles transactions with her customers. Her daughter has become an expert in the embroidery business. Haleema has requested a loan so her daughter will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

She wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses, which is why she wants to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours to have in stock. She requires some capital to buy the desired items, but she does not have sufficient cash on hand.

Therefore, Haleema humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, she will be able to buy the threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colours that she needs.
Haleema and her family will be thankful to Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them fund this loan to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for her duaghter.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Murtala has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Murtala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Murtala can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Murtala will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Murtala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 39 years old and she has 2 kids. Claudia is an itinerant saleswoman who sells many different kinds of beauty products from catalogues. 

She goes to offices and houses and she has to walk and travel a lot to purchase and sell the merchandise. She needs a loan to buy more beauty products,  such as perfumes.  She is getting ready to take advantage of the Christmas Season. 

She hopes you can help her. She is healthy, works hard and is good at calculation.  Claudia is ready to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, such as perfumes.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, es una persona muy sacrificada, que a la par que estudia también trabaja, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder abrirse camino.
Ella estudia la carrera de contabilidad y por medio de ella quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Juan is from the city of Coronel Oviedo.  He is a self-sacrificing person who both works and studies, and through his studies he wants to make his way in the world.  He is studying for a degree in accounting so that he can help his loved ones by means of his education.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his university fees so that he can continue with his education.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es de la ciudad de Santaní, ya es un profesional que terminó su carrera, hoy con ganas de poder aumentar sus conocimientos, está estudiando el postgrado de didáctica universitaria, para que por medio de el pueda enseñar en las universidades, y de esa forma ayudar a las demás personas que al igual que el quiera estudiar.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su postgrado, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Cesar is from the city of Santaní.   He is already a professional with a college degree, but he now wants to increase his knowledge.  He is undergoing postgraduate studies so that he will be able to teach at a university.  This way, he will help other people like him who want to study.

Cesar is requesting this loan to cover his postgraduate educational expenses so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Genny

texts.es:
Genny, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está casada y tiene un hijo, por quienes ella está esforzándose para poder ayudarles por medio de su profesión.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y sueña el día de mañana ser una profesional útil a los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Genny is from the city of Carapeguá. She is married and has a child whom she is making an effort to support by means of her profession. She is studying to be a nurse and dreams of one day being a professional who can help everyone else. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her university fees so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: In Him Is Life Group

texts.en:
This is the 'In Him Is Life' group of two hard working members who are very industrious in their business.
They are located within the Greater Accra Region of Ghana.

Esther, 34, is the owner of a business selling soft drinks, cosmetics and provisions. She offers a variety of  products.

She lives with her only son and takes care of him daily. Esther makes good use of her time and is always trying to learn new business methods and strategies.  This year she learned to make decorations, which is now another source of income for her family.

She hopes that with responsibility and honesty, she will be able to pay back the loan that she is requesting. She asks for a loan to buy more products and items to resell.

loans.use: to buy more products and items to resell

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana continua estudiando la carrera de derecho, y por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino para poder ayudar a su familia con su profesión. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le permitió poder seguir con sus estudios.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Liliana is continuing to study for her law degree.  Through her studies she wants to make her way so that she can help her family with her profession.  She states that with her previous loan she was able  to pay her university fees, which enabled her to continue with her education.  Today she is requesting a new loan to once again pay for her university fees.  This way she can continue with her education.  She is grateful for this opportunity to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Fátima está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, se fijaron como meta el crecimiento de cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
La Sra. Laura, es una de las que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, y por medio de su humilde trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales tales como: cerdos y  gallinas para criar y posterior venta de esa manera a seguir esforzándose por ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Virgen de Fátima Group is in its 5th cycle of the women's committee program, where everyone works and they help one another to succeed. They set a goal for each member to grow, not just financially, but also as a person.

Laura, a member of this group, raises and sells small and medium farm animals. Through her humble work, she makes an honest, respectable living. She is requesting this loan in order to buy animals such as pigs and chickens to raise and then sell, to continue her efforts to help her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and sell, such as pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer from the Toka village. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist.  Superior inputs will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.
 
Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Haruna can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later period later of the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Haruna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Haruna hopes to realize better yields.  Haruna plans to use his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación está luchando para poder lograr su meta de ser un profesional útil para la sociedad.
Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder lograr sus metas y sentirse útil para la sociedad de esa forma.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar estudiando y luchar por sus anhelos.
texts.en: Susana is studying in the business administration program. With great effort and dedication, she is working to be able to achieve her goal of being a professional who is useful to society. She is giving her all to be able to achieve her goals and to feel useful to society in this way. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay tuition and fees for her program and continue to study and fight for her dreams.

loans.use: pay her university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número 4to  Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 9 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema, luchando por mejorarla.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Francisca quien tiene como negocio una humilde despensa, ella está creciendo y lucha para poder mejorar cada día su emprendimiento, el cual es el sostén de su familia. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que no teme a ningún desafío, es por ello que siempre trabaja de manera muy activa dentro del programa de comités.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con frutas, panificados, bebidas, carne, y otros, de manera a seguir trabajando y ofreciendo a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Trabajadoras" group is in their fourth loan cycle with the Women's Committee program where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey where nine of the members are below the poverty line, that is to say extreme poverty, struggling to improve.

One of the members is Francisca who has a humble store as a business. She is growing and fighting to be able to improve her undertaking each day which is the support for her family. She is a very demanding woman who is not afraid of any challenge. For this reason she always works hard in the Committee program.

She is requesting this loan to be able to stock her store with fruit, bakery goods, drinks, meats and others. In this way she can continue to work and offer her clients what they request.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store like fruit, bakery products, drinks, meat and other products.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ella es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad, en el último año de carrera.
Es una persona responsable, honesta. Desea culminar con satisfacción sus estudios y ser una buena profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Gloria is from the city of Paraguarí. She is a student in the accounting program, in her final year of the major. She is a responsible, honest person. Gloria wants to complete her education with satisfaction and be a good professional. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay her university fees and be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: pay her university fees and tuition.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia es alumna del quinto año de la carrera de medicina, ella comenta que sus padres son quienes la han apoyado siempre para poder seguir sus sueños de ser un médico.
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza por ser una profesional útil a la sociedad, y apoyar a quienes lo necesitan en algo tan importante como es la salud.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera,  y de esa forma poder seguir con su sueño de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en: Herminia is a student in the fifth year of the program in medicine. She mentions that her parents are the ones who have always supported her in order for her to be able to follow her dreams to be a doctor. Herminia is a person who tries hard to be a professional who is useful to society and to help those who need something as important as good health. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay the tuition and fees of her program and, in this way, be able to continue in her dream to be someone in this life.

loans.use: pay her university tuition and fees.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.es:
Naomi es de la ciudad de Encarnación, estudia la carrera de administración de empresas, a la par que estudia también trabaja, y de esa forma lucha por tener los medios para cubrir los gastos de su carrera. 
Sus padres siempre la han apoyado en todo, y quiere poder ayudarles también algún día, pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y así seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Naomi is from the city of Encarnación. She is studying in the business administration program and works, too, working hard to have the means to take care of the expenses of her university program of study. Her parents have always supported her in everything and she wants to be able to help them some day, too. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the tuition and fees of her program and continue with her studies.

loans.use: pay university fees and tuition.

loans.name: Shadrach Group

texts.fr: Auparavant, Chadrack était cultivateur. A chaque fois qu'il réalisait une grande récolte, il gardait les semences dans un dépôt. Cela a constitué son capital de démarrage dans la vente des intrants agricoles. D'un côté, il vend les semences et de l'autre la production pour consommation. Comme difficulté, en cas de mévente, les semences pourissent; certains cas de pertes se présentent à cause de la non maîtrise du calendrier saisonnier et la baisse du prix pendant la période de récolte. Chadrack et son épouse Kavira espèrent avoir un capital important afin de répondre aux attentes de leurs clients et surtout améliorer les conditions de vie de leur famille.
texts.en: In the past, Chadrak used to be a farmer. Every time he had a large harvest, he would store the seeds in a warehouse. This has allowed him to have a starting capital in order to launch a business selling agricultural inputs. On the one hand, he sells seeds; on the other hand, he also sells produce for consumption. His challenges include having unsold seeds spoil. In some cases, losses are caused by a bad alignment with the farming calendar and dropping prices during the harvest periods. Chadrack and his wife Kavira hope to build sufficient capital in order to meet customer demand and, before all, improve their family's life conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for resale.

loans.name: Ra'no

texts.ru: Раъно 39 летняя мать двоих детей. У нее 2 дочки. Старшая дочка учится в университете, а младшая учится в средней школе. Ее муж работает алюмин - заводе. Сама Раъно работает в алюмин заводе вместе с мужем. Раъно после работе еще у себя дома занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она не ждет заработную плату от работы и дополнительно зарабатывает на жизнь. Раъно заботливая мать и жена. Она обратилась за кредитом, для оплаты за обучения старшей дочери. У нее не зватает денежных средств и по этой причине спрашивает кредит. Вы можете поддержать Раъно сейчас.
texts.en:
Ra'no is 39 and she has two daughters.  The oldest is a university student while the youngest is still in secondary school.  Ra'no and her husband both work at an aluminium plant.  After her work, Ra'no also sews women's dresses from orders she receives from her customers.  As she is making her own additional money, she doesn't have to wait for the salary she receives from her job.

Ra'no is a caring wife and mother.  Because of a lack of financial resources, she is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's tuition.  Please support her.

loans.use: to pay for her oldest daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кава и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Мадины есть 3 коровы, 5 овец, на 0,85 Га земли выращивает картофель, эспарцет и зерновые культуры для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Мадина обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Мадина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и накопить на попупку сельскохозяйственной техники.
texts.en:
Madina was able to repay her previous loan, after using it for its intended purpose.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her obtain this financing.  She now has three cows and five sheep on her farm and also owns 0.85 hectares of land on which she grows potatoes, sainfoin, and cereals for resale and for domestic consumption.  She makes a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).

In order to further grow her farming business, Madina has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy additional livestock.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her livestock headcount.  She would also like to save enough money to buy agricultural machinery.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose viene de una familia humilde, está estudiando la carrera de criminalística, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a su familia, quienes siempre han estado con él.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios y luchando de esa manera por sus metas.
texts.en: Jose comes from a humble family. He is studying in the field of criminology and, through his studies, hopes he will be able to help his family, who have always stood by his side. He is asking for this loan to pay for expenses related to his graduation certification, continuing with his studies and working hard to reach his goals.

loans.use: to pay expenses of graduation requirements

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en:
Hamisu is a maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

In the past Hamisu would have had to sell his maize at a low price at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With a loan from Babban Gona of 2,825 NGN and its support, he will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to 2000 USD per hectare of land, Hamisu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his farm's output for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to store and delay selling his maize harvest until later when he can get a better price for it.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is a 38-year-old farmer and also a father of two children. The woman who stands near him is his wife and she is a factory worker. They can only make USD 7 per day to support their family. Sok resides in a rural area of Prey Kabbas District, Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in this career for nearly 10 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for his house. He is very happy with this loan, since it will promote his health, the environment, and his living standards. He would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like him.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.en:
Mirtha is originally from the Dominican Republic and has been living in the United States for the past 28 years. She started her business because of her passion for and skill in cooking Dominican cuisine. In the past, Mirtha has always received great reviews on her home cooking and has been asked, on many occasions, to cater events for friends and family.

Mirtha's greatest success in running her catering business has been being able to meet so many new clients and contribute to their special events in a memorable way. She currently runs her business alone. In the past, she has faced difficulty in getting access to working capital for big catering jobs.

Mirtha is seeking a loan to purchase additional cooking materials and to also hire an assistant to help her take on more catering contracts. Her vision for the future is to continue being of service to others through her catering service.

loans.use: to purchase materials and hire an assistant that will allow her to take on additional catering jobs.

loans.name: Musarat Bibi

texts.en:
Attention to detail, dedication, and passion for her work are what drive Musarat to succeed. She is a 60-year-old woman who works making traditional woven clothing. She works every day for the sake of her family, who live in a community in Multan, Pakistan. Her husband can’t do more work because he is a heart patient.

Nothing is more important to Musarat than her children. That is why she is always seeking to develop her business. Her main source of income is her business weaving traditional clothing.

In order to continue her success, she is now requesting a loan from KIVA’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to invest in buying materials such as threads, dyes in different colors and a power loom.

Musarat and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lender’s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy a power loom and other raw material such as dyes and threads for her weaving.

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en: Sreyneang’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sreyneang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin, a resident in Kampong Cham province, is 37 years old and married with three dependent children, one of whom is in school and the others are too young for schooling. Growing rice and raising ducks has been her main source of income for years. Earning about USD10 per day, Rin can save about USD7.5 each day.

Rin is new to VisionFund, and she is applying for a loan to buy ducklings and feeds to nourish them. She hopes that her business will grow smoothly and earn her more income to expand it and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ducklings and feeds to nourish them for sale to increase her income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote area of Kampong Cham province, Sophat is 26 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school while the other is too young to go yet. She is also the leader of this two-member group seeking a loan.

To make a living Sophat and her husband grow rice and soybeans and do labor for others. Drops in rice and soybean prices are the couple’s main challenge in this occupation.

Sophat has taken out and successfully repaid four previous loans through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia. She is now applying for a 2,500,000 KHR to be divided between her and her group member. With her portion she is planning to buy rice and soybean seeds and organic fertilizer to boost crop yields.

Her past loans have enabled her to improve the family’s living conditions. She hopes now to get high rice and soybean yields to support her family and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice and soybean seeds and organic fertilizer to boost her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: Chanthorn’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Chanthorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Madou est celui qui à la corde du bœuf en main, c’est un malien âgée de 44 ans marié  père de  07 enfants  dont 04 sont scolarisés.
La femme est le ménage et exerce le petit commerce de condiment pour aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
Il a une bonne moralité dans sa communauté, très expérimenté dans son activité qu’il exerce depuis 8 ans, il fait preuve de courage et de rigueur dans son élevage de bœuf.
Madou achète ses bœufs dans la foire de sa localité  et il les vend dans la même foire. Ces remboursements précédents avec le RMCR ont toujours été bien fait, ce qui lui permet de dégager un bénéfice supportant les frais de scolarité et l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
Madou is the man holding the ox by a rope.  He is a 44-year-old native of Mali, married, and the father of seven children, four of whom are in school.  His wife takes care of the house and also sells condiments in order to help her husband cover the family's daily needs.

Madou enjoys a good reputation in his community.  He also has a good deal of experience in his activity, in which he has been involved for the past eight years.  He is a brave and serious cattle breeder.

Madou buys cattle at the local market and resells them at the same venue.  He has always honored his repayments with the RMCR.  He has also been able to make some profits which have helped him to buy clothes for his children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to raise and resell cattle.

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es:
Fabio es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio su estudio quiere poder abrirse camino en el mundo laboral.
Él es una persona muy trabajadora que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Fabio is from the city of Villarrica. He is studying a career in accounting, and through his studies wants to enter the workplace.

He is a very hardworking person who is putting all his effort forth to grow and succeed. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay for his education expenses. In this way he can cover the expenses he has.

loans.use: pay for education expenses.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is 32 years old and lives in Battambang province. He is married and has two sons too young to attend school yet. His wife and he earn income from working in construction, playing traditional songs and sewing clothes to sell. These three businesses earn them about 10 USD a day, from which they can manage to save about 4 USD daily for future needs.

Sophea is now requesting a 1,000 USD loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia to buy a decent motorcycle to commute from home to his workplace and to add a bedroom to his house. He hopes that a motorcycle will reduce the cost of and time spent commuting. Given more time to work, he hopes to earn extra money to send his sons to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to save time and money commuting to work and add a bedroom to his house.

loans.name: Jhoselin

texts.es:
Jhoselin es una joven mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 1 año, y su negocio es la confección de guardapolvos.
Ella es emprendedora, constante y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘cupesi terrado’ donde hace 31 años, una riada dejó sin hogar a cientos de familias que crearon la ciudadela que actualmente se potencia como el epicentro económico de la ciudad.
Jhoselin es de tez morena, cabello castaño obscuro largo, y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer de taxi y con su hijo que aún no está en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de guardapolvos, delantales, mandiles y prendas de trabajo mayormente femeninas, actividad que realiza en un cuarto de su casa habilitado como taller de costura para luego realizar la venta por mayor y menor de forma ambulante en distintos lugares comerciales y peatonales, “aprendí a costurar por la ayuda de una amiga con la cual trabajé durante bastante tiempo, tuve la oportunidad de independizarme y la demanda del negocio me exige mejorar la calidad de costura…” comenta. su negocio es exitoso porque no cuenta con competencia directa en los lugares donde ambula. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende por mayor y menor, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar nuevas máquinas. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura completo, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser industrial para mejorar la calidad de las confecciones y producir por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que reaiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jhoselin solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser industrial para mejorar la calidad de confección y producir por mayor.
texts.en:
Jhoselin is a young woman of 25 years. She lives with her partner and has a one year old child. Her business is the making of overalls.

She is enterprising, steadfast and very responsible. She runs her business in the neighborhood of Cupesi Terrado, where 31 years ago, a flood made hundreds of families homeless, whom then created the citadel that now has become the economic epicenter of the city.

Jhoselin is of dark complexion, long dark brown hair, and short stature. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which is spoken in her home environment, and she speaks Spanish since it’s the common tongue and for the business she runs. She shares her life with her partner who works as a taxi driver, and with her son who is not yet of school age. They live in a rented room built out of brick, which has potable water, electricity, and sewerage.

Her business is the production of overalls, smocks, aprons and work clothes, mostly for women. She performs her work in a room of her house equipped as a sewing workshop, and then she sells them both in wholesale and itinerantly in various commercial and pedestrian areas.

"I learned to sew with the help of a friend with whom I worked for a long time. I had the opportunity to become independent, and business demands required me to improve the quality of my sewing ..." she says. Her business is successful because it does not have direct competition in the places where she walks. The advantage of her business is that she can sell both wholesale and retail, the disadvantage is her lack of capital to buy new machines.

Her dream is to have a complete sewing workshop. She wants to buy an industrial sewing machine industry in order to improve the quality of her sewing and to produce in bulk. This is her first sequence of loans with Emprender in the 5 years that she has been running this business.

It is for these reasons that Jhoselin is asking for a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of her sewing and to produce in bulk.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of her sewing and to produce in bulk.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kabiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Kabiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Kabiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isyaku

texts.en:
Isyaku is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isyaku has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Isyaku can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Isyaku will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Isyaku is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en:
Philibus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Philibus is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Philibus would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Philibus will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Philibus now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members.  He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Danjuma

texts.en:

Danjuma is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

Asha'habu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.
