loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en:
Isiya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Isiya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Isiya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Isiya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Isiya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Isiya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike with which to do business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Ahmed is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth some day. 

Traditionally, Ahmed would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Ahmed can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ahmed has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 

Ahmed is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to repair his house or to move into a bigger home. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena has been involved in activities since 2014. She started her business with her own working capital of $2000. She is requesting a loan of $1500 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies according to what people like, including: candles, eggs,  noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, nuts, cigarettes, coffee, children's milk and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

She also has a dog and a pig. She hopes to make her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy candles, eggs, noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, nuts, cigarettes, coffee, children's milk, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Santos Eligio

texts.es:
Santos, se dedica a varios oficio entre los que podemos mencionar administrar una ladrillera, jornalero y albañil; él vive con su compañera de vida, una hija y un nieto, Santos aprendió estos oficios como ayudante durante varios años pero luego el decidió poner su propio negocio ahora ya tiene más de 30 años de experiencia en la albañilería, la ladrillera y en ser jornalero.
Santos solicita el crédito para poder realizar la compra de leña, tierra y arena para fabricar ladrillo, además de poder hacerle algunas mejoras a su vehículo que es el que utiliza para el transporte de sus productos, así como otros viajes. Con el otorgamiento del crédito Santos busca poder fortalecer su negocio, ya que le permitirá poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
Sueña con ampliar su vivienda y crecer como microempresario.
texts.en:
Santos works in different trades, including managing a brick production business, and working as a builder and a labourer. Santos lives with his partner, one daughter, and one grandson. Santos learned his trades over a number of years but later decided to open his own business. He now has 30 years' experience in building, brick making, and in working as a labourer.

Santos is applying for this loan in order to buy firewood, land and sand to make bricks; he will also carry out repairs to the vehicle he uses to transport goods and for other trips. With this loan, Santos is looking to strengthen his business. this will allow him to improve his family's quality of life.

Santos dreams of expanding his home and of growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy firewood, land and sand to make bricks; he will also carry out repairs to the vehicle he uses to transport goods.

loans.name: Marìa Carmelina

texts.es: Carmelina tiene 50 años de edad, está casada vive en el campo su esposo es jornalero, hace 18 años todos los días se levanta muy temprano  para dejar a dos terneros alimentándose luego se va ayudar a su esposo a trabajar al jornal, dedicándose  a la crianza de terneros los compra pequeños los cuida, alimenta, y los vende,  así obtiene algo de dinero para satisfacer las necesidades básicas. Carmelina con el dinero comprara dos terneros, vacunas, balanceado obtendría mayores ganancias para poder pagar su gastos, a futuro ya no salir a trabajar al jornal es muy duro estar expuesta al sol y lluvia esto hace que se enferme con frecuencia.
texts.en:
Carmelina is 50 years old. She is married and lives in the country. Her husband is a labourer.

For 18 years, Carmelina has woken up very early to feed her calves. She then goes to help her husband with his work. Carmelina raises young calves: she looks after them, feeds them, then sells them. She thereby earns a living in order to cover basic household needs.

Carmelina will use this loan in order to buy two calves, vaccines and feed. She can thus earn a higher profit to cover her expenses. In the future she does not want to have to go out to work in the fields. It is very hard to be exposed to the sun and rain so much, and Carmelina often falls ill as a result.

loans.use: to buy calves, vaccines and feed.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Oñondivepa está en su ciclo número dos, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron para poder trabajar de manera unida, y por medio de esa ayuda mutua poder salir adelante y crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lilian quien es una persona muy trabajadora, ella se dedica al humilde trabajo de la venta de remedios naturales, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder procurar una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia, está muy orgullosa del trabajo que hace, ya que es digno y honesto.
La Sra. Lilian solicita de este préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales para la venta,  lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Oñondivepa" group is on its second loan cycle. The members are all women, and all heads of family. The have come together in order to work together. Through this help, they want to move forward and grow.

One member of the group is Lilian. She is very hard-working. She does humble work selling natural remedies and, through sales, has the means to enjoy a higher quality of life with her family. Lilian is very proud of her work as it is decent and honest.

Lilian is applying for this loan in order to buy natural remedies to sell; this will help her to realise her business plan and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es:
José, de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado, vive en casa propia con su esposa, tiene hijos pero todos ya son mayores de edad.

José, se dedica al cultivo de yuca, camote y maíz desde que era un niño y a través de la agricultura a logrado cubrir sus necesidades durante muchos años.

José, necesita el préstamo para preparar la tierra y comprar pesticidas, fertilizantes y abono.

José, sueña con dejarle a sus hijos un buen patrimonio, para que vivan en terrenos propios y trabajar en esos terrenos.
texts.en:
Jose, 58, has a fifth grade education. He is married and lives in his own home with his wife. All his children are adults.

Jose works in agriculture growing yucca, sweet potatoes and corn. Ever since he was a child, through agriculture he has been able to meet his needs over many years.

Jose is in need of a loan to prepare his land and buy pesticides, fertilizers and manure.

His dream is to leave his children a good heritage so they can live and work on their own land.

loans.use: to prepare his land and buy pesticides, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María, de 66 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada, su esposo trabaja en una carpintería y juntos tiene 1 hijo pero ya es mayor de edad.

María, se dedica a realizar los quehaceres de la casa y le ayuda a su esposo en la carpintería.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar madera y herramientas para la carpintería.

María, sueña con dejarles una casa grande a su hijo, para que viva en casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria, 66, has a second grade education. She is married and her husband works as a carpenter. They have an adult son.

Maria is a homemaker and helps her husband with the carpentry business.

She is in need of a loan to buy wood and tools for the business.

Maria dreams of leaving a large home to her son so he can live in his own house.
.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools for her carpentry business.

loans.name: Maria Ercilia

texts.es:
Ercilia, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, tiene una hija que está estudiando bachillerato y depende económicamente de ella. 

Ercilia, tiene una venta de comida a domicilio como desayunos típicos y almuerzos, este negocio lo atiende junto a su pareja y su hija, los lugares que más visitan para vender son los negocios y talleres de los alrededores de la colonia donde vive. 

Ercilia, necesita el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta, porque debido a que la demanda de comida es mayor, no alcanzan a cumplir con los pedidos y con la motocicleta lograrán dar abasto a la demanda y entregaran todos los pedidos a tiempo. 

Ercilia, sueña con tener un comedor formal y establecido en un punto estratégico de la colonia y tener empleados para continuar vendiendo a domicilio y tener un local amplio.
texts.en:
Ercilla, 40, has a high school education. She has a partner and her dependent daughter attends high school.

Erciila runs a business delivering food such as typical breakfasts and lunches. Her partner and daughter help her in the business. They sell mainly to businesses and workshops in the areas near where they live.

Ercilla is in need of a loan to buy a motorcycle since demand is greater and she is unable to fill the orders. With the motorcycle she will be able to meet demand and deliver the orders on time.

Ercilla dreams of having a formal diner and establishing a strategic location in the community, as well as hiring employees to continue her delivery business and have a large locale.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Keiry Vanessa

texts.es:
Keiry es una mujer que para sobrevivir se dedica a vender ropa (nueva y usada) y sandalias, también cuenta con un empleo de gestora de ventas de una organización comunitaria, mientras ella trabaja su madre le apoya con el negocio y en su tiempo libre se dedica por completo al negocio, cuando es necesario sale a vender ropa de forma ambulante, esto es para tener otros ingresos, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre y tiene experiencia comprobable, Keiry está acompañada, vive con su familia y su pareja.
Comprará ropa nueva, sandalias y otros productos para uso personal, tendrá un inventario capaz de suplir las necesidades de sus clientes y generarle más ingresos con los que pagara las cuotas de la deuda adquirida, espera aprovechar la temporada de fin de año para vender más.
Los sueños que Keiry tiene son construir su casa propia, ampliar su negocio con la apertura de una tienda y estabilizarse económicamente para que en su hogar las necesidades disminuyan.
texts.en:
Keiry earns a living selling clothing (new and used) and sandals. She also works as a sales agent for a community organization. When she is at work her mother helps with her business. In her free time, Keiry dedicates herself completely to her business and when necessry she goes out as a street vendor to earn extra income. She learned her trade from her mother and has verifiable experience. Keiry lives with her partner and family.

She will buy new clothing, sandals and other personal care products in order to have enough stock to meet customer demand. This will generate more income to pay off debt. She hopes to take advantage of the year-end holiday season to sell more.

Keiry's dream is to build her own house, expand her business by opening a store and stabilize her economy to reduce household necessities.

loans.use: to buy new clothing, sandals and other personal care products in order to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Abraham Valdelomar Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “las emprendedoras de Abraham valdelomar” conformada por 05 socios. Este es el caso de Elena de 38 años de edad casada con 4 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas como gaseosas y aguas  desde hace más de 13 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de gaseosas y agua mineral. El grupo “las emprendedoras de Abraham valdelomar” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. ELENA es la primero del lado derecho viste polo color rojo lleva en brazos a su bebe.
texts.en:
This a new solidarity group called "Las Emprendedoras de Abraham Valdelomar" and it is comprised of five members.

One of the memberrs is Elena, 38, who is married and has four children. She sells beverages such as sodas and bottled water and has been in the business for over 13 years. Her greatest desire is to expand her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy sodas and mineral water.

The group "Las Emprendedoras de Abraham Valdelomar" is grateful to people who make this loan possible through Kiva, as it allows the group members to continue improving.

Elena is first from the right in a red top holding a baby.

loans.use: to buy sodas and mineral water.

loans.name: Marta Ysabel

texts.es:
Marta, de 60 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, está casada, su esposo es agricultor, tiene 5 hijos y todos ya están casados, en su casa solo viven dos nietos y su hija menor. 

Marta, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa desde hace 14 años, pero también tiene una vaca lechera y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y cuida la vaca. 

Marta, necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda como: bebidas gaseosas y pólvora para vender en la época navideña. 

Marta, sueña con ampliar su tienda y tener una fuente de ingresos fija para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Marta, 60 years old, did not go to school. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has 5 children and they are all married. Now only her two grandchildren and her youngest daughter live at home.

Marta has had a small shop at home for 14 years. She has a dairy cow as well, and her husband works in farming and takes care of the cow.

Marta needs the loan to buy supplies for her shop, such as carbonated soft drinks and fireworks to sell during the Christmas holidays.

Marta dreams to grow her shop and to have a steady income to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her shop, such as carbonated soft drinks and fireworks to sell during the Christmas holidays.

loans.name: Marcial De Jesus

texts.es:
Marcial, está necesitando de un nuevo financiamiento para continuar trabajando y llevando el sustento a su familia, comprara pan, embutidos, tomates, repollos, aderezos, bebidas, condimentos, etc., para poder elaborar la venta de hot dogs, tiene la fe en Dios que sus clientes mantendrán la fidelidad a su negocio, ya que así contara con los ingresos que necesita para subsistir.
Al utilizar el crédito anterior para fortalecer su negocio, don Marcial está teniendo mejores ingresos, cuenta con clientes satisfechos y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
Marcial needs a new loan to continue working and supporting his family. He will buy bread, meat, tomatoes, cabbage, toppings, beverages, condiments, etc., to be able to make and sell hotdogs. He has faith in God that his customers will stay loyal to his business, and this way he will have income he needs to survive.

Because he used the previous loan to fortify his business, Marcial is making better income. He has satisfied customers and his family's circumstances remain stable.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, tomatoes, cabbage, toppings, beverages, condiments, etc. to make and sell hot dogs.

loans.name: Jose Inocente

texts.es:
José es una persona dedicada a la comercialización de semilla de marañón, tiene aproximadamente cinco años de estar desarrollando esta actividad, sus ingresos por el momento son estables, él actualmente vive con su esposa e hijos, todos dependen económicamente de don José y no cuentan con ayuda de remesas.
Ha decidido solicitar un crédito para poder comprar semilla de marañón en una cantidad mayor, para almacenar y atender las demandas de sus clientes, considera que estará preparado para la temporada de buenas ventas y como el costo del producto es bajo su margen de ganancias será mayor y así disminuirá las necesidades familiares.
Sus aspiraciones son ser responsable con la entrega de los pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, y al mismo tiempo ser un ejemplo a seguir por sus hijos para que  sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
José is a person who sells marañón seeds. He has been doing this activity for approximately 5 years. At this time, his income is stable. He lives with his wife and children, and all of them depend on Jose him financially. They don't receive any remittances.

He has decided to ask for a loan to be able to buy a large quantity of marañón seeds to store and meet his customers' demands. He is preparing for the season of good sales, and since the cost of the product is low his profit margin will be higher and his family's needs will be fewer.

He plans on being responsible with delivering his customers' orders and at the same time be an example for his children so they can be upstanding members of society.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of marañón seeds to store and to meet her customers' demands. He is preparing for the season of good sales.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, son 17 mujeres, todas ellas muy emprendedoras que sueñan con poder mejorar sus negocios y de esa forma brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
La señora Gladys ayuda al sostenimiento de su hogar con la elaboración de Chipa y posterior venta, la chipa es un alimento típico paraguayo que se consume en toda época del año. Con su trabajo ha logrado dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus chipas, como ser harina, almidón, queso, huevo, manteca y otros insumos, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Trabajadoras. It is in its third cycle of the women's committee program. There are 17 women, all of them very enterprising, all of whom dream of improving their businesses to offer their families a better quality of life.

Gladys is helping to support her home by making and selling chipas. Chipas are a traditional Paraguayan food that is eaten all year round. With her work she has been able to give her family a decent life without the hardships she had to go through.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy ingredients to make her chipas, such as flour, starch, cheese, eggs, lard, and more so she can continue with her sales, fighting to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make chipas, such as four, starch, cheese, eggs, lard, and more.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Anita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 30 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are still in school. Cresencia works very hard to provide for them.

Cresencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

Cresencia has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Cresencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza has been doing business since 2012 with her own working capital of $ 800.

She is requesting a loan of $ 1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store including coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, aqua, pens, slippers, shampoo and soft drinks.

She wants to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management of her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, aqua, pens, slippers, shampoo and soft drinks.

loans.name: Odete

texts.en:
Odete is a business women and she has a kiosk, so now she is requesting a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

Odete opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $ 500. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as detergents, sugar, snacks, cooking oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sardines, biscuits, noodles, lighters, eggs including soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

She is happy with the loan that is offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods and she hopes with this loan she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy detergents, sugar, snack, cooking oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sardines, biscuits, noodles, lighters, eggs, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Octaviana

texts.en:
Octaviana lives in Aileu. She saw that every day there are many people who buy goods in the market, so she had the idea to open her store in that place.

So now she is applying for a loan of $ 700 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to add to her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store, including cooking oils, wheat, a stove, a broiler and other things to sell, She wants to be able to make bolu (steamed cakes) and banana fries.

Octaviana has been involved in business activities for a few years; she started with her own working capital of $ 150. She is earning a good income from her business because many people like to buy it, so she is still happy to do her business.

With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to make her business into bigger store. She also has animals like cows, pigs and dogs.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, wheat, a stove, a broiler and other things.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 40 years old and married with five children who are currently in school. Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Gemma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Evelyn Yaneth

texts.es:
Evelyn, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada desde hace 12 años, actualmente vive con sus hijos y una hermana, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y es el fontanero del proyecto de agua potable de la comunidad. 

Evelyn, se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica y lava y plancha para sus vecinos; porque los ingresos del trabajo de su esposo, no alcanzan para cubrir los gastos de su familia. 

Evelyn, necesita el préstamo para colocar un pequeño negocio de venta de meriendas como pasteles, enchiladas y yuca, además para la reparación de una parte del techo de su casa. 

Evelyn, sueña con construir su casa de ladrillo o bloque, porque actualmente es de adobe y es insegura.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 29 years old and completed high school. She has been married for 12 years. She currently lives with her children and sister. Her husband works in farming, and is the plumber for the community drinking water project.

Evelyn works as a domestic servant and washes and irons clothes for neighbours as her husband's income does not cover all family expenses.

Evelyn needs this loan in order to open a small business selling snacks such as enchiladas, pastries, and yucca; and to repair the roof of her house.

Evelyn's dream is to build a house with bricks or blocks as the house is currently made with adobe and is not secure.

loans.use: to open a small business selling snacks such as enchiladas, pastries, and yucca; and to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en: Vanny’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Vanny makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a factory laborer and officer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Samit's Group

texts.en:
Samit, 44, is living in a remote area of Kampong Cham province. She is married with five dependent children, three of whom are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband are growing rice and rubber trees and working for others for a fee. They have been involved in farming business for 26 years. Weeds are the main challenge to rice crop since it reduces rice yields and its quality.

This is the first time for Samit with VisionFund and she, the leader of this two-member group, will use her loan to purchase organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to support farmland. She hopes that her crops will grow better and produce more to support her children’s studying and upgrade lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to grow her crop fruitfully.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en: Sorn’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sorn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and officer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Leak's Group

texts.en: Leak’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Leak makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en: Sokhorn’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sokhorn sells fishes to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Mao makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Savin's Group

texts.en:
Savin’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Savin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their villages there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Savan's Group

texts.en:
Savan’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Savan makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family.

In their village. there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of them to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.en:
Kanykei is a 19-year-old freshman in the International and Comparative Politics Program at AUCA. Her main goal is to devote herself to developing her community and improving everyday lives of her fellow citizens. In order to grow in influence to such a degree, she needs a high-quality education. In her view, AUCA is well-known as a university, which provides an essential and indispensable knowledge of quality in International and Comparative Politics, which is what she has chosen as a tool to further her life. She believes that she can make a meaningful contribution and a difference by giving back to her community and sharing her knowledge and experience that she will gain during her studies at AUCA.

Kanykei has a big family of seven: her parents, four elder sisters and herself. The first three elder sisters are married and live with their own families. The fourth sister went to Korea to earn her living some years ago, when her family was in a deep financial need. Kanykei’s parents are almost retired. Her father works as a driver of public transportation and her mother is a seamstress. Their income covers daily expenses and her parents are ready to sacrifice the rest of it for Kanykei’s higher education costs.

As AUCA is one of the best universities in Central Asia and proves to be the first in Kyrgyzstan, its tuition fee is also high for many families in Kyrgyzstan. Kanykei is applying for a Kiva loan in order to get some funding as a deferred payment and pay it back after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education at AUCA

loans.name: Pong's Group

texts.en: Pong’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province, Cambodia. Pong makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia.

Pov makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province, Cambodia. Sok makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as teacher and officer to support his family. In the group's village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, de 56 años de edad, estudio segundo grado, está casado y tiene 4 hijos pero todos tienen sus propios hogares, solo vive con su esposa, un hijo, su nuera y su nieta.

Enrique, es ganadero, todo lo que sabe aprendió de su padre y lo práctica desde que estaba soltero, actualmente su actividad la realiza juntamente con su hijo, además sabe de albañilería. 

Enrique, necesita el préstamo para hacer dos silos de comida para el ganado, para cortar sácate, pagar mozos y picar el sácate para prepararse con suficiente pasto para el verano. 

Sueña, con tener una procesadora de lácteos, para obtener mayores ingresos y distribuir todos los derivados de la leche, porque actualmente vende la leche a un precio muy bajo.
texts.en:
Enrique is 56 years old and studied until the second grade. He is married and has four children, but they all have their own homes. He lives with only his wife, one son, his daughter-in-law, and his granddaughter.

Enrique is a rancher. He learned all he knows from his father and has been doing this work since he was single. Now he works with his son. He also knows bricklaying.

Enrique needs this loan in order to make silage to feed his livestock, to cut hay, to pay laborers, and to chop the hay so that he has enough feed for the summer.

He dreams of having a dairy processing plant so that he can earn a better income and distribute all types of dairy products, because currently he sells milk at a very low price.

loans.use: to make silage to feed his livestock, to cut hay, to pay laborers, and to chop the hay so that he has enough feed for the summer.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia.

Phalla makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Karla Teresa

texts.es: Karla, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive con sus padres e hijo en una aldea del municipio del Progreso, Yoro.  karla trabajo unos años en una maquila y por estar más cerca a su hijo decidió poner su propia pulpería para vender granos básicos, manteca, frijoles, azúcar, pastas, pan, huevos, productos de limpieza, churros, refrescos, jugos y otros abarrotes. Este negocio lo tiene hace dos años en su casa y ya cuenta con buena clientela. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo con ODEF y es por 25,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar más productos como ser lácteos, granos básicos, pan molde, ingredientes para comidas navideñas, pollo, aceite, huevos, azúcar y productos de aseo. Esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar las ventas y ahorrar para cubrir gastos de educación de su hijo el próximo año. Su sueño es ver a su hijo graduado.
texts.en:
Karla is 27 years old and is a single mother of one son. She lives with her parents and her son in a village in the municipality of Progreso, Yoro. 

Karla worked for several years in a factory, and in order to be closer to her son she decided to open her own small grocery story. She sells dry grains, shortening, beans, sugar, pasta, bread, eggs, cleaning products, chips, soft drinks, juices, and other groceries. She has had this business for 2 years in her house and she has established a good customer base. 

The loan that she is requesting is the second cycle with ODEF, and it is for 25,000 Honduran Lempiras. With it she will purchase dairy products, dry grains, bread, ingredients for Christmas foods, chicken, oil, eggs, sugar, and cleaning products. This investment will help her increase her sales and save in order to cover education expenses for her son next year. Karla's dream is to see her son graduate.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products, dry grains, bread, ingredients for Christmas foods, chicken, oil, eggs, sugar, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Samorn's Group

texts.en: Samorn’s group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh province, Cambodia. Samorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In the village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help the group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia.

Sok makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and officer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

Leng’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Leng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and taxi driver to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

texts.en:
Sophy’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia.

Sophy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and teacher to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Serei's Group

texts.en:
Serei’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia.

Serei makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.en:
Obdulia is 50 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for six years.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Adozinda

texts.en:
Adozinda sells vegetables. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use this loan to buy more vegetables in another place. After she buys, she will bring the vegetables to the market to sell.

She started to selling vegetables in 2010 with her own working capital of $400. Now she wants to take this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants use it to buy more vegetables such as leeks, onions and other things to sell.

Every day her life is selling vegetables in the market because she is earning a good income from it. She also has animals like pigs and chicken.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as leeks, onions and other things to sell.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia.

Kong makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Kimly's Group

texts.en: Kimly’s group members live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Kimly makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 44 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She operates a retail store in the village, which she has been doing for 13 years. She earns a net income of 200 PHP daily. Her net income is usually spent on her family's daily expenses and her children's school allowances.
 
Due to inadequate capital for her business, Bella requested a loan for 25,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase cooking oil, canned goods, food seasonings, beverages, noodles, coffee, and sugar to sell. She hopes that her retail store will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, canned goods, food seasonings, beverages, noodles, coffee, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is 18-year-old freshman in the International and Comparative Politics Program at AUCA. She came to study at AUCA from the south part of Kyrgyzstan. She didn’t choose to study ICP accidentally, but had made her mind up after some political issues in Kyrgyzstan.

The Kyrgyz Revolution of 2010, also known as the Second Kyrgyz Revolution, began in April, 2010, with the ousting of the Kyrgyz president in the capital Bishkek. It was followed by increased ethnic tension involving Kyrgyz people and Uzbeks in the south of the country, which escalated in June, 2010. The violence ultimately led to the consolidation of a new parliamentary system in Kyrgyzstan.

All of this brought many problems for the citizens of this country, and Alina wanted to find answers to her questions about why all this was happening in her Motherland.

Alina entered AUCA with a hope to become a big politician who could make a difference in her country in the future. She dreamed to study at AUCA, as it is accredited in Kyrgyzstan and in the USA, and it provides quality education in English, which opens good perspectives in her life.

Alina has a family of five, and she is the youngest child in her family. Her parents are retired and get a small pension from the state.

Thanks to the diligence of her elder sister, her sister studies in one of the universities of Moscow on a budgetary basis. Her elder brother is a sophomore at another local university. Alina’s student life caused additional expenses for her family as now her parents have to pay for two students’ tuition fees. They do gardening and raise cattle and sell them to earn extra money, but still the money is not enough to cover Alina’s tuition.

Since Alina and her brother study in the capital, they have to rent a flat and pay for utilities, food and transportation. They are always short of money.

Having applied to AUCA, Alina and her family were happy to find out about a Kiva loan, which is provided at an interest-free rate to the AUCA student and can be paid back after her graduation. Alina thanks all Kiva lenders for their support and notes that Kiva is an indispensable loan for her and others in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education at AUCA.

loans.name: Erick Mauricio

texts.es:
Erick, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, vive en casa de sus padres, su papá trabaja como jornalero en la alcaldía del pueblo y su mamá en los oficios del hogar. 

Erick, trabaja como jornal en las labores agrícolas y como ayudante de albañilería en ocasiones en la misma comunidad. 

Erick, necesita el préstamo para comprar una yunta de terneros para engorde, con esto tendrá ingresos a futuro y será una forma de auto empleo para la época de verano. 

Erick, sueña con empezar a estudiar a distancia el bachillerato y así poder aplicar a nuevas oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Erick, 22, studied up to ninth grade. He lives in the home of his parents, his father works as a day laborer for the local town hall, and his mother is a homemaker.

Erick works as day laborer in agriculture, and occasionally as an assistant in construction work in the same community.

He is applying for a loan to buy a team of calves to fatten. This will provide him with income in the future and it will be a form of self-employment for the summer season.

Erick's dream is to begin studying through distance learning so that he can obtain his high school diploma and thus be able  to apply for new work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a team of calves for fattening.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Caacupé, son 20 mujeres muy trabajadoras que vieron una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en el programa de comités de mujeres, y es por ello que se unieron para trabajar juntas.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Claudia, quien tiene una despensa humilde en su casa, comenta que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio lo ha montado, y que gracias a ello da a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, empezó con muy poco, pero ha ido mejorando con el tiempo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos variados para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, panificados, lácteos, bebidas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the city of Caacupé. They are 20 very hard-working women who saw a great opportunity for growth in the women's committee program. That is why they joined together in order to work together.

Claudia is one of the members of this group. She has a modest grocery store at her house. She says that she established it through great effort and sacrifice. Thanks to this, she gives her family a better quality of life. She started with very little, but it has been improving with time.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy varied grocery store products like vegetables, fruit, baked goods, dairy products, drinks, and others. This way she will be able to continue with her sales like she is doing.

loans.use: to buy grocery store supplies like vegetables, fruit, baked good, dairy products, drinks, and others..

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 48-year-old woman from the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is married with two young children; one adult and school aged children. Her husband works hard as a driver while Marie is engaged in a direct sales business to help her husband with their daily expenses.

Marie buys and sells products such as cosmetics, beauty products, lotion and fragrances. She will use the requested loan to buy these products. In the future, she wishes to be successful in her business as well as in her personal life to have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy products such as cosmetics, beauty products, lotion and fragrances

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus works hard to support her child. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Venus requested a PHP 2,200 loan through NWTF in order to buy a water filter. She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water and a healthy family without any diseases caused by contaminated water.

Venus is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
A resident from Battambang province, Sarun is 47 years old and she is widowed. She has three dependent children, one of whom is in school. This breadwinner grows cassava and works for others for a fee to support a living.

Sarun is now requesting for a loan from VisionFund to buy a decent motorcycle. She believes that this loan will enable her to reduce costs of transporting and to save up to buy organic fertilizer to improve farmland.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorcycle in order to reduce costs of transportation.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina sells onions, garlic, turmeric, tomatoes, legumes and vegetables. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She will use this loan to buy more vegetables in another place. After she buys, she will bring the vegetables to the market to sell.

She started to selling vegetables in 2008 with her own working capital of $500. Now she is take this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more vegetables such as papaya fruit, papaya flowers, leeks, onions and other things to sell.

Every day her life is selling vegetables in the market because she is earning a good income from it.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as papaya fruit, papaya flowers, leeks, onions and other things to sell.

loans.name: Mae Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mae Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a tricycle transport business.

Mae Ann is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

Mae Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Laazarus

texts.en:
Laazarus is a maize farmer from Masama village. As a Babban Gona member, Laazarus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Laazarus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Laazarus can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Laazarus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Laazarus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Qurbat

texts.en:
Qurbat is 52 years old young man. He is an IDP who lives at the moment in Bilasuvar region which is a settlement for refugee people. Qurbat is married and his family is large. He helps his family and takes care of old parents too. Qurbat is a well reputed man in the local market. At this age, he has been successful in the local bazaar due to his energetic efforts and tireless working. He grows some vegetable and fruits. People see him as an honest, intelligent and hard-working man. There are many traditional dishes which consist of vegetables like potato, cabbage, tomato and also egg-plant. People prepare dolmas, bozbash and other meals with them.

He wants to become a successful person and to meet the family needs in a better way. For this he plans to improve his business. He is planning to buy new seeds and fertilizers. He requires 1200 AZN loan. Kiva lenders should support him.

loans.use: to buy new seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en: Safia is a 39 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and four siblings. She has spent six years working as a female hairdresser and beautician at her domicile where she greets her customers with a great smile. She started her career at a young age with the intention of increasing the family’s revenues. Currently, she wants to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her sister’s educational fees. She states that this is her second loan from kiva and this loan will help her to ensure a good education for her sister and her school year.

loans.use: to pay her sister’s educational fees.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 30 years old supporting 6 people in her family, she sells used shoes, a business she has been doing for the last 4 years and gets a monthly income of Kes 20000.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more stock.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoe stock.

loans.name: Esam

texts.en:
Essam is a father who supports a family of seven members. They have been living in Aqaba since the late 90’s. ‎ Recently Essam started selling hot drinks and making snacks in his van. He wakes up at dawn to ‎prepare them and stays till afternoon serving people with hot drinks and sandwiches. ‎

Now Essam is requesting a loan to add more variety to the sandwiches stuffing that he makes and ‎increase his stocks of hot drinks. ‎

loans.use: to add more variety to the sandwiches stuffing

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing passenger transportation services by driving a taxi for the past 20 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Sumaira's husband needs to do maintenance on his vehicle because the current condition of the vehicle's tires is not so good. This requires some maintenance expenses to maintain his taxi. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to perform maintenance on his vehicle. Therefore, Sumaira has applied for a Kiva loan for her husband from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband with replacing the tires on his taxi.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a business woman and she has a small kiosk. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as noodles, biscuits, sardines, candy, gambling cards, soft drinks and other things for sale. 

Rosita opened her kiosk in 2013, with her own working capital of 500 USD. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to be able to have more working capital with which to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as noodles, biscuits, sardines, candy, card gambling, Including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelina is 48 years old. She is a widow with five children.

Angelina works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Angelina has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Angelina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Adamu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Adamu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Adamu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en:
Ishaya is a maize farmer from Bazana I village. As a Babban Gona member, Ishaya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Ishaya can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ishaya no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Ishaya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is 51 years old. He lives in El Alto and he also lives on Suriqui Island, where he works. Gregorio is a fisherman and he works as a carpenter. He goes to work at 3:00 am to catch fish.

Gregorio has two little sons that are going to school. He is married and his wife helps him sell fish. Gregorio needs a loan to buy wood because he will make a couple of boats he will sell to the fishermen of his community

loans.use: to buy wood for boat construction

loans.name: Claudia Aricela

texts.es:
La señora  Claudia de 38  años  de edad es madre soltera vive con sus  padres y su hijo  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 12 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación en una comunidad San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Claudia en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, también vende frescos, ropa interior, camisas y achinería, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Claudia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería como   arroz, azúcar, café, huevos, queso, leche, pan, harina, aceite, etc. para surtir bien el negocio en esta época de navidad, Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su ingreso y salir adelante, uno de sus sueños es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Claudia, age 38, is a single mother. She lives at home with her parents and her son. For 12 years she has been engaged in the business of selling groceries. Her business is located at her house in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras. In her business Claudia sells everything having to do with basic needs items. She also sells snacks, underwear, shirts, and low-cost consumer goods. She is a hard-working woman who wishes to get ahead.

Claudia is requesting the loan to buy grocery items like rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, cheese, milk, bread, flour, and cooking oil, etc. She will do this in order to stock her business well during this Christmas season. With the support of the loan she plans to improve her earnings and get ahead.

One of her dreams is to improve her business and her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November, 2015.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, cheese, milk, bread, flour, and cooking oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a 28 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child who is still studying. Her husband works since 2005 as a gypsum designer and she doesn’t work. She is only dedicated for her home and kids. Today, she is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child’s school fees what makes her very happy that she will able to secure him a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay her child’s school fees

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millcent is 30 years old lady from Kisumu who is married and supports 1 person in her family.

She has a computer center, a business she has been doing for the last 5 years and generates a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

She has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to add more stock of printing papers and other stationery to her shop.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business and pay back the loan from VisionFund Kenya.

Her dream is to expand the business.

loans.use: to add more stock of printing papers and other stationery to her shop.

loans.name: Kacia

texts.en:
Kacia is a 37 year old woman who is married to Yohanes, a 38 year old electrical technician. They are blessed with 3 children; their ages are between 4 to 13 years old; two of whom go to school. 
Kacia has been running a kiosk business for years. The business helps her to manage her family daily living. She sells daily basic needs such as cooking oil, sugar, instant noodle, coffee, shampoo, soap, etc. She wants to restock the products and to provide new products as well. She was told by a neighbor on the TLM loan product. She then joined in the existing group as an additional member and requested a loan of IDR 2,000,000 from Kiva, through TLM. She hopes the loan will help her to improve the business and for a better life

loans.use: to purchase more stocks and supplies of products to be sold in her kiosk

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 44 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Grace is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Grace has been farming rice for 22 years and earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Petronila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Petronila es una madre soltera y responsable de suplir las necesidades de sus 5 hijos, como negocio ella desarrolla varias actividades económicas, dentro de las cueles las principales son la crianza y comercialización de ganado y cerdos, además practica el destazo de este tipo de animales, hizo su apertura hace 10 años con ingresos propios, trabaja de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Para mejorar su negocio está solicitando ayuda con un crédito, el cual utilizara en la compra de ganado y cerdos, los cuidará y engordara para luego venderlos a precios mayores, espera recuperar la inversión en un corto tiempo para resarcir la deuda adquirida.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más reconocido en la zona y ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Petronila is a single mother, providing for five children. She has several business activities, mainly raising and selling cattle and pigs. She also butchers these kinds of animals. She launched her business ten years ago with her own money, she works from seven in the morning until five in the evening.

To improve her business she is asking for help with a loan, which she will use to buy cattle and pigs. She will raise them, fatten them and then sell them at a wholesale discount. She hopes to recoup the investment in a short time to quickly pay back the loan.

Her dream is to have a business that is well-known in the area, and offer her customers a better future.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs, which she will raise and fatten to later sell them at wholesale discounts.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Noemi works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Noemi is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Noemi has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Amadu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Amadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Amadu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Amadu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Amadu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es:
Gloria, tiene 33 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está soltera y vive con sus tías y una prima.

Gloria, se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica y en la temporada escolar trabaja como cocinera en la escuela que está en su comunidad y en tiempo de vacación trabaja con sus tías en la pequeña ganadería familiar.

Gloria, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca para repasto, porque quiere aprovechar el forraje que queda del cultivo de maíz y del sorgo.

Gloria, sueña con comenzar a construir una casa para ella.
texts.en:
Gloria is 33 years old, she studied until the first grade, she is single, and lives with her aunts and a cousin.
Gloria works as a domestic employee and during the school season she works as a cook in the school of her community. During the holidays she works with her aunts in a small family livestock business.
Gloria needs the loan to buy a cow for beef, because she wants to take advantage of the fodder that is left from the crops of maize and sorghum.
Gloria dreams with starting to build a house for herself.

loans.use: to buy a cow for beef, because she wants to take advantage of the fodder that is left from the crop of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 31 years old. He is married and lives in Khelvachauri district with his wife and 2 children. Irakli serves locals as a taxi driver and gets a daily income. He wants to open a bakery and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2600 USD.

With the received credit he will open a bakery and will bake Georgian national bread. This will increase his family income and with increased income Irakli will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to open a bakery and bake Georgian national bread

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom’s Group members live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sreymom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and vendor to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter in order to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married and she has 4 kids, all of them are going to school. Her husband is a mason but the family is in the dairy business and they sell milk to a milk plant.

She needs a loan to buy a cow because she wants to give some rest to the animals she has. In that way she will produce better milk, so she hopes you can help her because she works hard

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Amsterdam Group

texts.en:
Joyce is in her mid 60's , she is married with six children, one of them is still in school and other's are grown up.She has been having two projects, growing and selling chickens and a catering business. She works from 7 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy chicks, medicines for chicks, chicken feeds ,started the catering business and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, renovated her house and expanded the chicken shade. She will use this loan to buy chicks, to buy chicken feeds and to buy equipment for catering . She dreams of opening a catering school.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group, Amsterdam, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks, to buy chicken feeds and to buy equipment for catering

loans.name: Nazarali

texts.ru: Назарали занимается растениеводством на своем земельном участке. Он начал этот бизнес 15 лет назад. Эта деятельность является основным источником дохода, ведь за счет нее Назарали обеспечивает семью. Сейчас он готовится к посеву нового урожая, у него недостаточно денежных средств, чтобы купить качественные семена и минеральные удобрение, по этой причине он обратилась за кредитом, чтобы получать качественный урожай. Ваш кредит поможет ему расширить деятельность и постепенно улучшить условия жизни семьи. Он надеется на Вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Nazarali works in agriculture on his own piece of land. He started this business 15 years ago and it is the primary source of income with which he provides for his family. Right now he is getting ready to plant new crops, but he doesn't have enough money to buy quality seeds and mineral fertilizer. For this reason he is looking for a loan so he can receive a good harvest. Your loan will help him expand his business and gradually improve his family's living conditions. He hopes for your assistance and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is the age of 38, living in Rawalpindi, with her family. Her son has been running a barber shop for three years, he has been using salon instrument for many years. Worn out instrument need to be replaced with new one. He wants to buy new instruments but his financial constraints are becomes a hindrance to buy them.

Due to his low purchasing power, Nasreen requested a loan so that her son can become empowered and he can easily buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, shaving machine, front mirror and revolving chair.
Nasreen hopes that this loan will work positively and she would be able to make some saving for household expenses.Nasreen thanks to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her son invest in his barber shop.

loans.name: Machozi Group

texts.fr: Employée dans la savonnerie de son père, Béatrice s'est constituée un petit capital à partir du salaire qu'elle percevait. Une fois l'usine fermée, elle s'est lancé dans le petit commerce, puis après elle est devenue cliente de PAIDEK grâce à l'orientation qu'elle a reçue de ses amies. Comme difficultés, elle cite la mévente, la baisse du prix et parfois l'arrivée tardive de marchandises car elle va s'approvisionne en Ouganda. Elle a comme voeux le progrès de son activité, la construction d'une maison en matériaux durables et la garantie de la scolarité de son enfant. De gauche à droite, Béatrice est en deuxième position sur la photo, habillée en blouse multicolore parmi laquelle la couleur noire.
texts.en:
As an employee in her father's soap factory, Béatrice was able to put aside a small amount of savings from her salary. Once the factory closed, she got into small scale commerce, and then she became a client of PAIDEK, thanks to information she got from her friends.

As challenges, she mentions poor sales, falling prices, and sometimes the late arrival of merchandise because she goes to stock up in Uganda. Her hopes are to see progress in her business, to build a concrete house, and to guarantee her child's school fees.

From left to right, Béatrice is the second person in the photo, wearing a multicolored blouse trimmed with black.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale: flour, salt, shoes, and cookies.

loans.name: Mikalu

texts.en:
Mikalu is a maize farmer from Tashar Kashin Miya village. As a Babban Gona member, Mikalu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Mikalu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Mikalu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mikalu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Mikalu plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en:
Suleman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Suleman has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Suleman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Suleman can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
 
As a Babban Gona member, Suleman will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Suleman is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Adamu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Adamu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora, a sus sesenta y cinco años de edad, no se cansa de trabajar duro para que su pulpería cada día crezca un poco más.
