Gracias a la confianza que ha depositado en MiCrédito y Kiva, Elena ha logrado fortalecerse como comerciante, por lo cual está profundamente agradecida. 
Ella ha recurrido a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para comprar grandes cantidades de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, entre otros granos básicos que en esta temporada del año tienen gran demanda. En un futuro desea poder optar a otro financiamiento para comprar freezeres congelantes de carnes producto que aún no ofrece en su negocio.
texts.en:
Elena is a very strong, hard working woman who, at the age of 75, never tires of putting in the hard work needed to expand her grocery store a little every day. Thanks to the trust she has placed in MiCrédito and Kiva, Elena has grown as a businesswoman and she is profoundly grateful for that.

She has requested a loan from Kiva together with MiCrédito to buy large quantities of rice, beans, sugar and corn as well as other basic foodstuffs which are in high demand this season. In the future she would like to be able to request another loan to buy meat freezers as she still does not offer that product in her business.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of rice, beans, sugar and corn as well as other basic foodstuffs.

loans.name: Shitu

texts.en:
Shitu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shitu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Shitu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Shitu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Shitu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and his family members, and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en:
Meswalehe is a married woman with four children, all of whom do not attend school because they are all grown-ups. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation.

Meswalehe operates a coconut business, selling at the market to hotel owners and anyone else. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase more coconut supplies for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut supplies for resale.

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en:
Buhari is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Buhari has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Buhari would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Buhari can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Buhari will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Buhari is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Rikochi village. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yakubu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yakubu hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tsotso Group

texts.fr: Travaillant pour une tierce personne pendant sept ans, j'ai fait des économies à partir du salaire que je percevais. Ainsi, je me suis lancée dans le commerce des poissons; y est associé les souliers voyant que cette activité ne marchait plus bien grâce au conseil d'une amie." Telles sont les déclarations de Jeannette. Comme obstacle à son activité, elle cite le vol de l'argent et de marchandises lorsqu'il y a afflux de clients devant le dépôt et la perte lorsqu'il y a baisse du prix. Elle souhaite mieux s'organiser grâce à cette activité en scolarisant et nourrissant  ses enfants orphelins. Jeannette est habillée en boubou mauve sur la photo.
texts.en:
"Having worked for someone else for seven years, I was able to put aside savings from my salary. Thus I got into selling fish. Thanks to the advice I received from a friend, seeing that that business was not doing well, I added the sale of shoes." These are the words of Jeannette.

As challenges to her business, she mentioned the theft of money and merchandise when there are a lot of customers in front of the depot, and also the loss experienced when prices fall. She hopes to be able to get organized better thanks to this business, so she can pay school fees and feed her orphaned children. Jeannette is wearing a purple boubou (loose African dress) in the photo.

loans.use: to buy shoes and fish for resale.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон простой и образованный человек. Он житель района Рудаки. Ему 54 лет. Абдурахмон мечтал стать учителем. Ему нравиться преподавать и обучить детей. Абдурахмон 26 лет работает учителем в школе. Он  преподает литературу и национального таджикского языка.  У Абдурахмон есть двое детей. У него одна дочка и один сын. Его сын учится в университете. Дочка учится в средней школе. Сам Абдурахмон родился и вырос в семье образованных людей. Его обучали и воспитали хорошо. И Абдурахмон тоже хочет, чтобы его дети обучали и стали образованными. Абдурахмон просит кредит для оплаты договора за обучения сына. У него возникли финансовые проблемы. Ему не хватает денег и решил, взят кредит. С такими планами Абдурахмон обратился к Вам за кредитом.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon is a simple and educated man. He is 54 and a resident of the Rudaki region. He always dreamed of becoming a teacher as he likes to teach and educate children. For 26 years he has been working as a teacher in a school, teaching literature and the Tajik language. He has two children, a daughter and a son. His son is a university student and his daughter is in high school. 

Abdurahmon was born and raised in a family of educated people who taught and raised him well. He also wants his children to become educated. He is requesting a loan to pay his son's tuition. He has had financial problems and doesn't have enough money, and so he decided to take out a loan. With this plans, Abdurahmon is turning to you for a loan.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy used her previous loan for 17,000 PHP to purchase higher volumes of fish and seafood in different varieties. As a result, it enhanced her earnings and provided for her family’s daily expenses and her children’s educational needs. 

Nancy plans to improve her business further and requested another loan for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy different varieties of fish and seafood to sell. She also plans to replace the old motor of her fishing boat with a new one so that it can function more efficiently and provid her higher profit, paving the way for her children’s completed education.

Nancy has been consistent in repaying her previous loan and she maintains her good record. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase different varieties of fish and seafood to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Batoma est une éleveuse malienne qui achète et vend les moutons. Elle est âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants âgé respectivement de 16 à 29. Trois de ses enfants sont inscrits à l’école. C’est elle qui est assise en tenant le mouton, elle n’est pas instruite. Son mari cultive le mil pour la nourriture de la famille. Femme courageuse Batoma cherche le financement au RMCR en vue d’acheter plus de moutons pour son activité.
Elle exerce l’élevage depuis plus de 6 ans, Batoma fait ses achats et ses ventes aux marchés locaux de Ntogonasso et Kimparana. Son bénéfice prévisionnel peut atteindre 60 000 FCFA par mois ce qui  lui permettent d’assurer les charges de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Batoma comes from Mali and buys and sells sheep. She is 56, married, and the mother of five children aged from 16 to 29. Three of her children are enrolled in school. She is the woman who is sitting, holding the sheep; she is illiterate. Her husband grows millet to feed the family.

A courageous woman, Batoma is asking RMCR for a loan to buy sheep for her business. She has been doing livestock-raising for more than six years. She buys and sells her sheep in local markets in Ntogonasso et Kimparana. Her estimated profit can amount to 60,000 FCFA per month, which allows her to cover family expenses and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to raise sheep for resale.

loans.name: Bhanupriya

texts.en:
Bhanupriya is a 42-year-old widow from a small town of Keonjhar, Odisha, India. Bhanupriya has been living permanently in this area for the last 35 years. Her husband was managing a shop for 10 years, and five years ago, her husband passed away in an accident in front of his own shop.

She has three sons living with her. Out of her three sons, one is married. One son is employed in a private company in Rourkela, and the youngest one is still continuing his studies.

Bhanupriya is a lady with sheer determination and confidence. After the sad demise of her husband at a very young age, she took up the whole financial burden of her family on her own shoulders. She has been running her mobile repairing center for the last five years, along with with which she has kept a refrigerator in her shop where she has beverages, frozen snacks and semi-processed food items to serve her customers.

She is requesting a loan amount of 20,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to renovate her shop and add more racks so as to make the display of her shop more appealing. With the other part of the loan amount, she will purchase additional snacks items for her customers.

Subsequently, the loan amount will help Bhanupriya to get a higher return on her investments and increase her customer base.

Bhanupriya is eagerly awaiting your generous hearts to help her.

loans.use: to renovate her shop and add more racks so as to make the display of her shop more appealing, and to purchase additional snack items.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel lives in Maubesse. He saw that every day, many people always buy some goods in the market, so he had an idea to open his store in that place. So now he is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve his business.

He is taking this loan because he wants to add it with his working capital to buy additional supplies to keep in his store, including cooking oils, Aqua, biscuits, noodles, bandaged, milk, sardines, sweets, lighters, and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

Manuel has been involved in business activities since a few years ago; he started with his own working capital of $500. He is earning a good income from his business because many people like to buy, so he is still happy to do business. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, he hopes to run his business into a bigger store.

He also has animals like cows, pigs, and dogs.

loans.use: to buy cooking oils, Aqua, biscuits, noodles, bandages, milk, sardines, sweets, lighters, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is a married mother of four children, all of whom don't attend school because they are all grown-ups. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation.

For over ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to the general public. She faces a major challenge of transportation to various markets. She dreams of expanding her business and hiring an employee in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and lessos (African cloth) for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes, lessos (African cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children. He cooperates with his wife to enhance their family’s financial situation and satisfy their life requirements. He owns a restaurant in his town and, as for his wife, she owns a clothes shop. 

Due to the bad financial situation he is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his children's education fees. What makes him very happy is that he will able to secure them a brilliant future.

loans.use: to pay his children's education fees.

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
A positive outlook in life sustains Procesa in her personal and family life, including management of her small general store. Despite being a widow, she shows her toughness by providing for her children’s needs and education. She continues to find ways on how to make her store more competitive. She aims to widen her inventory, but she lacks the needed capital.

Procesa aspires to sell more quantities of grocery items and beverages; this is why she seeks your kindness to lend her PHP 15,000 financial assistance. Her profit and savings from these will pave the way towards her dream of experiencing a better life in the future. It’s her little consolation after working really hard in raising her now grown-up children.

She constantly prays for good health, peace and happiness for her and her children. She’s a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. The organization has been operating in that area for many years and has established several fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

Procesa constantly attends her group fellowship every Thursday because she gets inspiration from the sharing of testimonies and the study of the Bible.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of grocery items and beverages.

loans.name: Rocrisma

texts.en:
Like other entrepreneurs, Rocrisma dreams of having a more stable and competitive business that will bring her a more affordable living condition someday. To fast track this, she manages her current business with passion and diligence. From a small sari-sari six years ago, she has developed it into a mini-grocery and added rice in her inventory. Recently, she availed herself of a loan that was faithfully paid back. With the given amount of PHP 30,000 she was able to supply her store with additional grocery items and sacks of rice that she sold for additional income. 

To continue the improvement of her current inventory, she would like to request for PHP 30,000 loan for the second time. Again, she will use it to buy a larger volume of merchandise products and sacks of rice. If granted, this will be a good opportunity for her to gain better profit and ease her financial burden as a widow. 

For now, she would like to give you her sincerest thanks. 

She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of merchandise products and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Nahaly

texts.en:
Nahaly is thankful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan which she used to purchase various grocery items, toiletries, and canned goods for her store. These additional supplies enabled her to attract more customers, and her earnings helped meet her daily living expense. She has added some amount in her savings for emergency purposes.

This time, she would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan which she will use again to buy more grocery items, dry goods, and beverages. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her. 

Nahaly dreams of having a bigger General Store someday. She prays that God will continue to bless her and her child with good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies. All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, dry goods, and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Tuzobaho Group

texts.fr:
Fidèle fait partie du groupe  Tuzobaho  et  habite à  Ngozi. Il a 33 ans et est marie a Joselyne, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1 mois a 8 ans dont 2 étudient. 

 Il fait  le commerce du haricot,du riz,…dans sa boutique  depuis  9 ans. 

Il est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande de haricot et de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Fidèle, age 33,  is a member of Tuzobaho Group who lives in Ngozi. He is married to Joselyne, a merchant. Together they have three children, age 1 month to 8 years. Two of them go to school.

For the past nine years, Fidèle has been selling beans, rice, etc, in his shop. He is seeking his third loan from Kiva's partner, Turame.

He will use this loan to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of beans and rice to resell, in order to earn more.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans and rice

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry, aged 23, is a very optimistic man who does not want to blame his future on failure to attend school due to his parents' inability to raise school fees.

He rides a motorcycle; he started by riding his boss’s motorcycle, to whom he would remit 80 percent of his earnings. Later, he bought his own, and this has helped him earn more income.

With the proceeds, he has been able to start constructing his own residential house. Henry is in need of a loan to buy iron sheets to roof his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof his house.

loans.name: Immaculee Group

texts.fr: Vivant dans un foyer où son époux préférait travailler seul, Immaculée a été guidée par une de ses cousines afin de la permettre de participer et s'impliquer dans l'économie familiale. Malgré la petitesse de son capital, elle espère avoir un fond de roulement assez consistant pour lui permettre de bien gagner sa vie, prendre soin de sa famille et acheter une grande parcelle pour y construire. Sur photo, Immaculée est habillée en blouse blanche et bleue.
texts.en:
Since his husband prefers to work on his own, Immaculée followed the guidance of one of her cousins in order to get involved in covering the family's expenses.

Even though she doesn't have much money, she hopes that her working capital is enough to enable her to earn a living, provide for her family, and buy a big lot of constructible land.

In the photograph, Immaculée is wearing a white and blue blouse.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear closing to resell

loans.name: Emadolin

texts.en:
As a member of Center for Community Transformation for more than six years, Emadolin has received a number of loans from the cooperative in the past. It greatly sustained her variety store business and helped cover her daily household and personal needs. Despite her status as single, she feels a sense of fulfillment that she is able to provide assistance to her siblings, nephews, and nieces.

When CCT partnered with Kiva, it gave her better chances to avail higher loans that will further improve her business. Recently, her requested loan of 15,000 PHP was granted and went a long way. She bought more dry goods and grocery items, which she sold for additional profits.   

This time she's positive that you will trust her again. She's seeking for another 15,000 PHP loan to procure more quantities of groceries and cases of beverages. She puts forth her best effort to give the best service to her loyal and increasing customers. She thanks God for Kiva and CCT, and for using them as instruments to assist small business owners like her. 

Emadolin continues to meet up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to procure more quantities of groceries and cases of beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Galagaza Group

texts.en:
Juma, who is in his mid 30's, is married with two children that go to school. He has been running a general store for four years now. He works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Juma's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase items in the general store inventory and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loans and appreciates KIVA for the support of their group which is doing great now. He used the profit to pay school fees, loan payments, and household expenses. He will use this loan to increase shop inventory to meet his customers' demand. He dreams of expanding his business. 

Juma will share this loan with his loan group "GALAGAZA," which has two members who will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory to meet his customers' demand at his store.

loans.name: Gneta Group

texts.fr:
Zeny est malien âgé de 60 ans,marié père de cinq (05) enfants, quatre  garçons(04) et une (01) fille, âgée respectivement de 07 à 27 ans dont deux(02) garçons vont à l’école.
Il est au centre de la photo avec le bélier et la chèvre.Zeny est l’honnête  digne et courageux dans son travail d’élevage bélier et chèvre.Sa femme fait des petits commerces du condiment (piment, magie, oignon, huile, le sel et le soumbala) ces bénéfices lui  permet de subvenir ces besoin nécessaire (habillement, chaussure et la sante). Zeny a suivi une formation au centre d’alphabétisation de son localité.Il a quatre ans (04) ans d’expérience dans sn l’activité d’élevage il n’a jamais eu de problème de remboursement avec le RMCR. Ses achats et les ventes se font à une grande foire non loin de son village.Le prêt lui permet d’acheté un (01) bélier et un (01) chèvre pour son élevage, et son bénéfice mensuel prévisionnel peut atteindre 17500 FCFA par mois ce qui lui permettra d’assuré  la santé, l’éducation et l’alimentation de ses enfants. Il rêve d’élever beaucoup de béliers et de chèvres dans les jours a venir
texts.en:
Zeny comes from Mali and is aged 60, married, and the father of five children, four boys and one girl, aged from 7 to 27. Two of the boys attend school.

Zeny is in the center of the photo with a ram and a goat. He is honest, worthy, and courageous in his work raising sheep and goats. His wife is engaged in buying and selling condiments: hot peppers, Maggi, onions, oil, salt, and soumbala. The profit allows her to cover certain necessities (clothing, shoes, and healthcare.)

Zeny took classes to learn to read and write at a center in his locality. He has been raising livestock for four years and he has never had a problem reimbursing RMCR. He makes his sales and purchases at a big fair not far from his village.

This loan will permit him to buy one ram and one goat for his livestock-raising business. His monthly profit may attain 17,500 FCFA which will allow him to ensure healthcare, education and food for his children. He dreams of raising a lot of rams and goats in the future.

loans.use: to raise sheep and goats.

loans.name: Martinho

texts.en:
Martinho is businessman. He saw that many people buy goods in the market every day, so he had the idea to open his store there. Now he is applying for a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve his business. He is taking this loan because he wants to add to his working capital to buy more supplies to keep in his store, including Gillette, cooking oils, water, biscuits, noodles, milks, sardines, sweets, lighters, and other things to sell.

Martinho has been involved in business activities since 2014, when he started with his own working capital of $400.00. He is earning a good income from his business because many people like to buy his goods, so he is still happy to do his business. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, he hopes to turn his business into a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy Gillette, cooking oils, water, biscuits, noodles, milks, sardines, sweets, lighters, soft drinks, and hard drinks for his store.

loans.name: Mworra Catholic Twetungure Group

texts.en:
Hope is a hardworking, 35-year-old married mother with six children. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. She carries out the buying and selling of fresh foods, especially tomatoes, as a main business. She also supplements her income with coffee growing and selling to earn extra money for her family. She started this business eleven years ago with the intention of growing her earnings and taking good care of her family.

In the future, Hope wishes to expand her tomato business so as to realize more profits and educate her children, but she faces challenges of bad debtors, weather changes, and a high rate of competition. This limits her stock turnover and the productivity of her business.

Hope seeks financial support from Kiva through Hofokam Limited to buy more tomatoes to sell. She is a member of Mworra Catholic Group, where members guarantee each other for loan accessibility in groups without pledging security.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is 38 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband represents the income source in the family in order to fulfill their family needs and improve their lifestyle. He owns a mini market in their town. Ghada does not work. 

Ghada requested a loan from Vitas s.a.l., which she will use to pay the school fees for her child so that she has a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her child

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is married. He does tailoring for a living and has been in business for fifteen years. He also practices agriculture for food security and commercial purposes. He is doing fairly well, though he lacks improved agricultural methods so that he can perform better and yield a lot in terms of harvests. He desires to have a tailoring school and educate his community, since he has reaped tangible benefits from this business. 

Noah is now requesting money to buy pesticides for his garden; being a rainy season, crops are much affected.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his garden.

loans.name: Wilmer Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil casado su esposa realiza quehaceres del hogar tiene dos hijos Maylen de 3 años e Isaih de 5 meses de edad permanecen junto a sus padres , desde muy pequeño su papa le enseño a comprar pequeños  terneros alimentarlos, darles vitaminas esperar a que crezcan para obtener algo de dinero y poder satisfacer las principales necesidades, hoy Alejandro requiere el dinero para comprar una vacona que a futuro le daría leche obtendría un ingreso con el que podrá seguir pagando los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 31 years old. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. He has two children who live with them, Maylen who is 3 years old and Isaih who is 5 months old.

When he was very young his father taught him to buy young cattle, feed them and give them vitamins, and then wait for them to grow to get some money to cover their basic needs. Now Alejandro needs the money to buy a cow who will be able to provide milk in the future. He would gain income from this to continue covering his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Abatoy

texts.ru: Абатой проживает на районе Хуросон. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж работает заграницей. У них пятеро детей. Абатой занимается животноводческой деятельности и земледелием параллельно. У нее не большое количество скотин. Она хочет изменить ситуацию. Она планирует расширить деятельность, приобрести еще пару голов скотов и увеличить доходность. У Абатой не хватает не большой суммы денег, чтобы совершить покупку, и она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Abatoy lives in the Khuroson region. She is 49 years old and married. Her husband works abroad. They have five children.

Abatoy works with livestock breeding and in parallel with field crop cultivation. She has a small number of livestock. She would like to change the situation. She plans to expand her business and purchase more livestock to increase her income. Abatoy does not have enough money to make this purchase and she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock

loans.name: Fayziniso

texts.ru: Файзинисо талантливая девушка из Бохтарского района. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. Она живет с родителями, братом и его женой. Файзинисо умная и целеустремленная девушка. Она учится в Кургантюбинском Государственном Университете по специальности юрист-психолог. Файзинисо нужно оплатить за договор в Университете, однако у её родителей нет достаточно денег, и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Так как Файзинисо уже на последнем курсе, она не хочет быть отчисленной и остаться без работы. Файзинисо мечтает, что она станет хорошим специалистом и будет помогать родителям. Пожалуйста, помогите Файзинисо.
texts.en:
Fayziniso is a talented girl from the Bohtar region. She is 21 years old and not married. She lives with her parents, brother and sister-in-law. Fayziniso is a smart and purposeful girl. She studies at the Kurgan-Tyube State University, specializing in law and psychology. 

Fayziniso needs to pay her university tuition. However, her parents do not have enough money, and she decided to apply for a loan. As Fayziniso is already in her last year, she would not like to drop out and be without work. Fayziniso dreams of becoming a good specialist and help her parents. Please help Fayziniso.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Ulan

texts.ru: Улан успешно погасил свой кредит, он очень благодарен Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог в финансировании. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Улан вновь обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена в качестве корма для скота. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Ulan successfully repaid his loan and he is very thankful to Kiva and all those who helped him with the financing. He has four cows, ten sheep and two horses on his farm. 

With an aim to further develop his business, Ulan again turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase hay to use as livestock feed. He plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing his business and in building a livestock barn.

loans.use: to purchase hay to use as livestock feed, in order to invest in his business

loans.name: Sopeak's Group

texts.en:
Sopeak’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sopeak makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a doctor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and the woman to safeguard the health of their families. They will save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Serypeap's Group

texts.en:
Serypeap’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia.

Serypeap makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia.

Savy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Evelyn Consuelo

texts.es:
Evelyn, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y viven junto a una hija que depende totalmente de ellos.

Evelyn, trabaja en una colegio cristiano desde hace dos años, ahí es la encargada de cuidar a los niños de kinder, pero aparte de eso también cría cerdos en el patio de su casa, los cuales vende cuando tienen el peso adecuado.

Evelyn, necesita el préstamo para comprar 4 cerdos pequeños y concentrado para engordarlos. 

Evelyn, sueña con ver que su hijos se superen y lleguen a ser profesionales y sean un ejemplo para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 25, is a very hard-working woman. Her partner works in agriculture, they live together with a daughter who is completely dependent on them.

Evelyn has worked in a Christian school for two years, where she takes care of the children in kindergarten. Aside from this, he also raises pigs in her yard at home, which she sells once they weigh enough. Evelyn needs the loan to buy four piglets and feed to fatten them.

Evelyn dreams of seeing her children succeed and grow up to be professionals, so they can be a positive example for society.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Bibikiz

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Бибикиз. Она мать троих детей. У нее одна дочка и два сына. Детям 14, 20 и 22 года. Бибикиз после окончания школы вышла замуж. После замужества она научилась шить и кроить у свекровью.  Она быстра, освоила все навыки шитья. И сидя дома начала зарабатывать на жизнь. Бибикиз заботливая и жизнелюбивая мать. Она помогает детям в учебе, и обеспечить их хорошо. Бибикиз решила взять кредит и оплатить договор за обучения сына. Его старший сын учиться в университете. Без оплаты его исключать с университета. Бибикиз этого не хочет, она хочет, чтобы  его дети учились. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Бибикиз просит кредит. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This woman is called Bibikiz. She is the mother of three children. She has one daughter and two sons. The children are 14, 20 and 22 years old. After finishing school, Bibikiz got married. After her marriage, she learned to sew and cut from her mother-in-law. She quickly mastered the art of sewing and started earning money for living from her home. 

Bibikiz is a loving and active mother. She helps her children with their studies and supports them well. Bibikiz decided to take a loan and pay for her son's tuition. Her eldest son is in university. If they don't pay he will be expelled. Bibikiz does not want this, she wants her children to study. Due to a lack of  money she requests a loan. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition

loans.name: María De La Paz

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, estudió hasta primer año de bachillerato, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran viviendo en Estados Unidos y una hija que recientemente inició el viaje en busca del “sueño americano” y que aún no se sabe mucho, con ella solo viven los otros dos hijos, de los cuales uno trabaja vendiendo pan de forma ambulante y el otro sufre de problemas mentales y no puede trabajar.

María, se dedica a la venta de especias como canela, pimienta, comino, orégano y cebada; ella aprendió a preparar especias cuando tenía 21 años de edad y trabajó para otra persona; después de dos años de trabajar ahí decidió elaborar las especies de forma independiente; ahora sale a venderlo de forma ambulante en los diferentes caseríos y cantones cercanos a la ciudad.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar las especias y así aprovechar la época de fin para vender más y obtener buenas ganancias.

María, sueña con tener un pozo en su casa y no depender del agua de un vecino, que es el que proporciona el agua a todos los de la comunidad.
texts.en:
María, 55 years old, went to school up to the first year of high school. She is a single mother of 5 children. Two of them live in the United States and one daughter has recently begun her journey in search of the "American dream". Not much has been heard from her yet. Only her two other children live with her. One of them works as a street vendor selling bread and the other has mental problems and can not work.

María sells barley and spices such as cinnamon, pepper, cumin, oregano. She learned to prepare spices when she was 21 years old and worked for another person. After two years of working there she decided to produce spices on her own. Now she works as a street vendor selling spices in the various villages and cantons near the city.

María needs the loan to buy the materials to produce the spices and thus take advantage of the end-of-year season to sell more and make good earnings.

María dreams of having a well in her home and not depending on water from a neighbor who is the one to provide water to the whole community.

loans.use: to buy the materials to produce spices and take advantage of the end-of-year season to sell more.

loans.name: Suth's Group

texts.en:
Suth’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia.

Suth makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Молодая 20 летняя девушка из района Хуросон по имени Шахноза. Шахноза собирается выйти замуж. Она живет вместе с мамой. Мама занимается продажей овощей. Шахноза принимает заказы на шитье национальной одежды. Конечно, клиентов у нее не много и она шьет за не большие деньги. Она не жалуется на маленький доход, ведь она только пока она повышает свое мастерство и набирает опыт. 
  Шахноза и после замужества продолжить свою работу. Но на данный момент все ее мысли занимает только ее свадьба. Конечно, провести свадьбу это расходы и для покрытия расходов Шахноза обратилась за кредитом. Шахноза надеется, что станет красивой невестой и ее свадьбе пройдет как в ее мечтах.
texts.en:
This young girl of 20 years is from the region Khuroson, and is called Shahnoza. She has decided to get married. She lives together with her mother. Her mother works with selling vegetables. Shahnoza takes orders for sewing traditional clothing. Of course she doesn't have many customers, and she sews for a small fee. She is not sad about the small income, because it is only until she improves her skills and gain experience. 

After her marriage, Shahnoza will continue her work. However currently all her mind is only occupied with the marriage. Holding a wedding is of course expensive, and to cover all expenses Shahnoza applied for a loan. She hopes that she will be a beautiful bride and that her wedding will be as in her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her wedding

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, vive con sus hijos, de los cuales los mayores le poyan con ingresos económicos para cubrir las necesidades de toda la familia, pues ella manifiesta no tener ayuda de parientes en el extranjero, el negocio de María es atender una venta de verduras, cuenta con cinco años de experiencia, de la cual obtiene ingresos considerables los cuales son su respaldo para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Con el capital podrá comprar papas, tomates, ejotes, pipianes, remolachas, chiles, etc., la finalidad de la inversión es ofrecer producto fresco y atender a nuevos clientes, María espera poder aumentar el flujo  de ventas y tener estabilidad en sus ingresos para cubrir necesidades básicas de su familia.
Ella tiene como objetivo continuar luchando por salir adelante junto a su familia y lograr guiar a sus hijos por el camino del bien.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her children. Two of the children are now adults and support their mother with an income to help cover the families' necessities. Maria does not have any relatives living abroad.

Maria has a business selling vegetables. She has five years' experience and earns a good income, which she uses to pay for necessities.

Maria will use this loan in order to buy potatoes, tomatoes, green beans, cucumber, cabbage, chilies, and more; this investment will allow her to offer fresh products and work with new customers. Maria hopes to increase sales and have a stable income to pay for necessities for her family.

Maria's goal is to continue working hard in order to move forward with her family and to guide her children along a path of good life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, green beans, cucumber, cabbage, chilies, and more; this investment will allow her to offer fresh products and work with new customers.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is maize farmer from Rukku village. As a member of Babban Gona, Abubakar is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Abubakar is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sabiu

texts.en:
Sabiu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sabiu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Sabiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sabiu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Sabiu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Sabiu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Chanorn's Group

texts.en:
Chanorn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chanorn makes a living cultivating rice  to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta is sixty years old and she cooks and sells food at her street stand. Asunta has her own house and she is married. Her husband is a mason. Asunta also has a son.

Asunta needs a loan to fix her house because the place is old and the rain is ruining the walls. Asunta works hard and she hopes you will trust her again

loans.use: to fix her house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 33 years old supporting 3 people in her family.

She sells greengroceries , a business she has been doing for the last 17 years and gets a monthly income of Kes 18000.

She has applied for her third loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more stock of fresh groceries for resale.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fresh groceries for resale

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 29 years old married to Elkana and blessed with two children aged 15 and 8 years old.

She has been into restaurant business for ten years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 9000. This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more bales of baking flour, sugar, bar soaps and cooking fat for the restaurant.

She anticipates to help the husband in paying school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

Her dream is to have a big hotel in town that is stable.

loans.use: to buy more bales of baking flour, sugar, bar soaps and cooking fat for the restaurant.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her raising pig.

Mercedita dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sani is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Sani will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Sani now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Don Ronald es un agricultor muy esforzado que se dedica al cultivo y venta de plátano, actividad en la cual posee amplia experiencia. Solicita un préstamo de ochocientos mil colones (₡ 800 000), para la compra de abonos, insumos agrícolas, semilla, así como el pago de mano de obra, esto con el propósito de mejorar su plantación y generar mayores ingresos económicos familiares.
texts.en: Ronald is a hardworking and experienced farmer who grows and sells plantains. He is requesting a loan of 800,000 Costa Rican colones to buy fertilizers, agricultural supplies, seeds, and to pay for labor, which would help improve his crops and generate a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies for his plantain crops.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Fe y Esperanza, es un grupo nuevo, donde ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde 5 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Abelina, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre trabaja y se esfuerza por sus seres queridos. Ella pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando poco a poco y lo hace a través de la venta de ropas.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, quiere comprar remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones, blusas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group is named Fe y Esperanza [Faith and Hope]. It is a new group where they are in the Poverty Stoplight program, and 5 of the members find themselves below the poverty line; in other words, in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Abelina, who is the president of the group. She is a hardworking person that always works and strives for her loved ones. She makes her greatest effort to be able to improve little by little, and she does this by selling clothes.

She is requesting this loan to buy various clothing items, and thus be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She wants to buy T-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants, blouses, and other items so she can continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as T-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants, blouses, and other items.

loans.name: Latifeh

texts.en:
Latifeh is a 48-year-old, Lebanese widow and mother of three children, two of them are still studying school. Her oldest child is the main source income of the family after the death of his father, and he work hard to satisfy their life requirement. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family members.

Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her children’s educational fees. She tends to help them and to provide them with a good education. This is her first loan and she wants to express her thanks for it

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer from Galadima Mayau village. As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Bitrus can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Bitrus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Bitrus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 62 años de edad está casado, vive en el campo  su esposa realiza quehaceres domésticos en su  hogar, luego de trabajar muchos años al jornal se fue aprender cerrajería sin obtener ningún salario hace 20 años atrás decidió abrir su propio y pequeño taller de cerrajería en su casa para estar cerca de su familia, Manuel  necesita el dinero para comprar materia prima realizando puertas, ventanas, generando mejores ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
texts.en:
Manuel is 62 years old, married, and resides in the countryside. His wife devotes her time to domestic chores in the home.

After struggling every day for many years, Manuel went off to learn the locksmith trade without earning a salary. Then, about 20 years ago, he decided to open his own small metalworking shop in his home, in order to be near his family.

Now, Manuel needs funds in order to purchase the primary materials required to make doors and windows, so that he can generate better income and pay for basic household necessities.

loans.use: purchase primary materials needed for making doors and windows.

loans.name: Zapaniya

texts.en:
Zapaniya is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Zapaniya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

loans.name: Bunsreng

texts.en:
BunSreng, a 44-year-old father of three children, lives in Kang Meas District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.

To make a living, he and his wife work as farmers in a small rice field which is located a little bit far from their house. So far, it is more than ten years that he and his wife have been involved in this farming business. Both of them can earn a net profit of 8 USD per day.

BunSreng wants to increase the convenience of his life by having a motorbike for daily use in his family. Now he is borrowing a loan from HKL to buy a motorbike to ride to his rice field. He would like to thank all lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Alhaji Tsalha

texts.en:
Alhaji Tsalha is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Tsalha has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji Tsalha can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Tsalha will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Tsalha is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married and blessed with four children who go to school. They all live in a five-bedroom house in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. The fact that she was unable to acquire a basic education because she did not go to school has made life very difficult for Martha.
It is difficult for her to feed and educate her children.

Martha was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her friends and relatives who have been GHAPE members since 2004. She thinks her business will succeed because a wonderful experience developed, and certainly because of the availability of capital.

With the new loan requested Martha will buy cocoa, coffee, and drinks, and it will actively help the community in that it will reduce the distance to market to them.

Martha has successfully borrowed and repaid loans seven times. The profit from this loan helps her pay for her children's school fees and provides basic food for her family. She plans to reinvest and plough back her profit by buying more inventories.

Martha knows her business is going to succeed and she prefers a loan from GHAPE because she has acquired some basic training in finance management, low interest rate, and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy cocoa, coffee, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 28 years old, married, and she lived in Solana with her spouse. She manages a retail store for income. She sells grocery items to the people in her village.

Elvira wanted to improve her sales and profits in order to satisfy demands of her customers. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy canned goods, bread, eggs, softdrinks, and soap to sell.

In the future, Elvira hopes to continue managing good business and save profits for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 25-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children, who are still studying.

Her husband has operated a mini-market for 11 years. He is a very hard worker and does not tire of work, with the aim to develop it and benefit from it. As for her, she doesn’t work, she is only dedicated to her home and kids.

Today, she is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her child’s school fees. What makes her very happy is that she will be able to secure a brilliant future for him.

loans.use: to pay her child’s school fees.

loans.name: Nsene

texts.en:
Nsene is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Nsene has operated a coconut business for over four years now, selling at the market to buyers at Mombasa market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her aspirations are to open a green grocer in future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more coconut supplies for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut supplies for resale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a forty three year old, hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is physically powerful, energetic and works long hours throughout the week to look after his family.

Alex has been in the livestock business for 8 years to earn returns for his family. He also sells concrete and carries out farming business to make sure his family gets the best standard of living. He dreams of having diversified sources of income, and expanded businesses but his main challenge is inadequate capital to do so.

Alex is requesting a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

loans.name: Segundo Humberto

texts.es: Humberto tiene 46 años de edad,  de estado civil casado tiene dos hijos, Johana de 17 años de edad y Alex de 15 años de edad ellos estudian en instituciones gratuitas del sector,  hace más de 20 años vino al país  en calidad de refugiado buscando trabajo y tranquilidad desde ese entonces se ha dedicado a sembrar cebolla, papas, maíz encontrando en este pequeño negocio una fuente de ingresos para sustentar a  su familia. Humberto necesita el dinero para comprar abono así mejorando su producción obteniendo ingresos para cubrir los principales gastos de su familia.
texts.en: Humberto is 46 years old, married with two children; Johana who is 17 and Alex 15. They attend the local state school. More than 20 years ago he came to the county a refugee in search of work and peace. He has made a living since then growing onions, potatoes and maize. This small business generates an income that provides for his family. Humberto needs the money to buy fertilizer to improve his crops which generate an income to meet his family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve production.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en: Sopheak’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sopheak makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.
