loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio is the owner of his house, he is married for 10 years to his wife. Julio sells milk and he also works as a teacher at the school of his community.

Julio needs a loan to buy a milking cow Julio has great plans for the future, as he will buy a car to transport his milk to many places. Julio hopes you can help him, because he and his wife work hard and they have experience

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Carla Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Carla Gabriela de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos, es natural de la ciudad de Tarija, es una joven aspirante que gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación pudo concluir sus estudios como agronoma, hoy desea implementar media hectárea de producción de terreno de producción de Vid de variedad moscatel para poder mejorar sus ingresos.
Es así que ella sigue capacitándose en el área agrícola, cuenta con un certificado técnico en viticultura que Vid realizando con el fin especializarse en la producción de este fruto.
Ella aspira con el tiempo a comprar mas terrenos agrícolas y de esta forma incrementar su producción de este emprendimiento  que piensa llevarlo a cabo gracias al conocimiento adquirido hasta el momento y de alguna forma mejorar las técnicas que hasta el momento realiza.
Carla gabriela actualmente consultora temporal de un programa que se viene trabajando con la gobernación de Entre Ríos en el área agrícola hace más de tres años, paralelo a esta actividad la señora hace cinco años esta cultivando otras hortalizas en terreno de propiedad de sus padre
texts.en:
Carla Gabriela is single, does not have any children, and is a native of the city of Tarija. She is a young woman that, thanks to hard work and dedication, was able to complete her studies to become an agronomist. Today she wishes to develop a half-hectare of land for the production of grape vines to be able to increase her earnings. It is in this way that she can continue training herself in agriculture. She has a technical certificate in viticulture for the purpose of specializing in the production of this fruit.

She aspires with time to buy more land for agriculture and in this way increase her production in this undertaking, which she believes she will be able to achieve thanks to the knowledge she has obtained and the improvements in technique she has achieved. 

Carla Gabriela has been a temporary consultant for more than three years for a program that works with the government of Entre Rios in the area of agriculture. Along with this activity, she has cultivated vegetables on her father's land for the past five years.

loans.use: for the development of a half-hectare of land to produce grape vines and in this way generate greater economic earnings for herself.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 61 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leonora has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for three years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hansell Dyan

texts.es:
La pasión por la odontología es uno de los fuertes de Hansell, una joven de 24 años de edad, que al sentirse en su sala de odontología siente que está en el lugar indicado y disfruta lo que hace. Ella ya salió de su carrera como Cirujano Dentista y no tardo tiempo en establecer su propia clínica. Ahora tiene seis meses de haberla iniciado y siente que todo va a paso firme.
Hansell cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres y de su hermano, quienes trabajan en empresas privadas y a pesar de que su papá ya no está casado con su madre, él sigue apoyándola con remesas bimensualmente. En estos momentos esta emprendedora siente que debe seguir avanzando con esfuerzo propio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar un sillón dental, puesto que ella empezó alquilándolo debido a los altos costos. En sus planes está seguir trabajando fuerte para hacer más grande su negocio y generar empleos.
texts.en:
Passion for dentistry is one of the strengths of Hansell, a 24 year old young woman. Once you see her in the dentist's room, you can feel that she is in the right place and that she enjoys what she does. 

She has already finished her dental surgery courses and didn't waste time establishing her own clinic. She started it six months ago and feels that everything is going well.

Hansell counts on  the support of her parents and her brother, who work in private businesses and even though her father is not married to her mother, he continues to support her with twice monthly remittances. 

At this time, this entrepreneur feels that she should continue advancing of her own effort, and that's why she's asking for a loan to purchase a dental chair, a workstation that she started renting because of the high costs. Her plans are to continue working hard to make her business bigger and to create employment.

loans.use: to purchase a dental chair.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is married man and has four children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He practices farming where he mainly grows coffee to earn a living, which he has been doing for eight years. He supplements it with piggery to earn extra income. His main challenge is lack of capital. Due to over farming the same piece of land, the soil has lost fertility leading to low returns. 

Gerald requested a loan, which he will use  to buy manure and seedlings for his farm. He dreams of expanding his farm so that he earns more income in order to educate all his children and construct a permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is a hardworking, married man with three children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He carries out cattle fattening as a main basis of earning a living, and with the profits, he has been able to develop himself and look after his family. Apart from that, he also earns more money to support his family from farming.

He has been dealing in the business since 2009 and has a vision of expanding it into a big one. However, he faces challenges like other business people, of inadequate capital plus unpredictable weather changes. With the requested loan, Jonas intends to buy more cows for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Anaam's Group

texts.en:
Anaam and Ramzi are a married couple who have four children to support. Ramzi is a public ‎employee and works as a taekwondo trainer after that, while Anaam is a housewife who looks ‎after the children.
‎
Anaam wanted to make use of her time at home with having a small retail project that she can do ‎at home, and decided to do used clothing sales. Her husband supported the idea and started the ‎project with her by getting connected with clothing distributors.

Now Anaam and Ramzi are ‎requesting a loan to increase the amount of clothes and increase their stock to sell in their ‎neighborhood.‎

loans.use: to increase stocks of used clothes to sell in their ‎neighborhood.

loans.name: Gladis Esperanza

texts.es:
Gladis de 51 años de edad no posee ningún tipo de nivel académico ya que por recursos económicos no pudo estudiar, actualmente está casada y sus hijos ya no viven en su casa y su esposo se dedica a trabajos agrícolas.

Gladis, desde que estaba muy joven ayudaba a su madre a trabajar en la agricultura, luego cuando se casó ayudaba a su esposo con los trabajos agrícolas, actualmente posee una pequeña tienda la cual tiene desde hace varios años.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar arroz, frijol, aceite, huevos entre otros productos para surtir su tienda.

El propósito que tiene es  tener más mercadería para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladis is 51 years old.  She does not have any type of academic education, because due to financial reasons she could not get an education.  She is currently married but her children don't live in her house.  Her husband is engaged in agricultural work

Since Gladis was very young she had helped her mother to work in agriculture.  Then when she married she helped her husband with the farm work.  She now owns a small shop, which she has had for some years

The loan she needs is to buy rice, beans, oil, eggs and other products to stock her store.

Her objective is to have more goods in order to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, eggs and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Adurahaman

texts.en:
Adurahaman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adurahaman has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Adurahaman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Adurahaman can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Adurahaman will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Adurahaman is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Saratu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Saratu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Saratu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Saratu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a maize farmer from Gangarida village. As a Babban Gona member, Ado is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ado would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Ado can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ado no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, he hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en:
Mansur is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mansur is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Mansur would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Mansur will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Mansur now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Godlove

texts.en:
Godlove is a married man with five children and lives in a two-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life: the death of his father who was very supportive to him and the family at large, he had a leg fracture complication which almost took his life and led to expenses on medication which almost led to the collapse of his business, his child refused to go to school and preferred strolling around the quarter during school hours, and he has also had to deal with theft of his property.

Godlove has taken and successfully repaid his loan six times and says with this new loan requested, he will buy more piglets, feed, plant plantains on a vast farmland. He will also buy tires, pay for labor, do general repairs on the motor bike, pay for the required documents that will allow the bike to be operated in town, and buy other parts needed for maintenance.

Godlove has a positive view of business, succeeding because he has been doing it for a long time. With this business activity, the community members will be transported to and from their job sites, their farm produces will be transported to the market, and children will be transported to and from school, also manure from pigs will be used for cultivation.

With the profit from this loan, Godlove will improve his family's standard of living by providing them with three meals a day, pay for his family's medication, pay for his children's education, and provide them with other basic necessities. He will also put back some profits into the business and do repairs on his house.

Godlove prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to support his farming and motorcycle service businesses.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 35-year-old Lebanese married mother of two children. She cooperates with her husband to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. She works as a nurse in a hospital in her town since 2011, and her husband he is a car dealer.

Today, Layla is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay school fees for her children. She is very happy that she will be able to ensure a good education for them and that makes her very happy and thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and four children, who are still attending school. She cooperates with her husband to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Her husband has been working in the agriculture field for the past nine years, and Hanaa owns a mini market in town since 2005 in order to earn extra income and be able to support her family financially.

Today, Hanaa is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s school fees. She will be more than happy to see them graduating and achieving their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is a married man with four children and lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He rears cows for fattening and later sells them off. That earns him a living, and he has been in the business for the last nine years. He supplements it with selling hides and skins and works seven days a week.

He started the business purposely to increase his income, look after his family, and pay school fees for his children. He has hopes to expand on his land so as to rear more cows for better yields, though the problem he faces is lack of enough water and pastures for the animals, especially during prolonged droughts. Asaph is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a hardworking married man. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

Fred still carries out farming where he mostly grows sugarcane, which he started so as to improve on his standards of living and pay school fees for his children. He also earns additional income from goat grazing. He hopes to have a big piece of land for improved farming though he is challenged by inadequate capital achieve his goals.

Fred is requesting for a loan to buy more manure for his farm and improve on the soil fertility.

loans.use: to buy manure for his farm.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jessica is 33 years old and both of her children are in school.

Jessica has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like sugar, canned good, noodles and other items to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a forty-six-year-old hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has the responsibility of taking care of his seven children, aged between 20 and 3 years. He also looks after a dependent, who on the side helps him to take care of his cows.

Stephen deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income and has been able to improve on his standards of living and have a better life. He is a lucky man that he also earns a monthly income from being a sub county supervisor with the Electoral Commission. He faces the challenges of inadequate capital and foot-and-mouth diseases that affect his cows. He has a vision of buying more land for better grazing.

Stephen is requesting for a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has nine children, all of whom are grown up. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the irrigation methods she uses in her farming business.

For over ten years, Asha has operated a farming business, selling at the market to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of hiring employees to help in running her business.

With this KSH 50,000 loan, Asha wants to purchase farm inputs: fertilizers and seeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.en:
Victor is 44 years old and lives in the municipality of Sincelejo. He has a son who is 12 years old, and since he was born, he has become the reason to live for this responsible man. Fifteen years ago he decided to start his own business; he fabricates fittings, something he learned by himself and is really good doing it.

He’s asking for a loan so he can buy a soldering machine of better capacity so he can offer better service in his business. He wants to accomplish with this investment optimizing the operation of his business so it can become more productive. He wants also to improve the conditions of his house.

You can be part of Victor’s story just by supporting him with the loan he needs.

loans.use: to buy a soldering machine of better capacity so he can offer better service in his business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old and is a married woman who lives with her husband in the municipality of Sincelejo. Last year, she decided to start her own business because her family is going through some economic issues that she wants to solve. Now she manages a fruit and vegetable store, something she learned thanks to some training she took before.

She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some packages of “ñame" and "yuca” (traditional Colombian tubers), corn and some chili pepper. She hopes that this loan will let her increase her sales and clients so the business can proper. She dreams of paying for her children's education, something that is really important for their future.

Help Rosa to accomplish all her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy some packages of “ñame" and "yuca” (traditional Colombian tubers), corn and some chili pepper.

loans.name: Asosyasyon Men Nan Men(Amm)

texts.en:
Guettie is living in Carrefour and has three children. Since she got married she could not find a job. She then decided to start retailing food.

Thanks to a training she received, she launched a community group to save money. Her group is now two years old. She has successfully put some money apart for her family.

Guettie's group has 23 women and seven men. She was happy to be connected to Fonkoze during the interview for her group application. Like many cooperative Zafen borrowers, Guettie will use the money to buy food products in bulk and sell the products retail to small vendors in flea markets.

Guettie is pictured with four people that compose the committee board (from right to left):Guettie wears a headscarf and is the president. Fitho is the secretary. Romel wears a black shirt and is the treasurer. Yslande is the accountant. Christie is the second accountant (far left).

loans.use: to buy more food products to retail in flea markets.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Phat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ansanm Nou Fo

texts.en:
Myriam is 36 years old and she has three children. She was never employed in any businesses in her life.

To find means to live, she sells homemade drinks to individuals. Three years ago, Myriam took part in a community group of 30 people (22 women and 8 men). They form a Village Savings and Loan Association. Up to now, her group has saved around $800. Myriam is the treasurer of the group. The majority of the women are involved in soft drinks sales because the profit margin is 20% per unit.

In Christmas time, especially until January, Haitian people consume a lot of homemade drinks, especially soft liquors. Therefore, Myriam needs a loan to buy drinks and raw materials to produce them. With the profit, she will save 5% and pay her children's school tuition. That is the case for 50% of the women in Myriam's group.

From left to right, the committee board is as follows:
Eznar wears a sleeveless dress and she is advisor. Guerline is the secretary. Lynce is the deputy advisor. Jonathan is the president and Myriam is the treasurer.

loans.use: help purchase racks of soft drinks to retail.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, who is in her early 70's, is married with four grown up children. She has been running a nursery since 1968 for years now. She works from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 27th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to renovate some classes for her nursery, and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profits to repay the loan, built a class, and covered household expenses.

She really appreciates Kiva's support; her life has changed. With the new credit request, she will use it to open a small stationery shop in her nursery school. She dreams to finish building her place. Juliet will be accountable for paying back the loan as per schedule.

loans.use: to open a small stationery shop in her nursery school.

loans.name: Alisar Suzana

texts.en:
Alisar Suzana is a 47-year-old, Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and two school-aged children. Her husband works hard to show her determination of being able to improve her family’s way of living; he has owned a fish shop in his town since 2008. As per her, she doesn’t work.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the school fees. She is an optimistic person, always aiming for the best. She plans to receive more Kiva loans with the coming years to secure them a bright future.

loans.use: to pay the school fees.

loans.name: Rosmira De Jesus

texts.en:
Rosmira is a married woman who is 55 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the municipality of San Carlos in Colombia. She has worked her whole life as a confectioner, but this year she decided to become independent and start her own business making clothes, a dream she has had for a long time and now see as a reality.

Rosmira has applied for a 5,000,000 COP loan through Kiva's field partner Interactuar to buy a sewing machine and two specialized machines so she has the tools she needs to start her business. The most important thing for her is to make the business a long-time success so it will give her the money she needs to provide for her family and renovate her house, something she needs to do soon.

Rosmira is looking for a little support in her business and dreams of help with the loan she needs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and two specialized machines so she has the tools she needs to start her business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is an engineer. He is living at his parent’s house, but he helps them with the expenses. He travels a lot because of his work, but he wants to be his own boss. He needs a loan to start his own construction company. Fernando works hard; he knows a lot about his field, and he hopes you can help him. He is in the picture at one of his supervision work.

loans.use: to start his own construction company.

loans.name: Mvilako

texts.en:
Mvilako is a widowed woman with five children, and none of them attend school as they are grown-ups. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water.

She has operated a food stall business for over six years now, selling at the market to the general public. She faces a major challenge of food preservation methods in her business, and her greatest monthly expense is medication. Her dream is to expand her business and buy a fridge to be able to preserve her food products.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cereals, etc. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Alexandra Marcela

texts.en:
Alexandra is 33 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellín. She has a little daughter who is only four years of age and whom she loves more than anything. Her daughter was the reason for her to start her own business three years ago, a food place where she prepares and sells delicious food.

She’s asking for a loan so that she can buy products like rice, oil, grain, disposables, and an umbrella to improve her food place. She hopes that with these improvements and investment she can improve her sales by increasing her clientele, and that this will enable her to accomplish some dreams like paying for her daughter's education and buying a house where they can live a great life.

Alexandra needs a little support, and you can help her with the loan she needs.

loans.use: buy products like rice, oil, grain, disposables, and an umbrella to improve her food place.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 26-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing it for the past four years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. She sews garments for the nearest factories. Her husband brings cloth from the factory. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has become out of order due to continuously working.

Nasreen thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring services.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is the age of 36, and a mother of two children. She is living with her husband and children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She engages in tailoring services to earn an income. She started her tailoring services three years ago, because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Zahida is applying for the loan so that she can buy a sewing machine, as the previous one has worn out, and once again start providing the services. She has become an expert in her field of tailoring services. Zahida requested a loan, so she will be able to buy a sewing machine from the market.

Zahida will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is confident that in no time she will able to return the loan amount, as her services once again get kick started.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring services.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en:
Bendita is a businesswoman and she has a small kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as tea, eggs, noodles, biscuits, sardines, candy, cigarettes, pencils, gambling cards, bread fries and other things to sell.

Bendita started to open her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $800. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy tea, eggs, noodles, biscuits, sardines, candy, cigarettes, pencils, gambling cards, bread fries and other things to sell.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 35-year-old woman, living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good, but the body is fully damaged. He does not have a sufficient amount to buy a new rickshaw body and maintain its engine to support his transportation services.

He wants to start driving, but is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Zahida requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy a new rickshaw body and drive the rickshaw smoothly. She hopes that now her husband will be able to earn more income. She is very happy after receiving this loan; Zahida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body and maintain its engine, to support her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, ella está estudiando para ser farmacéutica y en este año culmina su carrera que gracias al apoyo de sus padres y hermanos ha podido estudiar.
Su meta es llegar a ser una profesional útil a la sociedad y también para su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su familia, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Ignacia is from the city of Paraguarí. She is studying to become a pharmacist and this year she will complete her program of study, made possible thanks to the support of her parents and siblings. Her goal is to become a professional who is useful to society and also to her family. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the tuition and fees of her program and be able to continue her education.

loans.use: pay university fees and tuition.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer from Garibi village. As a Babban Gona member, Daniel is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Daniel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Daniel can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Daniel no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, he hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Souleymane  est un Malien âgé de trente-neuf ans, il vit dans un milieu rural avec sa femme et ses quatre enfants dont deux garçons et deux filles qui sont âgés de trois à onze ans ; un garçon et une fille vont à l’école.
Depuis trois ans, il mène une activité commerciale de vente de chaussures en plastiques qui lui permet de faire vivre sa famille en supportant aussi la scolarité de ses enfants. Il évolue dans cette activité au sein d’un groupe dont les membres mènent des activités de commerce de  détail, d’embouche (ovin et bovin) et de maraîchage.
Son souci et celui de ses coéquipiers sont d’accroitre leurs activités en vue de maximiser leurs profits pour améliorer leurs conditions de vie familiales, surtout  l’éducation et le bien-être de leurs enfants.
Sur l’image du profil, Souleymane  est le monsieur qui est assis en posant ses mains sur le stock de chaussures en plastiques.
texts.en:
Souleymane is a 39-year-old Malian. He lives in the countryside with his wife and four children, two boys and two girls between the ages of three and eleven. One boy and one girl go to school.

For three years, he has been selling plastic shoes, which allows him to provide for his family and to support his children's schooling. His activity in this business takes place within a group whose members manage retail, sheep and cattle fattening, and vegetable-farming businesses.

His and his teammates' goal is to grow their businesses to maximize their profits, so they can improve living conditions for their families, in particular as regards the education and well-being of their children.

On the featured photo, Souleymane is the man who sits with his hands touching the stock of plastic shoes.

loans.use: with selling shoes.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Greetings from Armenia. Here are Astghik and her son Rafik, who is a 17-year-old student. Astghik lives in Noratus village of Gavar region with her husband, elderly retired mother-in-law and three children. Rafik is her middle son, who currently studies at Yerevan State University and gets specialization in geography and geology science. He chose this specialization because Armenia is one of the world's ancient countries and there is a big potential for this kind of specialist to explore and develop that field.

This family is hardworking: Astghik bakes different type of cookies and sells them at the local food stores, while her husband has been running the family farm that includes cattle breeding, land cultivation, and fishery.

Despite this family´s main obstacle, the money, Astghik and her husband do their best to give their children opportunities to advance professionally and have good jobs in the future. The requested loan will help Astghik to cover Rafik's university tuition, and she will be very thankful if lenders support their family with this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son, Rafik's, university tuition and give him opportunity to get an educational degree in geography and geology science.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina con 56 años de edad,de estado civil viuda,vive en casa propia,junto a su hijo, en el distrito de Cayalti,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Alejandrina cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Alejandrina se dedica a la actividad de venta de verduras y otros como cebolla,tomate,choclo,papa,etc, con una experiencia de más de 10 años en el negocio.Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería y arreglos en su casa.De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio,obteniendo mayores rendimientos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Alejandrina a tenido 05 préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa, fué de S/ 2,000.00 a 15 meses, el cuál lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 56-years old. She is a widow and lives in her own home with her son in the district of Cayalti, Chiclayo province, and department of Lambayeque, Peru. Alejandrina has very good personal and work references from the residents in the area. The people who live here work mainly in agriculture, business and livestock.

Alejandrina works selling vegetables such as onion, tomato, corn, potato, etc. and has more than 10 years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and house arrangements. This way, she can grow her business in terms of what she offers and get better earnings to be able to improve her quality of life.

Alejandrina has had 5 loans with Edpyme Alternativa. The last was $2,000 for 15 months, which was paid off on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and house arrangements.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 38 years old and married with three children.

Marialyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Marialyn has borrowed and paid back ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marialyn aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is 44 years old, married, and has five children. She has been working for six years from her house, selling clothes, underwear, special blankets, and bed shields, to help her husband cover their family's living needs and expenses. She is working hard on developing her business so she can open her own shop in the future.

Hanadi used her previous loan to pay her children's school tuition fees and increase her business merchandise with newly released products. She is requesting another loan for the same purposes. She hopes to expand her business in the future so she can increase her income and keep improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees as well as increase her business merchandise.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She operates a restaurant business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Gemma requested a loan from NWTF for 29,500 PHP, which she will use to buy more ingredients for her restaurant. In the future, she would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret needs a loan to buy a deep freezer and chairs to use in her restaurant, so as to put it into the required level that customers usually want and to make more sales.

She lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She runs a restaurant that sells food and soft drinks. She has been in business since 2009. She dreams of constructing a commercial house, so as to have many sources of income.

Margret appreciates Kiva for the support rendered to her because she has been in line to pay school fees for her children with the previous loans.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer and chairs to use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has four children, two of whom attend school and two of whom are grownups. She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  

Mwanamisi  requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase several sacks of cashew nuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and because Yehu offers affordable credit facilities. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her dream is to establish another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Wassomagni Group

texts.fr:
Nassoun est une ménagère âgée de 48 ans, tenant la corde des moutons en main. Elle vit au Mali avec son mari  et ses enfants au nombre de 7 dont 3 écoliers. Depuis 10 ans, elle exerce l’élevage de moutons. Très expérimenter  elle met le sérieux dans son activité ce qui lui profite bien et la permettant d’avoir un bénéfice prévisionnel  mensuel de 8 500 FCFA .
Son bénéfice mensuel lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins notamment les frais scolaires la nourriture l'habillement et le financement du champ familial. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants et vend ses béliers dans les mêmes marchés. Elle est très appréciée dans sa communauté pour son courage et sa bravoure. Elle souhaiterait dans l’avenir acquérir une amélioration de son habitat.
texts.en:
Nassoun is a 48-year-old housewife. She is the woman holding the sheep in the photo. She lives in Mali with her husband and their seven children. Three of them are currently receiving educations. For the past 10 years, she has been raising sheep. As a very experienced livestock farmer, she takes her work seriously as it earns her a good living and allows her to earn an estimated profit of 8,500 FCFA per month.

Her monthly profits allow her to meet her family's needs, such as paying for their children's school fees, food and clothing, as well as financing their family's plot of land. She gets her supplies from the local markets and sells her livestock at these same markets. She is held in high regard within her community for her fortitude and her bravery. In the future, she would like to be able to make improvements to her family home.

loans.use: to purchase sheep which will then be resold.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado, junto a su esposa tienen 4 hijos; pero solo su hija menor vive con ellos y su esposa además de los oficios domésticos, también se dedica a la venta de ropa en su comunidad. 

José, se dedica a la agricultura y al cuidado de ganado bovino; este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, pero además de eso también sabe trabajar como albañil. 

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar una yunta de novillos, para realizar los trabajos agrícolas de la cosecha y con el forraje del cultivo espera cuidarlos en el verano y el próximo año los podrá vender a un mejor precio. 

José, sueña con hacerle mejoras a la casa y apoyar a sus hijos en lo que pueda para que ellos también tengan su propia casa.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old and he studied up to Grade 2. He is married and together with his wife has four children. Only his youngest daughter lives with them. His wife besides doing the housework works selling clothing in their community.

José works in agriculture and taking care of cattle. He learned this trade from his father and besides this he also knows how to work as a bricklayer.

José needs the loan to buy a team of steers to carry out the agricultural work during harvest. He hopes to care for them with the forage from his crops during the summer and next year sell them at a higher price.

José dreams of making improvements to his house and support his children with what he can so they can also have their own houses.

loans.use: to buy a pair of steers.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is 33 years old and married. He is from Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip, which is a difficult place to live due to the Israeli economic blockade in place since 2007. Shadi works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income.
 
Shadi requested a loan from FATEN, which he will use to improve himself and become an entrepreneur, selling cosmetics and accessories for ladies. This loan will help him to buy cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business. By taking this loan, Shadi will be able to improve his family's conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics products and accessories to start his own business.

loans.name: Peresperu

texts.en:
Peresperu is a hardworking married man with six children. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been able to look after his family and educate his children from his retail shop business, which he started 15 years ago. He is also a farmer. Inadequate capital is his main problem. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale and also to buy more land for farming.

He is requesting a loan to buy more wheat flour, sugar, salt, soap, and other general merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, sugar, salt, soap, and other general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Doña María, de 62 años de edad, es madre soltera por viudez, tiene 4 hijos y vive en un sector del municipio de Choloma Cortes, junto a una hija y 3 nietos. Ella anteriormente trabajaba en un supermercado y hace 10 años decidió por su propio negocio el cual es un taller de costura donde hace reparaciones y elabora prendas de vestir de diferentes diseños y estilos para vender. Está solicitando la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras que invertirá en la compra de materiales como hilos, tela, zipper y otros materiales para reparar y elaborar prendas de vestir para la venta. con esto pretende aumentar su inventario de materiales y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, y así poder mejorar los ingresos. Su plan es hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: María is 62 years old. She is a widow and a single mother. She has four children and lives in a sector of the municipality of Choloma Cortes, together with a daughter and 3 grandchildren. She used to work in a supermarket and ten years ago opted for her own business, which is a sewing workshop. She makes repairs and sews clothing of different designs and styles to sell. With the loan she hopes to increase her inventory of materials, cover the demand from her clients and doing this be able to increase her income. Her plan is to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, zippers, fabric and others to repair and make clothing for sale.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is aged 38, married to a carpenter/farmer and they're blessed with two children. She's in the food vending business, particularly ambulant vending. She's been in this business for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her net income is usually spent on the school allowances of their children.

Lovelyn sells a variety of food items such as juices, candies, breads, biscuits, cooked hot dogs, and siomai. Due to inadequate capital to use in her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase food items/ingredients and snacks to sell such as breads, biscuits, beverages, and juices. She's hoping that her food vending will continue to grow profitably.

loans.use: To purchase food items/ingredients and snacks to sell such as breads, biscuits, beverages, and juices.

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rabi is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Rabi would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Rabi will store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Rabi now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Ma. Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 23 years old and single. He has been working as a barber with seven years of experience in this area. He established his own business and is working hard to develop it through providing his customers with several diversified services.

Ali is trying to update his shop with newly released facial and barbering machines. He requested a Youth loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy a laser machine. The loan will help him to diversify his services and increase his income. Ali hopes to continue to update his business and provide his customers with diversified services.

loans.use: to purchase a laser machine

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children, two of whom attend school. The youngest one is not yet old enough. For over six years, Fatuma has operated a business selling cashew nuts in the market to the general public. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Fatuma owns a house without electricity or running water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and because it offers affordable credit.

Fatuma is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase several sacks of cashews to sell. Her dream is to open a grocery in the future.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of cashews

loans.name: Elsa Veronica

texts.es: Elsa tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil soltera, vive con su mamá que  es de avanzada edad, empezó cuando tenía 19 años  a vender pan salía caminando a comprar a la ciudad y luego lo vendía en el campo poco a poco fue incrementando su pequeño negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que le ha permitido alimentarse y pagar las medicinas de su madre.  Elsa necesita el dinero para incrementar sus productos en la tienda obtendría mayor utilidad y podría  seguir pagando los principales gastos de ella y su madre.
texts.en:
Elsa is 39 years old. She is single and lives with her mother who is in an advanced age.
She started selling bread when she was 19 years old. She walked on foot to buy in the city and then she sold it in the countryside. Bit by bit she expanded her small business. It´s the only source of income, which allowed her to feed herself and to pay for her mother´s medicine.
Elsa needs the money to increase her products in the shop. She will get higher profits and will be able to continue paying for her and her mother´s principal expenses.

loans.use: to buy products to expand the shop.

loans.name: Marthias

texts.en:
Marthias is married with five children. He lives a four-bedroom house in the Bamenda Momo Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He works selling pigs and goats. Marthias has faced many challenges in life, including death, sickness, poverty, and struggling to educate his children. He has taken and successfully repaid five previous loans and he prefers GHAPE loans because of their low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, social networking opportunities, and because GHAPE delegates decision-making during bimonthly meetings.

Marthias is requesting a loan to buy pigs and goats to sell and to pay for transportation. Because of his experience, his views of succeeding remain positive, and he feels community members will benefit from meat, which gives protein. With the profit from this loan, Marthias will improve his family’s standard of living by providing them with three meals a day, paying for his family's medication and education, and providing other basic necessities. He will also put back some of his profits into the business and will furnish his sitting room.

loans.use: to buy pigs and goats to sell and pay for transportation

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 21-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. Rami is the only breadwinner in his family and they depend on him for support. He runs a dry cleaning business in the city. This is a good business that provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. 

Rami is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development to help him buy a new iron and washing machine. He hopes that this new equipment will enable him to increase his sales, bring in more customers, and eventually allow him to save enough income to open another branch.

loans.use: to buy a new iron and washing machine

loans.name: Mera

texts.en:
Mera is an amazing lady who lives in Bethlehem City. She lives with her parents in a small and humble house. Mera's father works as an employee, but he is not able to cover all of his big family's needs. She wants to help him in any way she can because she is a very productive and ambitious lady.

Mera began working in the family business manufacturing souvenirs to sell from holy olive wood. When she felt that she had good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore she has applied for a loan to help her buy a new engraving machine to increase her income.

Mera needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: buy a new engraving machine.

loans.name: Salomi

texts.en:
Salomi is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, she is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tones of maize per hectare, which is five and half times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Salomi would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member she can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize, up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Salomi is requesting a loan to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, she hopes to realize better yields. Salomi plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
Ana opta por un nuevo crédito por la necesidad de reactivar su negocio, tienen planeado comprar variedad de pan para revender, otra parte le permitirá adquirir prendas de vestir con nuevos estilos para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, esperar administrar muy bien el crédito para tener resultados positivos.
El crédito anterior le ha sido de ayuda para presentar a sus clientes un negocio más surtido, con lo que sus ventas e ingresos han mejorado un poco, actualmente como ha diversificado más su negocio ha dejado de  elaborar pan en las cantidades que antes lo hacía y hoy cuenta con proveedores, cuenta su familia conserva el mismo grupo pero que hoy pueden compartir un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Ana applies for a new loan based on the need to reactivate her business. She is planning to buy an assortment of bread to resell. Another portion will allow her to acquire clothing articles, with new styles, to satisfy the taste of her customers. She hopes to manage her loan very well in order to get positive results.

The previous loan has helped her to offer her customers greater variety, which has slightly improved her sales and income. Currently, given she has diversified more her business, she has stopped making bread in the large quantities she was previously producing, and now she relies on suppliers. She has her family, keeps the same group, but nowadays they can share a more deserving lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of bread to resell. Another portion will allow her to buy clothing articles with new styles to satisfy the taste of her customers.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is maize farmer from Kargo village. As a member of Babban Gona, Hauwa is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tones of maize per hectare, which is five and half times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, she can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize, up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Hauwa is requesting a loan to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest. She is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end, Hauwa hopes to use her increased earnings to provide employment to members of her community at her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Fenina

texts.en:
Fenina is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, she is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Fenina would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, in order to meet her immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Fenina can now store her maize and delay its sale until later in the season when she can obtain the best price, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Fenina no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Fenina hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Sopheap makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chhun's Group

texts.en:
Chhun’s group live in a rural village in the Kampot province in Cambodia. He makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In Chhun’s village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Chhun is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 27-year-old, married man from Dier Al-Balah city, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Fares has a stall for selling shoes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. Fares took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's shoes to sell at his stall.

He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's shoes to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso tiene 57 años de edad, esta casado su esposa realiza quehaceres domésticos del hogar, tiene tres hijos Jaime de 21 años, Andrea de 20 años,  ellos ayudan a sus padres no pudieron continuar sus estudios por la falta de dinero, Dayana de 14 años estudia en una escuela gratuita del sector desde hace 40 años atrás inicio a criar terneros este pequeño negocio le ha permitido alimentar a su familia. Alfonso necesita el dinero para comprar  dos terneros alimento,  vacunas, luego de venderlos cuando crezcan obtendría ingresos para poder seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
texts.en: Alfonso is 57 years old and married. His wife takes care of the domestic chores. They have three children; Jaime 21 and Andrea who is 20. They were unable to continue their education because of a shortage of money and so they help their parents. Dayana is 14 and attends a local public school. 40 years ago Alfonso started rearing calves; this small business has allowed him to feed his family.  Alfonso needs the money to buy calves, feed, vaccines. When the calves have grown he will sell them to generate income allowing Alfonso to continue to provide for the basic needs of his household.

loans.use: to buy two calves, feed and vaccines

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 29-year-old single man from Gaza city, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Ghassan has a tailoring store where he sews clothes. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Ghassan took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new sewing machine for his tailoring business. He hopes that this will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually help him to save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Laureine

texts.en:
A 22-year-old ambitious single lady, Laureine has been working in a mobile phone shop. She uses her income to cover her living expenses and educational fees for tuition. She also provides tutoring services from her house for additional income.

Laureine is working hard to graduate and work in her field of study. She is studying Arabic literature and is enrolled in her third scholastic year. It is her graduation year.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her tuition fees. She is looking forward to her graduation and starting her career.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Kaemra's Group

texts.en: Kaemra’s Group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Kaemra makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Bounouma Sokourani Group

texts.fr: Un homme courageux Adama est le client qui tient en main la corne du bélier,âgé de 42 ans c'est un malien  marié, père de quatorze (14) enfants dont quatre (04)sont à l'école. Adama n’a pas été à l’école mais il a fréquenté le centre Alphabétisation de son village.;il fait recourt au RMCR pour soutenir et renforcer ses activités et il rembourse toujours bien ses prêts. Il achète ses béliers  dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone., Avec le prêt il achète des béliers pour faire l’élevage et les revends,il fait ses ventes dans les mêmes foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Il peut gagner un bénéfice de 30 000 fcfa par mois. Adama fait l’élevage depuis plus de 17 ans. Grâce au soutien  du RMCR, ses activités marchent  bien. Ce qui lui plaisent beaucoup dans son activités en est qu’elles génèrent assez de profits qui l'aide à prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adama is a Malian sheep fattener and brave man--the client holding the ram by the horn in the photo. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of 14 children, four of whom are in school. Adama did not go to school but has attended the literacy center in his village. He relies on the RMCR microfinance institution to support and strengthen his business, and he always repays his loans. He buys his rams and grains at the weekly fairs in his area. 

He will use the loan to buy rams, and grains to breed them, and resell them at the same weekly fairs in his area. He can earn an income of 30,000 CFA francs per month. Adama has been in the livestock business for 17 years. Thanks to the support of RMCR, his business is doing well. What he really enjoys about his business is that it generates enough income for him to take care of his family.

loans.use: Elevage de moutons pour la vente pendant six mois.

loans.name: Somoeun's Group

texts.en: Somoeun’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Somoeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Soun's Group

texts.en: Soun’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Soun makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Abineza Group

texts.en:
Speciose is a group leader, aged 32, married with 4 children aged between 1 and 10 years. The group is called ABINEZA means “People with humility” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses,make more profits and have a better future.

She sells fruits and has been running this business for the past 8 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fruits such as mangoes, oranges and sweet banana for sale. With the profits from the business,she would like to pay medical insurance and improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more fruits such as mangoes, oranges and sweet banana for sale.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is 37-year-old, lives in Ramtha and is married with five kids. She opened her business which sews women's ‎clothes and coats at her house from individual orders that she received. Then she took a loan and used it to develop and ‎buy new sewing machines.

Heyam is a very ambitious woman she is dreaming to be a successful designer and to have a ‎big sewing shop.

Lately Heyam`s family faced a financial problems, so she gave them all the money she had, and now ‎she wants to sew new clothes but she does not have enough money to buy what she needs from fabrics, yarns and ‎tools. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy what she needs and to expand her business

loans.use: to buy what she needs from fabrics, yarns and ‎tools

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en: Lay’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Lay makes a living cultivating rice and raising cows to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mawussé

texts.fr: Mariée, Mawussé est une femme âgée de 32 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Mawussé vit avec ses cinq enfants et son mari. Mawussé est une revendeuse  de chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Mawussé demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des douzaines de chaussures en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider son mari à bien prendre en charge leurs enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à certaines dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Mawussé is a 32-year-old married woman, residing in Adidogomé. She lives with her five children and her husband. Mawussé is a retailer of shoes. She purchases them two times per month at the market, and sells them at home and while circulating in the surrounding neighborhoods. 

She requests this loan to purchase dozens of shoes, to better sell and earn profits. This is in order to help her husband to support their children in their school education, and for some daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen shoes.

loans.name: Man's Group

texts.en: Man’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Man makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work selling groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokum's Group

texts.en: Sokum’s group lives in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Sokum makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Garba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Garba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Garba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Garba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Garba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alh. Magaji

texts.en:
Alh. Magaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alh. Magaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Magaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Magaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Magaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alh. Magaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Matha

texts.en:
Matha is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Matha is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Matha would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Matha can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Matha no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Matha hopes to realize better yields. She plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Tiessiri Fasokanou Group

texts.fr:
Ibert  est un éleveur  (bovins, ovins)âge de 44 ans, marié père de  04 enfants  âgée de 2 à 15 ans dont  3 sont  scolarisé ,sur la photo  c’est  lui  qui  se tient devant  à côté du bélier . Sa  femme   ménagère  fait  le petit commerce pour gagner sa vie.
 Ibert  aime être l’élevage car il tire beaucoup de profit, son  approvisionnement  se fait  dans  le marché de son localité. Son bénéfice  mensuel  peut s’étendre jusqu’à 50 000 FCFA.   
IL fait  recours  au R M C R  pour  avoir plus d’argent  afin d’élargir son  élevage qu’il mène depuis 10 ans. Il a toujours bien remboursé ses prêts avec le RMCR .Les  revenus  générer de cette activité lui  permettre  de couvrir  les  charges  familiales et participe au développement de sa communauté. 
Etant donné qu’il habite dans un milieu rural Ibert souhaite dans les jours à venir être un grand commerçant import-export de bétail.
texts.en:
Ibert is a stock breeder (cattle, sheep) and is 44 years old, and married. He is the father of four children, aged 2 to 15 years old, 3 of whom are in school. In the photo, he is standing in the front, next to the ram. His wife is a housewife, who makes a living through a small business.

Ibert likes being a breeder because he makes a lot of profit. His procurement is done in his local market. His monthly profit can be up to 50,000 FCFA. He turns to RMCR for more money to expand his breeding business, which he has led for 10 years. He always repays his loans with RMCR. The revenues from this activity allow him to cover his family expenses and participate in the development of his community. 

As he lives in a rural area, Ibert wishes in the coming days to be a great trader, importing and exporting livestock.

loans.use: to breed sheep and goats for sale.

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:
Eli is a maize farmer from Dantani village. As a Babban Gona member, Eli is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Eli would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Eli can store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Eli no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices.
