With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Eli hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Twisungane Sub Group A

texts.en: Jean Baptiste, 52, is the group leader. He is married with three children between 9 and 19 years old. The group is called TWISUNGANE, which means “Solidarity” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for changing to a better future. He sells motorcycle spare parts and he has been running this business for the past 19 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more spare parts for sale and with the profits from the business, he would like to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Emmanuel now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en:
Ishaya is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ishaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date, for up to 37% above the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ishaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to USD 2,000 per hectare of land. Ishaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community, through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Marie Esperencia

texts.fr:
Marie Esperencia a 30ans et vie dans la campagne. Elle est très motivée pour améliorer son niveau de vie. Son mari, qui est gardien travail dans la propriété où ils habitent. Le couple a 4 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés et sont respectivement âgés de 13, 10 et 7ans. 
Elle est dans la gargote depuis 2011. Le problème qui est toujours présent jusqu’à ce jour, est au niveau financier (insuffisance de fonds de roulement), Les clients n’ont cessé de s’accroître en nombre. Et en ce moment, son marché tend à s’améliorer. Le prêt servira à acheter du riz, des poids de terre, des haricots, riz, du lentille, du charbon, de l’huile, du sel, du poulet de race malgache, des légumes, de la viande de bovine et de la viande de porc.
Elle a pour objectif dans l’avenir de créer un mini-restaurant quand le revenu de son activité deviendrait optimal.
texts.en:
Marie Esperencia is 30 years old and lives in the countryside. She is very motivated to improve her level of living. Her husband is a watchman in the property where they live. The couple has four children, three of whom attend school and are ages 13, 10, and 7, respectively.

She has been running a small restaurant since 2011. The problem that always arises, even now, is the level of financing (insufficience of working capital). The number of customers never stops growing. Right now, her market is straining to improve. The loan will be used to buy rice, potatoes, beans, lentils, coal, oil, salt, Madagascan chicken, vegetables, beef, and pork.

Her goal for the future is to create a mini restaurant when the profits from her business become optimal.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, meats, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru: Марчона молодая, красивая девушка город Душанбе. Она серьезно относится к работе. Марчона год назад начала зарабатывать на жизнь. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Марчона шустрая и активная рукодельница. Она в день шьет 2-3 платье за 35-50 TJS. Марчона помогает маме обеспечить семью. Марчоне в работе помогает ее сестра. В данный момент, в дом котором проживает Марчона вместе с семьей, нуждается в капитальном ремонте.  Она хочет поскорей до наступления зимы сделать в доме ремонт и утеплить его. С этой целью она обратилась за помощью. Марчона надеется на то, что Вы поддержите ее в этом начинании.
texts.en: Marjona is a young, beautiful woman from the city of Dushanbe. She treats her work seriously. Marjona started to earn a living a year ago. She is involved in sewing women's clothing to order. Marjona is a witty and active craftswoman. She sews 2-3 dresses per day for 35-50 TJS. Marjona helps her mother to provide for the family. Her sister helps her with sewing work. Currently, the house, where Marjona and her family live, needs major repairs. She wants to quickly make repairs at home before the onset of winter and insulate the house. She requested a loan for this purpose. Marjona hopes that You will support her in this.

loans.use: to repair and insulate her house before the onset of winter

loans.name: Fayziddin

texts.ru: Файзиддин живет со своей семьей в районе Сарбанд. Ему 36 лет, женат и отец пятерых замечательных детей.  Файзиддин уже три года работает таксистом. Он купил себе микроавтобус и возит пассажиров по заданному маршруту. Его деятельность является основным источником дохода для него и его семьи. Файзиддин зарабатывает хорошо, так как он работает с 5 утра до 11 ночи. Однако в данный момент его микроавтобус сломался и Файзиддин нужно отремонтировать его. Файзиддин не имеет достаточно денег. Он надеется, что с вашей помощью он не потеряет источника своего дохода
texts.en: Fayziddin lives with his family in the Sarband district. He is 36 years old, married and a father of five remarkable children. Fayziddin has been working as a taxi driver for three years. He bought a minibus and transports passengers along a set route. His business is the sole source of income for him and his family. Fayziddin earns well because he works from 5 in the morning until 11 at night; however, his minibus has broken down and needs to be repaired. Fayziddin does not have enough money for the repair. He hopes that with your support, he will retain his source of income.

loans.use: to repair his minibus and retain his source of income

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en: Zahraa is a 27 year old Lebanese married woman. She is living with her husband and her two children, all of them are still studying. She is a housewife where she is dedicated from her home and family. Her husband is the main income provider, he works as a painter since 2012, but his income is barely sufficient. That’s why, today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l; she will be utilizing the loan to pay the school fees for her children. She said that this loan will surely helped her to insure the school year for them what makes her very happy.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 37-year-old, married man from Rafah, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house he is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Jalal has a tailoring store for sewing clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict.

Jalal took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new sewing machine for his tailoring. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his tailoring service.

loans.name: Mwanvua Group

texts.fr: Mwanvua est membre du groupe qui porte le même qu'elle. Il s'agit de trois dames qui se connaissent depuis 1980 et effectuent leurs activités dans un même marché. Pendant tout ce temps, personne ne les est venu en aide jusqu'à entrer en contact avec PAIDEK. Mwanvua reconnaît que cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins socio-économiques quoiqu'elle est parfois bousculée par la variation de prix des articles qui intervient à tout moment sans qu'elle le sache. Elle souhaite que cette activité lui permette de plus en plus à assurer son indépendance en s'approvisionnant au même endroit que les autres. Sur photo, Mwanvua est celle qui est en première position, portant une robe jaune et tenant dans ses mains un entonnoir bleu.
texts.en: Mwanvua is a member of the group where everyone runs the same business. It consists of three ladies who have known each other since 1980 and run their businesses in the same market. During this time, nobody has come to help them until they contacted PAIDEK. Mwanvua recognizes that this business allows her to meet her socio-economic needs, although she is sometimes shaken up by the variation in items’ prices, which can happen out of nowhere without her knowledge. She hopes that this business will allow her to ensure her independence more and more by stocking up at the same place the others do. In the photo, Mwanvua is the first one, wearing a yellow dress, holding a blue funnel.

loans.use: to stock up on miscellaneous food items to resell.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Lois is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Lois would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Lois will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Lois now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman and a mother of four children of whom two are in school and the rest are done with their studies.; she’s a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She owns a food cafe which she has operated for ten years, selling at home to neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from fellows in the same business and her aspirations are to expand her business in the near future.

Mwanajuma is borrowing this loan to buy food stuff for her cafe. She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.
She joined Yehu to have access to loans which will help in expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy food stuff for her cafe

loans.name: Ra'no

texts.ru: Замечательная и заботливая мама двоих детей. У нее два сына. Раъно разведена с  мужем. Она одна воспитывает, и кормить детей. Раъно занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды. Она опытная мастерица города Турсунзаде. У Рано есть большой талант и желание. Она просто обожает кроить и шить. Сын Раъно в плохом состоянии, него серьезный болезнь. Ее сын нуждается в медицинской помощи. Раъно решила взять кредит для купли лекарство и для лечения сына. Она мать любить своих детей и старается ради них. С большой надеждой Раъно обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Подержите ее семью.
texts.en: Ra'no is a remarkable and caring mother of two children, sons. She is divorced from her husband and raises and feeds her children alone. Ra'no is involved in sewing national women's clothing. She is an experienced seamstress in the town of Tursun-zoda. Ra'no has a lot of talent and desire. She simply adores sewing. Ra'no's son is in a bad condition and is seriously ill. He needs medical help. Ra'no decided to request a loan to buy medicine and treat her son. She is a mother and loves her children, and tries hard for them. Ra'no comes to You for this loan, with a lot of hope. Please support her family.

loans.use: to buy medicine and treat her ill child

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 25 years old and married with two children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing and farming rice.

Marilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Duhuzimbaraga Group

texts.en:
Julienne is a group leader; aged 46.She is married with 6 children aged between 2 and 14 years. The group is called DUHUZIMBARAGA which means “Let's work together” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses make more profits and have a better future.

She sells foodstuffs and has been running this business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more food stuffs such as rice, banana,cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, banana, cassava for sale.

loans.name: Hafsa

texts.en:
Hafsa is a single woman with no children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a food stall for the past year, selling at the market to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her greatest monthly expense is medication. Her dream is to expand her business and have an employee who will help in running the business.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase inventory of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, etc. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.fr: Jérome a 4 enfants. Il a 39 ans et vend des produits de quincaillerie depuis 6 ans. Il demande un microcrédit pour diversifier les produits qu'il propose à la vente à ses clients. Grâce au microcrédit, il peut augmenter son stock. A l'avenir, Jérome espère épargner davantage pour offrir une meilleure éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Jérome has 4 children. He is 39 and has been selling hardware products for 6 years. He is asking for a micro loan to diversify the products he sells to his customers. Thanks to the micro loan, he can augment his stock. In the future, Jérome hopes to save more with which to offer his children a better education.

loans.use: to augment his stock.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en: Nary’s group live in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia.  Nary makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Eunide

texts.fr: Eunide a 31 ans et elle vit chez ses parents. Depuis 4 ans, elle gère sa propre activité à domicile où elle vend des rideaux, des nappes, etc. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. À l’avenir, elle espère gagner des revenus plus élevés et prendre son autonomie.
texts.en: Eunide is 31 years old and lives with her parents. For 4 years, she has been running her own home business selling curtains, tablecloths, etc. She is asking for this microloan to augment her stock. In the future, she hopes to make higher profits and gain her autonomy.

loans.use: to buy curtains and sheets.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr:
Lydia a 37ans et habite dans une zone rurale. Elle fait partie des zélés de la vente. Son mari est maçon et le couple a 4 enfants. Deux  de ses enfants sont encore scolarisés, ils sont respectivement âgés de 14 et 11ans. Elle est dans la production de sac en rabane depuis 2010 et et son problème est au niveau matériel : machine à coudre. Le prêt servira à acheter une machine à coudre, un moteur à machine à coudre, des rabanes, blanche, étau, des sachets, de la ficelle à coudre, une sangle, des fermetures et des têtes de fermeture. 
Elle se donne pour objectif de produire beaucoup de sac pour les acheminer vers la ville.
texts.en:
Lydia is 37 years old and lives in a rural area. She is one of the zealous sellers. Her husband is a mason, and the couple has four children. Two of the children still attend school; they are 14 and 11, respectively. She has been making bags out of raffia matting since 2010, and her problem is in her equipment: the sewing machine. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine, a sewing machine motor, raffia matting, bleach, a vice, sacks, sewing thread, straps, and zippers.

Her goal is to produce a lot of bags in order to bring the to the city.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, a sewing machine motor, and raffia matting.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is the age of 38, living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fans and washing machines and troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He sells electrical components as well at his shop such as bulbs, switches, sockets, etc.

But now he wants to buy new inventory for his shop but does not have the amount to buy new inventory. Therefore, Sajida requested from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can become empowered to buy his desired inventory.

Sajida thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new electrical components and inventory such as bulbs, switches, sockets, etc. for her husband's electrician shop.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena has a very high interest in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2013, with her own working capital of $600, and she does her best with it. She has a small store so she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital because her capital is not enough.

She will use this loan to buy more additional items to keep in her store including sugar, aqua, lamps, soy sauce, slippers, rice, cooking oil, sweets, sardines, biscuits, ice, candles, coffee, snacks and other things to sell Including soft drinks and hard drinks. With this loan she still wants to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, aqua, lamps, soy sauce, slippers, rice, cooking oil, sweets, sardines, biscuits, ice, candles, coffee, snacks, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Isuwa

texts.en:
Isuwa is a maize farmer from Pegi village. As a Babban Gona member, Isuwa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isuwa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Isuwa can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Isuwa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Isuwa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en:
Philibus is a maize farmer from Gidan Zaki village. As a Babban Gona member, Philibus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Philibus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Philibus can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Philibus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Philibus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en:
Hamisu is maize farmer from Kunkumi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Hamisu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Hamisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Hamisu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Hamisu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-years-old single young man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs.

Mohammad is a student in the university where he studies to become a Medical Secretary. He also works in a dental clinic after school. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies to become a medical secretary.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to friends and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation to various markets. She dreams of expanding her business in the future
. 
With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase more bales of clothes for resale.
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Gambo is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Gambo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Gambo can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Gambo no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Gambo hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Cathiana

texts.fr: Cathiana a 24 ans. Elle est mariée. Son activité consiste à vendre des matelas d’occasion importés des États-Unis par des commerçants du quartier. Grâce à cette activité, peut subvenir aux besoins de sa fille. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock. À l’avenir, elle espère développer son activité et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: Cathiana is 24 years old. She is married. She works selling used mattresses imported from the United States by local retailers. Thanks to her business, she can support her daughter. She is asking for a microcredit loan to increase her stock. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy used mattresses.

loans.name: Ado

texts.en:
Ado is a maize farmer from Gidan Zaki village. As a Babban Gona member, Ado is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ado would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Ado can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ado no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Ado hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас милая и заботливая женщина из Кабадияна. Она замужем и имеет детей. Вот уже 5 лет она занимается продажей миндаля. Этот бизнес весьма выгодный в нашей стране.  В этом деле ей помогает ее муж. Они хорошо наладили каналы сбыта миндаля в своем районе. Теперь  они с мужем решили расширить сферу бизнеса и поставлять миндаль и в другие регионы. Однако для этого ей необходимо материальная помощь. Поэтому Мукаддас обратилась в Кива для получения кредита. Им очень нужна Ваша поддержка.
texts.en:
Mukaddas is a sweet and caring woman from Qubadiyon. She is married and has children. For five years now, Mukaddas has sold almonds. This business is extremely profitable in our country. Her husband helps her with her work. They are really attuned to the ways to sell almonds in their region.

Now, Mukaddas and her husband want to expand the sphere of their business and provide almonds to other regions as well. However, for this they require material help. Therefore, Mukaddas has applied to Kiva to receive a loan. They really need your support.

loans.use: to buy almonds and expand her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a businesswoman who owns a supplies company as well as a supermarket in Kyebando in Kawempa District, a division of Kampala in Uganda. Her supermarket has just opened, and she finds she has so many customers that she is unable to keep up with demand.

Grace is short on capital, and so she has applied for a 5,000,000 UGX loan through Kiva's field partner Ugafode Microfinance. After carrying out an appraisal and assessment of her business, Ugafode has agreed to finance this loan. Fulfillment of it will mean an increase in sales and a boost in her profits during the holiday season.

loans.use: to fulfill her customers' demands for sugar, bread, rice, corn flour and other such grocery items.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Bintou est membre du groupe Benkadi, marié et mère de  2 enfants âgé de 4 à21 ans, elle est analphabète, réside  au Mali, âgés de 40 ans c’est elle qui a les mains posés sur l’arachide sur la photo. Elle fait le commerce des arachides. Les rêves et les espoirs de Bintou est d’avoir plus d’argent pour acheter beaucoup d’arachide, et après ses ventes de tirer plus de bénéfice pour subvenir aux besoins de sa familiale. Par manque de moyen financier elle fait recours au RMCR pour pouvoir mener son activité. Elle s’approvisionne dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone et revend dans sa zone. Elle  gagne comme bénéfice 15 000 FCFA par mois.Le prêt l’aidera à survenir aux besoins de sa famille : santé, scolaire etc., depuis 11ans elle fait le commerce d'arachide Les obstacles auxquels se heurte de Bintou est souvent la chute des prix.
texts.en: Bintou is a member of the Benkadi Group. She is married and the mother of two children between the ages of 4 and 21 years old. She is illiterate, lives in Mali, and is 40 years old. She is the woman with her hands resting on the peanuts in the photo. She has a business selling peanuts. Bintou's hopes and dreams are to have more money to buy more peanuts and after her sales to have enough profit to meet her family's needs. Facing a lack of financing, she appealed to RMCR in order to conduct her business. She purchases supplies in the weekly fairs in her area and resells in her area. She makes 15,000 francs in profit each month. The loan will help her meet her family's needs (health, education, etc.) She has been selling peanuts for 11 years. The obstacles that Bintou faces are often a decline in prices.

loans.use: to sell peanuts.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс молодой отец и глава семейства. Ему 27 лет. Он с семьей проживает на районе Чоми и  работает в государственной организации. Фирдавс работает далеко от дома. Но это не достает ему хлопоты, потому что у него есть машина. Но сейчас его машина сломалась. Все его деньги уходит на семейные расходы и на меленького ребенка. Он принял решение обратиться за кредитом, купить автозапчасти и отремонтировать машину.
texts.en: Firdavs is a young father and head of household. He is 27 years old. He lives with his family in the A. Jomi region, and works in a government organization. Firdavs works far from home. However, this does not give him trouble, because he has his own car. But now his car is broken. All of Firdavs's money goes toward family expenses and for his small child. He decided to apply for a loan, purchase the automobile parts, and repair his car.

loans.use: to buy automobile parts and repair his car.

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en:
Cherly, 31 years old, is a married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has two young children whom she looks after while her husband drives to provide for them.

Cherly makes the most of her time by selling prepaid top-up loads and purified water, and she also invests in rice farming. She is asking for a loan to buy prepaid top-up loads to sell and empty five-gallon-containers so that she can increase her sales and accommodate more orders on water refill.

This loan will enable her to enhance her revenue and better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy prepaid top-up loads to sell and empty five-gallon-containers

loans.name: Dukore Cb Group

texts.en:
Mercelle, 41, is married with six children aged between nine and 23 years. She is also the leader of this group called Dukore, which means “Let's work” in English. The members sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses in order to make more profits and have a better future. As their leader, Mercelle has applied for a group loan of 6,260,000 RWF through Kiva's field partner Urwego to be apportioned among the group members.

For the past ten years Mercelle has sold produce such as Irish potatoes, cassava and bananas. With her portion of the loan she would like to buy more produce to sell. With her profits she will pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en:
Yahuza is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village. As a member of Babban Gona, Yahuza is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahuza would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yahuza can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Yahuza is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end, he hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Edzon

texts.en:
Edzon is a single man, but he supports his little brother. He needs a loan to buy a milking cow as he sells milk and he is assisted by his brother, but his brother goes to school too.

Edzon would like to have a house in the future and to move to another place to increase his quality life. He hopes you can help him

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Этот мужчина Шариф. Ему 32 года. Шариф вместе семьей проживает на районе Фархор. У него не большая семья. Шариф решил заняться выращиванием скота как бизнес. Он хорошо справляется работой на скотном дворе. Ему нравится его работа. Он уверен, что сможет справиться этим бизнесом и стать хорошим предпринимателем в своем районе. Шариф хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить деятельность. Она по этой причине берет кредит. Поддержите Шарифа в его начинаниях.
texts.en: This man is Sharif. He is 32 years old, and he lives with his family in the Farkhor region. He has a small family. Sharif has decided to raise livestock as a business. He has very able to do livestock work, and he likes the work. He is sure that he will be able to manage this business and become a good business owner in his region. Sharif wants to increase his headcount of livestock and expand his business. For this reason, he is taking out a loan. Support Sharif in his endeavors.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a new business.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Kiva's field partner Babban Gona, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to a 6,606 NGN loan and support from Babban Gona, she can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hauwa will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. She is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to putting her additional earnings toward building a house for her family.

loans.use: to store her maize at harvest time, then sell it at a later date for a better price.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 45-year-old housewife and a mother of 5 children. She lives in a small town which is Salt. Her husband is retired ‎and his pension is enough to cover his family's needs.

For that Diana started to do side jobs at home, making cheese, olives, and yogurt products to sell. Now she wants to buy a small machine that can help in the production of yogurt instead of her having to make it by hand. For that she is applying for this loan.‎

loans.use: to buy a small machine that can help in the production of yogurt and olives that she sells.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support he can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

As a Babban Gona member, Isah will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. Isah is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 30-year-old housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, and is mother to a child. Her husband, the only wage-earning person in the family, is a taxi driver.

He needs capital for the maintenance of his taxi. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult to pay for the maintenance. Therefore his wife Robina, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband.

With the profits, they will be able to have some savings. Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's taxi repair.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Victoria is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Victoria would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Victoria can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Victoria no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Victoria hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Salamatu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Salamatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Salamatu can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Salamatu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Salamatu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Bintou est la cliente qui tient la calebasse d’arachide en main.
Agée de 57 ans,  Bintou est une commerçante malienne des céréales. Mariée, mère de trois (03) enfants tous fréquentés l’école coranique. Bintou rêve dans les jours à venir de payer des bœufs et moutons pour ses enfants. Son mari est un cultivateur. Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Elle se bat beaucoup et  fait recourt au RMCR pour soutenir son activité. Elle fait ses achats (arachide et paniers) dans la foire hebdomadaire de sa zone. Bintou stocke son arachide, le décortique et revend les grains à la  même foire hebdomadaire de sa zone..  Bintou fait un bénéfice de 16 000 FCFA environ par mois. Elle fait le commerce des arachides et de paniers depuis plus de douze (12 ans), elle est cliente du RMCR il y a plus de trois (03) ans de cela. Grace aux prêts du RMCR, elle mène bien ses activités. Elle ne se plaint pas pour le déroulement de ses activités.
texts.en:
Bintou is the client holding the gourd filled with peanuts in her hands.

Bintou is a 57-year-old business woman from Mali who sells nuts. She is married and the mother of three children who all go to the Koranic school. Bintou daydreams of paying for cattle and sheep for her children. Her husband is a farmer. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She works very hard and appeals to RMCR to support her business. She purchases goods (peanuts and baskets) in the weekly fairs in her area. Bintou stocks her peanuts, shells them, and resells the nuts at the same weekly fair in her area. Bintou makes approximately 16,000 francs in monthly profit. She has been selling peanuts and baskets for over 12 years. She has been a client of RMCR for more than three years of that time. Thanks to her loans from RMCR, she can practice her business well. She doesn't complain about the her business' activity.

loans.use: to sell peanuts.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
A 42-year-old married mother of four and a former teacher, this is Fatima. She is a hard-working business woman, who decided two years ago to quite her work as a teacher and establish her own perfume production business.

Fatima adores her business, she believes that she can succeed in providing her customers the best scents they can smell, and she is working hard to achieve her goal.

Currently, she is running her business at home, until she finds herself financially capable of opening a separate shop in the future.

Today, and since she is considered working on developing a newly established business, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary raw materials for perfumes so she can increase her production, especially with the Holy Christmas season collection.

loans.use: to buy necessary perfumes and raw materials to increase her production, especially with the Holy Christmas season collection.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is father of 5 children, all of them are going to school.  He sells milk to a milk plant and he needs a loan to buy a cow for his business. He works hard and he hopes you can help him, because he is the only support of his family. Besides he is experienced in this business and he is healthy.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor  Roberto de 45 años de edad, es soltero y vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene 22 años de dedicarse a su negocio que esla venta de ganado y de leña, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su comunidad.
Don Roberto es un hombre muy trabajador  con muchos deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de madera y revender este material que es importante en las cocinas. Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende surtir y mejorar su vivienda. 
Don Roberto su sueño es comprarse un vehículo para su negocio.        
         
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre 2015.
texts.en:
Roberto is 45 years old, single, and lives in the small town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. For 22 years he has worked in his business of selling livestock and wood. His customers are his neighbors and friends in the community.

Roberto is a very hardworking man with a great desire to move forward. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of wood in order to resell it, since it is important in people's kitchens. With the support of the loan, he hopes to stock and improve his home.

His dream is to purchase a vehicle for his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his business.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 22-year old single lady from Ramallah City. She is a clever and ambitious girl. Muna studied law at local university in Palestine, and after she graduated she decided to open her own law office.

She apply for a youth woman loan from FATEN. This loan will enable her to get started to pay the rent of the office and buy some office furniture.

Muna hopes to be famous and professional and help her family and serve her country. Muna appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the rent of the office and buy some office furniture.

loans.name: Cesar Naason

texts.es:
Cesar, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a vender almuerzos y desayunos en el centro de la ciudad.

Cesar, se dedica a vender calzado en la ciudad, este negocio lo coloco gracias a la motivación de un amigo que lo impulsó para que lo pusiera, para llegar a su puesto de ventas tiene que recorrer seis kilómetros en autobús y su horario de venta es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:30 p.m.

Cesar, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su negocio como: calzado para damas, caballeros y niños y comprar sandalias para ambos sexos.

Cesar, sueña con darle a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir una vida digna.
texts.en:
Cesar is 40 years old. He went to school till eighth grade. He is living in a relationship. His partner is selling lunches and breakfasts in the city centre.

Cesar is selling shoes in the city. He set up this business thanks to the motivation of a friend who pushed him to open it. To arrive at his point of sale he has to travel six kilometres by bus and his hours of sale are from 7:00 a.m. till 4:30 p.m.

Cesar needs the loan to buy more products for his business, such as: ladies´, gents´and children´s shoes and to buy sandals for both sexes.

Cesar is dreaming of giving his family all the necessary things for living a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy more products for his shop, such as: ladies´, gents´ and childrens shoes and to buy sandals for both sexes.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 52-year-old married mother of three. She has been running a clothes selling shop since 2008 to support her husband, who is employed with a limited monthly salary, and help to cover their family's increasing living needs and improve their living.

Fatima is acquiring her second loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, where she proved to be a good standing borrower. Her previously acquired loan was invested in increasing her business capital, while today, and since she managed investing her previous loan properly, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua again, to increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter season collection.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter season collection.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
45-year-old Concepcion owns a sari-sari store in the community of San Miguel, Bohol. This business allows her to help her husband in raising their children.

It is a challenge for Concepcion to maintain her inventory level specially since she is also spending money for the education of her children. There are times when customers will prefer buying in other stores since she runs out of stock on most grocery items that she is selling.

She is requesting a loan to buy toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar and bath soap. With these goods, Concepcion can have a chance to increase her sales as well. In the future, she hope to further expand her business and manage it well for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar and bath soap.

loans.name: Deivi Javier

texts.es:
Deivi vive con su familia formada por su compañera de vida y dos hijos con edades de 6 y 5 años, en totalidad tiene tres dependientes, desde hace cinco años se está dedicando a la reparación de equipo para audio y video, trabaja solo con un horario de seis de la mañana a nueve de la noche, su negocio está instalado en su vivienda, para aprender el oficio estuvo en un curso por 6 meses.
Invertirá en papel especial para reparar bocinas, cobre, pegamento, conos para bocinas, alambre entre otros materiales necesarios para realizar las reparaciones en los equipos de sonido y audio que sus clientes le hacen llegar, espera agilizar sus actividades y prestar un buen servicio, su riesgo es la delincuencia existente en la zona.
Deivi tiene como aspiraciones ampliar su negocio, tener estabilidad económica y comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Deivi lives with his family, which consists of his life partner and two children who are six and five years old. In total he has three dependents.

For five years he has been working in audio and video equipment repairs. His work schedule is from 6:00am to 9:00pm. His business is run out of his home. To learn this profession, he took a six-month course.

With the loan, he will invest in special paper for repairing speakers, copper, glue, speaker cones, wire, and other materials that are necessary for repairing the audio equipment that his customers bring to him. He hopes to speed up his work and offer a good service. His biggest risk is the crime that exists in the local area.

Deivi's dreams include growing his business, having economic stability, and purchasing his own house.

loans.use: to invest in special paper for repairing speakers, copper, glue, speaker cones, wire, and other materials that are necessary for equipment repairs.

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
28-year-old Nasir has been running the school for many years. Nasir’s father started this school in his community to provide the best education. His father has a dream to make this school a model school in the city.

Nasir did his best and made his school as good as he can but because of financial constraints his dream could not be fulfilled. He is proud of the quality of education in his school, which is better than schools charging much higher fees than him. There are 723 students of which 42% are female students who are being taught.

Nasir require 150,000 PKR to build a computer lab in the school and to provide comprehensive education to his students.

loans.use: to build a computer lab in his school and to provide comprehensive education to his students.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a maize farmer from Galadima Mayau village. As a Babban Gona member, Isah is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Isah can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Isah no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Isah hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Adamu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Adamu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Adamu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Adamu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Julius Ummaru

texts.en:
Julius is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Julius has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Julius would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Julius can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Julius will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Julius is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Yusuf now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Liman

texts.en:
Liman is a maize farmer from Katsalle village. As a Babban Gona member, Liman is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Liman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Liman can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Liman no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Liman hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer from Kargo village. As a Babban Gona member, Daniel is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Daniel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Daniel can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Daniel no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Daniel hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Magajiya

texts.en:
Magajiya is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Magajiya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Magajiya would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Magajiya can store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Magajiya no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Magajiya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Somos Progreso Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “SOMOS PROGRESO” está conformada por 09 socias trabajadoras. Este es el caso de MARGARITA de 52 años de edad conviviente con 4 hijos. Margarita es una madre responsable con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su bodega su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz azúcar aceite y fideos. El grupo “somos progreso” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Margarita se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste chompa color negro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Somos Progreso" is made up of 9 diligent members. This is the case for Margarita who is 52 years old and lives with her partner and 4 children. Margarita is a responsible mother and is eager to improve her quality of life. She makes a living selling groceries from her store and her greatest desire is to expand her business. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase rice, sugar, oil and noodles. 

The group "Somos Progreso" is very grateful to Kiva for the help they have provided. Margarita is seated second from the left wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and noodles.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es dueña de una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, la cual abrió hace más de 6 meses por necesidad de generar ingresos para tener menos carencias en su hogar, lo fundo por iniciativa propia, ella  vive únicamente con su compañero de vida, no tiene otros dependientes.
Con el financiamiento comprara granos básicos, bebidas, huevos, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos para atender las demandas que hacen sus clientes diariamente, también piensa invertir un poco en variedad de ropa, con ello fortalecerá su negocio y atraerá a otro tipo de cliente.
Los sueños que tiene María son obtener mayores ingresos y tener mejor calidad de vida junto a su pareja.
texts.en:
María is the owner of a small, basic grocery store, which she opened more than six months ago due to her need to generate income in order to have less scarcity in her house. She opened the business under her own initiative. She lives with her life partner, and has no other dependents.

With the loan, she will purchase basic grains, drinks, eggs, sugar, oil, and other products to fulfill the daily demands of her customers. She also wants to invest a little of the money in a variety of clothes, which will strengthen her business and attract different types of customers. María's dreams include obtaining more income and having a better quality of life alongside her partner.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, drinks, eggs, sugar, oil, and other products to fulfill the daily demands of her customers.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is an amazing mother who lives in Wehdat. She has three daughters and one son. She is working hard to ensure a good ‎life for them, and she doesn't let them need anything. The eldest one is working in a company, the other two are studying in ‎university, and the son is still in school.

Heyam's dead and left her without income, so because of that she decided to open ‎her own business to be able to provide a living for her children. Heyam has started her business and she took a loan to buy ‎a simple sewing machine to start sewing embroideries.

She likes what she is doing. She said that her business is helping ‎her to pay for her daughters' education, and it helped her with the oldest one before she graduated and found work.

‎After she became a professional in sewing, she took a loan and expanded her work and started giving classes for trainees, where ‎they come to her home to take lessons in sewing.

Heyam wants to expand her shop and buy what she needs to raise her ‎profits, so she applied for a loan to help her buy yarns and fabrics, and to buy tools that she needs for the textile fabrics. She needs your support ‎to achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: to buy yarns and fabrics, and buy tools for textile fabrics.

loans.name: Okyeso Nyame Group

texts.en:
Okyeso Nyame group will begin its third cycle with the social micro finance organisation “ID-Ghana”. The group consists of 6 members and is directed by an executive board of which Jacqueline is the president. The members have varied businesses: producing and selling bread, rubber products, slippers and catering services. The loan will benefit these small businesses.

Jacqueline joined ID-Ghana one year ago at the invitation of a promotion from the institution that was made in the area. Today she has a business producing and selling bread. She learned this trade years ago from her mother. The loan today will be used to increase capital in order to buy margarine, flour and sugar at wholesale from the wholesalers in the localities of Chorkor and then make and sell the bread in the Shiabu Night markets. This work will enable her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responds that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy margarine, flour and sugar at wholesale from the wholesalers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old, single man who lives with his parents in Wihdat.

For the past three years, Ahmad has owned grocery store near his house. Being the only breadwinner in his house, ‎Ahmad works really hard in order to help his parents. He is requesting a loan to purchase a wholesale stock of rice, pulses, snacks and cleaning materials in order to accommodate a huge stock of eatables.

He is confident that his store will be a great success since there aren't any such small stores in his neighborhood.

Your loan amount will help support him to expand his business.‎

loans.use: to purchase a wholesale stock of rice, pulses, ‎snacks and cleaning materials.

loans.name: Sovagini's Group

texts.en:
Sovagini, standing to the right hand side in the photograph, is a charismatic and hardworking lady from Banarpal, Odisha, India. She has a family of four and is a blessed mother of two sons who are currently in school.

Sovagini hails from a low-income household and has access to very limited resources. For this reason, she was never able to build a suitable toilet for her family. Without access to toilet, she faces a lot of problems as she has to travel a long distance to relieve herself. She no more finds it feasible enough to depend on an open field for defecation.

Therefore, Sovagini, along with her other group member, is requesting a loan amount of 40,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet,incorporate water pipes and install a commode in it. Access to basic sanitation will consequently result in safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet, incorporate water pipes and install a commode in it.

loans.name: Sarojini's Group

texts.en:
Sarojini is a humble lady standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a remote village of Banarpal, Odisha, India. She has a family of five consisting of her husband and three children.

Sarojini is a mason by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, along with her other group members, she is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and install a hand pump in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

She is eagerly awaiting for your generous hearts to help her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and install a hand pump in her home.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is the age of 54; she is mother of three. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many weeks his rickshaw has not worked properly, thus he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the repairing cost of his rickshaw. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Parveen is so much thankful to Kiva and it's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in repair of her husband's transportation rickshaw.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en:
Ishaya is maize farmer from Kwankwani village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ishaya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Ishaya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, five and a half times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a maize farmer from Galadima Mayau village. As a Babban Gona member, Joseph is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Joseph would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Joseph can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Joseph no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Joseph hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Faliarisoa Lalanirina

texts.fr: Faliarisoa vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit. Avec lequel, elle a pu acheter des blousons et couettes fripes, elle a pu augmenter les quantités de ses marchandises et qui a eu pour conséquence l'augmentation un peu de ses chiffres d'affaires et de ses bénéfices. Pour ce nouveau demande de crédit elle va créer une nouvelle activité, un commerce de produits locaux et des provendes. Le but est de toujours améliorer le revenu afin de pouvoir continuer à financer les études de ses enfants, et de continuer aussi la finition de sa propre maison. La vente de friperie est toujours pratiqué. Elle va acheter avec ce prêt des pistaches, des haricots secs et provendes pour démarrer la nouvelle activité. L'idée est de diversifier l'activité, (extension d'activité et augmenter le revenu.
texts.en:
Faliarisoa thanks you very much for the loan. With it, she was able to buy secondhand jackets and duvets. She was able to increase the quantities of her stock which led to a small increase in her turnover and also her profits.
For this new loan request, she is going to create a new business - selling local products and feed. The goal is still to improve income in order to keep funding her children's studies, and also to finish her house.
She still sells secondhand clothing, and the idea is to diversify her business activities, so as to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of feed, 50kgs of dry beans and 50kgs of peanuts.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 24-year-old, married man from Rafah, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Nidal has a work shop for repairing washing machines and refrigerators in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. Nidal is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his work shop. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his customers, and eventually save enough funds to expand his business.

loans.use: buy new tools for his work shop

loans.name: Xiomara Cristela

texts.es:
Xiomara, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos, su pareja se dedica a comercializar frutas y verduras desde hace muchos años y en la casa de ella también viven sus dos padres.

Xiomara, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras en el centro de la ciudad, ella vende estos productos desde hace varios años y esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingresos y dedica todo su tiempo y empeño en dar una buena atención a sus clientes.- Xiomara, tiene que recorrer en autobús 13 kilómetros diariamente para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo y su horario es de lunes a domingo de 5:00 a.m. hasta las 4:30 p.m.

Xiomara, necesita el préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas de toda clase, porque se acerca la temporada navideña en la cual espera tener buenas ventas a finales de este año.
 
Xiomara, sueña con tener una vivienda digna, cómoda y segura para su familia y dar una buena educación a sus hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 27 years old. She went to school till sixth grade. She is in a relationship. She is living with her partner and their two children. Her partner has been marketing fruit and vegetables for many years. Both of her parents are living in her house as well.

Xiomara is selling fruit and vegetables in the city centre. She has been selling these products for several years and this activity is the main source of income. And she dedicates all of her time and commitment to providing a good care for her customers.
Xiomara has to travel 13 kilometres by bus every day to arrive at her working place and her working hours are from monday till sunday from 5:00 a.m. till 4:30 p.m.

Xiomara needs the loan to buy all sorts of vegetables and fruit, because the Christmas season, in which she hopes to have good sales at the end of this year, is getting closer.

Xiomara is dreaming of having a dignified, comfortable and secure home for her family and to give her children a good education in the future.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Gladis Emiri

texts.es: Gladis de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 15 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Gladis is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has made a living tailoring clothes 15 years. Her sewing workshop is located at her home and she has many clients due to her high standards when making the garments. With the income she receives from her job she manages to settle some of her household expenses. 

She is applying for a loan in order to purchase threads, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastics etc, thus being able to continue her work which makes her a good profit.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons and elastics etc.

loans.name: Sirajo

texts.en:
Sirajo is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sirajo is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Sirajo would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Sirajo will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Sirajo now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
