Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en:
Bashiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Bashiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bashiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bashiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Bashiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Bashiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a maize farmer from Bakutaje village. As a Babban Gona member, Dahiru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Dahiru can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Dahiru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Dahiru hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ashiru

texts.en:
Ashiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ashiru is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ashiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ashiru will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Ashiru now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Assétou est la personne qui présente le mouton sur la photo, âgé de 32 ans, elle est membre du groupe Tiéssiri  constitué en majorité femmes, nationalité malienne mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 scolarisés.
Assétou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école, réside à Saalo il y a 20 ans de cela, elle achète les moutons dans les marchés fait l'élevage pendant huit mois  et revend dans les grands marchés,elle peut gagner par mois 20 000 fcfa de profit. 
Pour acheter plus de moutons, elle fait recourt au prêt RMCR afin de pouvoir continuer son élevage de mouton. Elle a déjà bien remboursé les montants précédents et veux augmenter son fond de commerce  et ses revenus  afin de payer les frais médicaux et d’habillements des enfants.
texts.en:
Assétou is the person touching the sheep in the photo. She is 32 years old and is a member of the Tiéssiri group, made up of mostly women. She is Malian, married and the mother of six children, of which three are in school.

Assétou never went to school. She lives in Saalo and for 20 years she has been purchasing sheep at markets and raising them for eight months. She can earn 20,000F per month and resells the sheep in large markets.

She will use the RMCR loan to purchase more sheep so she can continue raising sheep. She has already paid back her previous loans. She is requesting the same amount in order to increase her business funds and her income in order to pay for her children’s medical expenses and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase less-expensive sheep to raise them and resell them after eight months.

loans.name: Amassagou B Group

texts.fr: Aiché est la femme qui  tient la corne du bélier en main, elle est malienne analphabète et âgée de 35ans. ELLE est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, deux filles et deux garçons, un garçon et une fille sont à l’école.  Les enfants sont âgés de 9 ans, 13, 16, et 20 ans.le mari de Aiché,pour gagner sa vie fait le  commerce d'habits (vente de vêtements et de tasses). Une femme courageuse et battante elle rembourse toujours ses emprunts. Elle utilisera ce prêt dans l’achat de mouton pour ses activités d’élevage qu’elle mène depuis 20ans. ELLE s’approvisionne sur le marché local de la zone et revend toujours dans sa zone. Son bénéfice mensuel l’aide à prendre en charge ces  besoins de la famille (l’éducation des enfants leur alimentation et leur santé . Aiché fait l’élevage des béliers par ce que c’est une activité convenable aux femmes pauvres .
texts.en: Aiché, the woman holding the ram's horn in the photo, is a 35-year-old illiterate Malian. She is married and the mother of four children (two girls and two boys), ages 9, 13, 16 and 20 years old. One boy and one girl are in school. Besides farming, Aiché's husband makes a living from a small shop, selling clothing and wash basins. Aiché is a brave and determined woman who always repays her loans. She will use this loan to buy rams for her sheep breeding business that she's been involved in for 20 years. Aiché likes ovine breeding because it's a reasonably good business for poor women. She shops at the local market in the area and always resells in her area. Her monthly income helps her to get ahead in life. This loan will help her earn income to meet the personal needs of her children (education and health care). Aiché's hopes and dreams are to be able to ensure a modest food supply for her family and a good education for her children.

loans.use: to breed sheep for eight months.

loans.name: Melina Jaquelina

texts.es:
Melina agradece el apoyo que le brinda Padecomsm a través de los créditos Kiva, ya que con ellos ha tenido  a su disposición materiales para preparar la venta de pupusas y prendes de vestir, la calidad del producto es mayor y tiene más clientes satisfechos, en cuanto a su familia cuenta que tienen un estilo de vida más confortable.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito porque con ellos puede mantener la continuidad de su negocio, lo invertirá en maíz, aderezos, bebidas, chocolate en tablilla, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, etc., para elaborar la venta d pupusas, el resto le servirá para comprar una nueva plancha industrial para mejorar la productividad y dar una mejor atención.
texts.en:
Melina is grateful for the support that PADECOMSM has given her through Kiva loans. Thanks to these loans, she has been able to keep in stock the materials she needs for preparing and selling pupusas and clothing. The quality of her product is better and her customers are more satisfied. Additionally, her family is able to have a more comfortable quality of life.

She needs another loan because this will allow her to maintain the continuity of her business. She will invest it in corn, seasonings, drinks, chocolate, cheese, shredded pork, oil, etc. in order to make and sell pupusas. The remaining money will be used to purchase a new industrial iron in order to improve her productivity and provide better attention to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in corn, seasonings, drinks, chocolate, cheese, shredded pork, oil, etc. in order to make and sell pupusas.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi, who is a 30-year-old hard-working man, lives in Ambrolauri district. He has a homemaker wife, parents and a school aged son.

The family members are involved in small agribusiness. In particular, they own 150 vines and nut trees. They sell harvested grapes, vines and nuts at the local market.

Giorgi was unable to get a stable job, and so he works as a private car technition. His existing income is not enough for a five member family, and Giorgi decided to start his own business. He applied for credit to MFO Credo, and was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting people to start or re-start businesses.

Giorgi wants to purchase all the required tools and machinery and open his own auto repair service. Because of his hard work and kind attitude toward clients, Giorgi has a long list of loyal costumers, and will get the chance to make his business activity more productive and profitable.

This credit will be a great support for the family. Giorgi is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to have his own business.

loans.use: to purchase all the required tools, and open an auto repair center.

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José, de 75 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, estubo acompañado y su primer pareja tuvo 4 hijos, luego se volvio a acompañar con una joven y con ella tiene una niña de 6 años de edad que empieza a ir a la escuela.

José, tiene una tienda desde hace 12 años, este negocio decidio colocarlo porque ya no puede trabajar en el campo sembrando granos básicos debido a su edad y considero que a traves de la tienda podia también generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta básicos como arroz, frjoles, azúcar, aceite para vender en la tienda, porque se acercan las festividades de fin de año y en esta época se vende más.

José, sueña con ver crecer a su hija y que estudie y se preparé academicamente.
texts.en:
José is 75 years old and studied up until second grade. He was in a relationship and his first partner had four children. Later he entered into a relationship with another woman, with whom he has a six-year-old daughter who is starting school.

José has had a store for 12 years. He first decided to start this business because he could no longer work in the fields planting basic grain crops, due to his age. He thought that with the store, he could generate income to cover the expenses of his family.

José needs the loan to purchase basic grocery products like rice, beans, sugar, and oil to sell in his store, because the end-of-year celebrations are approaching and during this season he sells more. José's dream is to see his daughter grow, study, and progress academically.

loans.use: to purchase basic grocery items like rice, beans, sugar, and oil to sell in his store.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, five and a half times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Haruna will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Haruna will be able to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a maize farmer from Bamiyayi village. As a Babban Gona member, Isah is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Isah can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Isah no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Isah hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
O sr Ernesto tem 27 anos de idade, casado e pai de dois filhos dos quais um frequenta a escola e outro ainda é menor de idade. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta ainda o seu irmão e a sua prima.
O valor de empréstimo será aplicado na compra de gás, tubos, filtros para revender  e sonha em ser empresário  e neste momento enfrenta dificuldades financeiras para concretizar o sonho.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 27 years old, married, and the father of two children. One of them goes to school, and the other one is still very young. Besides his two children, he still sustains his brother and his cousin.

With the requested amount, he will buy gas, pipes, and filters for resale. He dreams of becoming an businessman. RIght now, there are some financial obstacles in his way to realizing his dream.

loans.use: to buy gas, pipes, and filters to sell.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.pt:
O senhor Feliciano de 53 anos de idade é segurança de uma empresa do ramo agricola, casado pai de 6 filhos dos quais apenas 1 estuda os restantes já são maiores de idade sustenta 3 netos que vivem com ele na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar areia, cimento, pedra, aros e janelas para dar continuidade da sua obra tipo 4.
Planos para o futuro terminar a construção de sua casa, fazer uma barraca e iniciar um negocio como forma de reforçar a renda familiar.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e a insuficiência de fundos e que para supera-los conta com ajuda de sua esposa que tem machambas e reforça a alimentação familiar com os produtos da machamba e que ira solicitar mais emprestimos, com os anteriores creditos fez a actual casa com material convencional
texts.en:
Feliciano is 53 years old. He works as a security guard for an agricultural company. He is married, and the father of six children; only one of them goes to school, and the rest are adults now. He maintains three grandchildren who live with him in a house he owns.

With the requested amount, he will buy sand, cement, stones, window frames and windows to continue building his four-room house.

In the future, he plans to finish building his house, open a store, and start a business to strengthen the family's income.

He says that his biggest challenge is the lack of funding, and that his wife, who works the land, helps him to overcome them and feed the family with the food she grows. He will apply for more loans. With the previous ones, he built the house where he lives now, with traditional materials.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, stones, window frames and windows to continue building his four-room house.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a Palestinian entrepreneur. She lives in Gaza, where unemployment is very high. 10 years ago, Fadwa graduated from the university, where she studied media and press, and unfortunately, did not find a job.

Four years ago, Fadwa decided to open her own business, which is an educational center. Now, Fadwa has loyal and distinguished students.

Recently, Fadwa decided to go to Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) to take a USD loan that will enable her to buy new laptops for her educational center.

Fadwa dreams of being a professional, helping her family and also serving her country. Fadwa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new laptops for her educational center.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina , 42, has embraced farming after she married and lived in the community of San Miguel in Bohol. She has three children ages 13, 17 and 19. Her husband drives a tricycle to provide for his family.

Esterlina is working hard on her farm so she can pay the school fees for her children. Esterlina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay school fees. This loan will enable her to pay the school fees ahead of time and repay the loan from the income on her harvest.

In the future, Esterlina hopes to experience a comfortable lifestyle from a successful business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for school fees.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Esther has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Esther would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Esther can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Esther will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Esther is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family, and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married mother of five children, who all attend school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over 10 years, she has operated a business selling handbags from her home to friends and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business by opening a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase more handbags for resale.
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags for resale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from kadanya Biyar village. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Saratu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Saratu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Saratu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: James

texts.en:
This is James, who is 27 years old. He is in his fourth year at Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology. He is studying for a course for a bachelor of procurement and logistics management. He is ambitious and he wants to succeed in life.

He had started with a diploma certificate and now is finishing his degree. His dream is to be an example to his children and the young people in his rural village.

He has struggled with his school fees, as his father is a peasant farmer while his siblings are unemployed. Thus, with a Kiva loan, he will able to finish his degree.

loans.use: to pay for tuition costs and non-tuition expenses.

loans.name: Souka Group

texts.fr: Chantal est la responsable du groupe elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, le groupe de Chantal est à son 1er contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et prend l'engagement de respecter les modalités de paiement. Cette brave dame coût des habits et cela fait 25 ans qu'elle exerce ce métier. Elle a besoin du crédit pour acheter des rouleaux de tissus, des pagnes tissés et fonds de roulement. pour faire avancé son activité, Chantal est très accueillante et guide ses clientes dans leur choix de tissus et de modèle, par moment, elle va même livrée les tenues de ses clients à la maison. Après ses ventes, les bénéfices de Chantal lui permettra de continuer son activité et aussi de faire les dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Chantal is the group manager. She is married and the mother of three children. Chantal’s group is on its first loan contract with ACFIME and is committed to following the payment requirements. This courageous woman makes clothing and has being doing so for 25 years.

Chantal needs the loan to purchase rolls of fabric, traditional wrap-around cloths and to have an operating capital. To improve her business, Chantal is very welcoming and guides her clients through selecting fabric and patterns, and she even sometimes delivers her clients’ clothing to their homes.

After sales, Chantal’s profits will allow her to continue her business and also to cover her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of fabric, traditional wrap-around cloths, and to have an operating capital

loans.name: Benkadi N°Ii Group

texts.fr: NOUHOUM  est malien non scolarisé c'est lui qui a levé sa main sur la photo homme de principe très sérieux dans son travail il a toujours bien remboursé les prêts qu'il prend au RMCR. Agée de  48 ans, marié père de 11 enfants ; dont 1 scolarisé,sa  femme est ménagère. NOUHOUM  fait  l’élevage des moutons, Il prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour acheter  beaucoup  de béliers. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend  ses béliers  en ville.  Il exerce ce métier  il y a plus de 7 ans.  Le profit estimatif qu’il gagne par mois  peu valoir au moins à 20 000 fca ce qui lui permettant de subvenir à certains besoins de sa famille entre autre la nourriture, les habits les chaussures et la santé.Il est souvent confronté à certaines difficultés  de méventes  et  aux  coûts  chers  des frais de transport des béliers  mais il organise généralement  le voyage avec des éleveurs  de sa localité pour  relever les défis.
texts.en: Nouhoum is Malian and did not attend school. His hand is raised in the photo. He is a man of principle and takes his work seriously. He has always reimbursed the loans he borrows from RMCR. Aged 48, he is a married father of 11 children; one who is schooled and his wife is a housewife. Nouhoum raises sheep. He will purchase many rams with the loan from RMCR. He supplies himself in the surrounding fairs and resells his rams in town. He has been exercising his profession for more than 7 years. The estimated profit he earns per month is worth at least 20,000 FCA which enables him to provide certain needs to his family, among other things, food, his children's school fees, their clothes and shoes. He is often faced with difficulties of poor sales and the expensive costs of transportation of rams but he usually organizes the trip with his local farmers to meet the challenges.

loans.use: to raise sheep for ten months

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Mariam est la femme qui est devant la tasse remplit de fonio ; commerçante malienne âgé 41 ans marié et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles âgées de 8 à 17 ans dont une fille scolarisé.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de sa localité chaque semaine ,  ensuite elle revend sa marchandise dans la ville la plus proche; elle gagne au mois 10000 fcfa de bénéfice par semaine sur l’ensemble des ventes ; elle s’en sort bien, mais  pour élargie son activité commerciale elle a besoin un point de vente comme une maisonnette ; vu son incapacité de financement elle demande un service financier (prêt) au RMCR Mali dans le but de pouvoir augmenter son bénéfice pour survenu aux besoin familiales .Son rêve est d’avoir dans l’avenir   un bon magasin pour  stocker plus de produits.
texts.en:
Mariam is the lady who is behind the cup filled with fonio. She is a Malian lady who is 41 years old and married with five children; two boys and three girls aged between 8 and 17 and another girl who attends school.

Mariam buys stock from the local market every week, then she sells the goods in the nearby town. She is getting on well, but in order for her business to grow she needs somewhere from which to sell, like a stall.

Due to her lack of funds, she is asking RMCR Mali for a loan with the aim of being able to increase her profits so she can meet the families needs. Her dream is to have a nice shop in the future where she can stock more products.

loans.use: to stock fonio for eight months so it can be sold.

loans.name: Maria Patrocinia

texts.es:
María, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja vive en Estados Unidos y trabaja como mesero en un restaurante, aún no tienen hijos y ella vive con su mamá.

María, desde que tenía 7 años de edad, su mamá le enseño a elaborar hamacas y cuando se acompaño decidio seguir con la elaboración de este productos artesanal, el cual se convirtio en una de las fuentes de ingresos de su familia.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar una caja de hilo para tejer hamacas, porque quiere hacer varias hamacas para venderlas al por mayor.

María, sueña con tener un taller de elaboración de hamacas y ser la propietaria para poder generar empleos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
María is 22 years old, studied until high school, and is in a relationship. Her partner lives in the United States and works as a waiter at a restaurant. They do not have children yet, and she lives with her mother.

Beginning when María was seven years old, her mother taught her to make hammocks. When she entered into a relationship, she decided to continue making these artisanal products, and this became one of the family's sources of income.

María needs the loan in order to purchase a box of thread to weave hammocks, because she wants to make several hammocks in order to sell them wholesale. Her dream is to have a workshop for hammock weaving, and to be the owner of the business in order to generate employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a box of thread to weave hammocks.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a sari-sari store owner who lives in the town of San Dionisio in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has six children, two adults and four dependent children. Her husband works hard as a fisherman to provide for the needs of their children.

Marilyn sells basic household commodities from her sari-sari store. She is asking for a loan to improve her store. She will buy drinks, assorted food seasoning, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil and snack foods. In this way, Marilyn will be able to improve her earnings and augment her profit. In this way, she will be able to enhance her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy drinks, assorted food seasoning, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil and snack foods

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village. As a member of Babban Gona, Salamatu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.


Before joining Babban Gona, Salamatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Salamatu can store her maize, and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Salamatu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family, and in the end, hopes to use her increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ely Merary

texts.es:
Ely, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a la falta de apoyo de sus padres y la distancia; está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en construcción y ella es madre de dos jóvenes. 

Ely, tiene una tienda desde hace tres años, la coloco gracias a la motivación de su madre y de su padre; pero aparte de eso ella trabaja tres días a la semana en otra tienda, en donde le han apoyado para que ella se supere, mientras ella trabaja su esposo le ayuda a vender en su tienda cuando tiene tiempo. 

Ely, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, leche, café, sal, huevos y otros productos para poder generar más ingresos que le permitan ir creciendo poco a poco con el negocio. 

Ely, sueña con incrementar su inventario y que su tienda sea rentable y tener muchos clientes en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Ely is 34 and finished high school but couldn't continue her studies because of a lack of support from her parents and the distance. She lives with her partner who works in construction and is the mother of two children.

Ely has had a store for three years which she opened thanks to the motivation she received from her mother and father. But besides that she also works three days a week in another store where she has been supported in her efforts to get ahead. While she works her husband helps with sales in her store when he has time.

Ely needs this loan to buy more staples such as sugar, rice, beans, corn, oil, milk, coffee, salt, eggs and other products in order to generate more income which will allow her to continue growing her business little by little.

Ely hopes to increase her inventory and make her store profitable and have many customers in her community.

loans.use: to buy more staples such as sugar, rice, beans, corn, oil, milk, coffee, salt, eggs and other products.

loans.name: Sukartini

texts.en:
Sukartini is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver.

Sukartini has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story:

"My mother instilled in me the value of a 'Balinese woman,' including how to prepare temple offerings. I also took courses in the traditional art of silver."

"Right now I need capital to build up my stock for the final holiday season rush. I also plan to create new designs to add to my collection. Thank you for your support! It means a lot to me and my silversmiths."

Use the link below to view Sukartini's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4978

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver

loans.name: Mirian Jamileth

texts.es:
La señora Mirian de 25  años de edad, vive con su esposo y tienen dos hijos que depende de ambos, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Mirian está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abarrotería como arroz, azúcar, café, huevos, queso, leche, pan, etc. y también quiere comprar sandalias  y zapatos para emprender con este nuevo negocio y aprovechar la temporada de navidad.
Doña Mirian con el apoyo de este préstamo desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento y mejorar su calidad de vida ya que  viene la navidad y desea surtirlo para vender más y atender mejor a sus clientes.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Mirian is 25 years old, lives with her husband and they have two dependent children. For several years she has earned a living through her grocery selling business. She is a hard working woman with a desire to succeed.

Mirian is applying for a loan to buy grocery store products such as rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, cheese, milk and bread. She also wants to buy sandals and shoes in order to start this new business and take advantage of the Christmas season.

Mirian with the support of this loan wants to supplement her financing needs and improve her quality of life as it comes up to Christmas. She wants to buy stock to sell more and better serve her customers. Her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2015.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, cheese, milk and bread for her business.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en:
Sadaf is very well atuned to the matters of her husband. She resides in a small area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 27 years of age, and manages her home along with her husband in peace.

For some time, they have been facing hard times, as her husband is not able to earn enough due to his taxi's breakdown, and he needs to get the taxi repaired. For that very reason, Sadaf applied for a loan from KIVA and it's field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her family's financial issues can be resolved, and they again can live the life they used to live.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's taxi repair.

loans.name: Wo Fee Ekome Group

texts.en:
The Wo Fee Ekome Group is applying for a loan to develop and grow their businesses, improve their living conditions, and help their families cope. 

The group is coordinated by Bismark, 45, who is married and has five children. He sells lubricant at his residence. With this loan, he will buy lubricant to service cars. 

The other members are Christiana, 37, who sells used clothing, and Brigdet, 36, who will also invest in buying underwear.

loans.use: to buy lubricant to service cars.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.en:
Efrain is a mason and the owner of his house. He is married and he has 3 kids

He needs a loan to pay for the gas installation at his house He is doing a lot of work to give his family better life conditions. He hopes you can help him because he is the only support for his family and the gas at his house will allow him to save money

loans.use: to pay for the gas installation at his house.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet es habitante del departamento de Estelí. A sus 46 años de edad, es comerciante y propietaria de una pulpería, es una mujer inteligente y con infinitos deseos de superación, por esto emprendió su negocio que ya tiene dos años de haberse establecido y al que dedica su tiempo completo. Ella acudió a MiCrédito para realizar su primer préstamo y a través del  programa kiva el préstamo le fue concedido, el dinero facilitado gracias a Kiva y MiCrédito, le sirvió en la compra de materiales para la construcción de un servicio higiénico, lo cual mejoró mucho su condición de vida.
Actualmente Yaneth ha decidido realizar su segundo préstamo, para invertir con ayuda de su marido en la compra de productos para su pulpería y en otro tipo de mercadería que pretende incluir en su negocio para la temporada navideña,y comprar ropa, zapatos, etc. 
Al finaliza el préstamo piensa continuar trabajando e invertir más  en su negocio y en las mejoras de  su hogar,  sonriente y con una mirada soñadora, asegura que aún está empezando y esta entera con la proyección de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Yanet is a resident of the department of Estelí. At 46 years old, she is a merchant and the owner of a small general store. She is a smart woman with an infinite desire to progress. For this reason she started her business, which has now been established for two years and is where she works full time.

She came to MiCrédito for her first loan, and through the Kiva program she was able to receive it. The loan, facilitated by Kiva and MiCrédito, allowed her to purchase materials for the construction of a bathroom, which improved her quality of life a great deal.

Currently, Yanet has decided to take out a second loan in order to invest, with the help of her husband, in the purchase of products for her general store and in other types of merchandise that she hopes to include in her business for the Christmas season, as well as clothing, shoes, etc.

When she finishes this loan, she hopes to continue working and invest more in her business and in improvements to her home. With a smile and a face full of hope, she assures that she's just getting started and is fully committed to the growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 32 years old and she lives with her husband, three children and parents-in-law in the frontier village Gosh of Tavush region. She got married very early and started farming and agricultural work with her husband and his family.

Liana is engaged in poultry and land cultivation. She sells a lot of poultry and eggs, and also vegetables such as potatoes, beans and carrots. Additionally, she sells fruit from her garden’s harvest such as apples, nuts and persimmons. Having a large family and countless needs, Liana has decided to make her farm more robust with cattle. With this goal, she is asking for a Kiva loan for the purchase of two cows for her farm. With spring coming, this will provide milk to sell and an opportunity for the sale of some dairy products as well.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for her farm, to provide milk and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a young man who is studying at one of the public universities in the Irbid. He lives in Ramtha which is seriously affected by the political situation in Syria. He is ‎majoring in business administration. His father had to find another job after retirement from ‎the military as the retirement salary was not enough to support the family. Now Mohammad is ‎applying for a loan to pay for the university fees and buy the books he needs.‎

loans.use: to cover his semester fees

loans.name: Sanije

texts.en: Sanije is a mother of seven children; five daughters and two sons. Her husband is employed in a factory but with very little salary, which makes it difficult to provide for such a large family. Sanije is involved in agriculture to help provide for her family. She has 35 sheep that she is able to use the milk and dairy products from for her family and to sell for a profit. At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase 10 more sheep and to renovate her stable. She is very confident that the loan will allow her to be able to increase her income even more and provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 10 more sheep and to renovate her stable to increase her income to pay for better education for her chidren

loans.name: Las Rositas Cumplidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSITAS CUMPLIDAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sabina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, venta de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de poleras, servicio de transporte, venta de leche y queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sabina es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de conservas, abarrotes y gaseosas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Las Rositas Cumplidas" communal association is beginning their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a council, of which Sabina is the President. The businesses run by the members of the communal association are varied, and include: fish sales, sweater sales, general store, jersey sales, transportation services, and cheese and milk sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners like Sabina. She says that she has been a part of Pro Mujer for six months, after joining through the invitation of a loan officer from the organization. Currently, she has a general store, and she says she learned this business through her own initiative.

She will use the loan to increase her working capital and purchase jams, groceries, and sodas in bulk, which she will buy from vendors in the city of El Alto and then sell in her store. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married with two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health services that the organization offers.

loans.use: to purchase jams, groceries, and soda in bulk.

loans.name: Fortuna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTUNA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de ropa deportiva,  tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de mantas de vicuña, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio confección y venta de ropa deportiva; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace dieciséis años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de tela e hilos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la confección,  lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Fortuna is starting its second cycle with Pro Mujer, under the Panamericana Regional Office. This group comprises eight members, and Cristina is President of its board of directors. The members of this communal bank work in a variety of businesses, such as selling vegetables, selling athletic clothing, running a general store, selling vicuna blankets, and selling jackets.

The loan they are requesting will benefit Cristina's group of small-business entrepreneurs. Cristina says she joined Pro Mujer through a friend who was already a client of this organization and invited her. She currently works making and selling athletic clothing. She says she learned this business from her aunt, and decided to venture out on her own sixteen years ago.

She will use her portion of this loan to increase her capital by purchasing fabrics and thread from the wholesale suppliers in the city of El Alto. She will then sew her items and sell them at her retail space. Her work allows her to generate income to support her family financially. She is in a common-law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she is interested in health and enjoys the training sessions the organization offers on this subject.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric and thread.

loans.name: Beatriz Virginia

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijas de 12 y 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de carteras.
Ella es constante, amable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ donde se realiza la feria comercial más grande del país, los días jueves y domingo, desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 12 grados centígrados.
Beatriz es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en reuniones familiares y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de carteras femeninas como, bolsos, carteras para el trabajo, bolsas de mano tipo sobre y otros, inició su negocio vendiendo ambulantemente para luego alquilar un puesto de venta en la feria,  “Las carteras son un accesorio importante en el vestuario femenino, El tipo de cartera describe la personalidad de quien la porta…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque cuenta con mercadería variada. La ventaja de su negocio es que está ubicado en un lugar comercial, la desventaja es que no cuenta con puesto propio de venta. Su sueño es vender por mayor, ella desea comprar variedad de carteras femeninas por mayor para abastecer su negocio por la fiesta de navidad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 14 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Beatriz solicita un préstamo para comprar variedad de carteras femeninas por mayor para abastecer su negocio por la fiesta de navidad.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a 38-year-old woman, married and has two children aged 12 and 13. Her business is in the sale of bags. She is persevering, kind and hard working. Her business is in the zone "16 de julio" where the largest commercial market in the country is carried out on Thursdays and Sundays. It takes place from the very early hours of the morning and in cold and dry weather with a maximum temperature of 12 degrees Celsius. 

Beatriz is dark-skinned with long black hair and is of short stature. Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks at family gatherings, and she speaks Spanish for general purposes and for her business. Her life is shared with her husband, who works in trade, and with her children, who study in school. They live in a rented room made of adobe that has drinkable water, electricity and a sewage system. 

Her work is in the sale of women's bags, such as purses, briefcases, clutches and others. She began her business selling as a street vendor to then later rent a stall in the market.

"Bags are an important accessory in a woman's wardrobe. The type of bag describes the personality of the person that carries it," she commented. 

Her business is successful bcause she has a variety of merchandise. Her dream is to sell wholsale, and she wants to purchase a variety of wholesale women's bags to supply her business for the Christmas holiday. This is the first sequence of loans in 14 years with the institution that carries out this activity, and because of this Beatriz is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of wholesale women's bags to supply her business for the Christmas holiday.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of wholesale women's bags to supply her business for the Christmas holiday.

loans.name: Elena Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Elena está conformado por tres mujeres laboriosas, coordinado por Rosa de 59 años de edad, madre soltera de un joven de 21 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de nacatamales desde hace cinco años y solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento a los socios de kiva, para la compra de carne, papa, maíz, arroz y vegetales. Una de sus metas es poner una comidería. Las otras socias del grupo son Jessika de 35 años propietaria de una pulpería y Denisse de 30 años quien se dedica a la venta de pollo.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Elena is made up of three laborious women. It is coordinated by Rosa. She is 59 years old and a single mother of a 21 year old son.

She has worked selling tamales for the past 5 years, and she is requesting a loan for the first time from the members of Kiva to buy meat, potatoes, corn, rice, and vegetables. One of her goals is to start a small restaurant.

The other members of the group are Jessika who is 35 years old who is the owner of a general store, and Denisse who is 30 years old who works selling chicken.

loans.use: to buy meat, potatoes, corn, rice, and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Valentina

texts.es:
María, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está acompañada, junto a su pareja tiene cinco hijos que ya están grandes y trabajan y estudian.

María, junto a su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y crían cerdos, desde que se acompañaron y decidieron tener hijos, acordaron que trabajarían en sus propios negocios.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos y concentrado para engordarlos, de esa manera en un par de meses tendrá otros ingresos para el sustento diario de su familia. 

El sueño de María, es mejorar cada día sus ingresos y darles lo que necesita sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 36 and completed the first grade. She lives with her husband with whom she has five children who are now older and work or study. Maria and her husband farm and raise pigs together. Since they moved in together and decided to have children they agreed that they would each work in their own businesses.

Maria needs this loan to buy pigs and feed to fatten them up. That way, in a couple of months, she will have more income to cover her family's daily needs.

Maria's dream it to keep increasing her income and give her children what they need.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to fatten them up.

loans.name: Louines

texts.fr: Louines a 29 ans et vit avec sa femme et ses deux enfants à Sarthe, Il gère une petite épicerie et vend des produits alimentaires depuis six ans, Il demande un microcrédit pour investir dans son épicerie et diversifier les produits qu'il y vend. A l'avenir, il espère gagner des revenus plus élevés.
texts.en: Louines is 29 and lives with his wife and two children in Sarthe. He runs a small grocery store and has been selling food products for 6 years. He is asking for a microcredit to invest in his grocery store and to diversify the products he sells. In the future, he hopes to make higher profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar and boxes of spaghetti.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail sells clothes and she is the mother of 2 daughters. Abigail is living in her parents house and she helps them with the expenses and the chores.

She needs a loan to buy merchandise for her business, since Christmas is coming. She will take advantage of that to increase her sales and to make more money. She hopes you can help her, because she buys good clothes, so she deserves a chance

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer from Daura village. As a Babban Gona member, Hauwa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Hauwa can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hauwa no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Hauwa hopes to realize better yields. She plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 32-year-old married man from Gaza City, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Fadi has an auto repair work shop in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Fadi took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new tool for his auto repair shop. He hopes that this new tool will enable him to increase his sales and customers so that eventually he can save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new tool for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Sile

texts.en:
Sile is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sile would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Sile can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

As a Babban Gona member, Sile will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. Sile is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Samaila is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is maize farmer from Kwankwani village. As a member of Babban Gona, he is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna can now store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

Yohanna is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Maria Estenia

texts.es:
María, de 33 años de edad, está acompañada, su pareja le ayuda en el negocio de destazo que tienen y son padres de 2 niños de 7 y 8 años de edad. 

María, es una mujer trabajadora, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para vender y para destazar, es muy conocida en su comunidad debido a la negocio que tiene, su pareja le ayuda para destazar y para repartir la carne y además se encarga de recolectar el dinero que queda pendiente por el producto que venden y las personas lo pagan después.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos para la venta, porque es de ese negocio de donde generan los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

María, sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y ayudarlos para que estudien una carrera universitaria y puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old and in a relationship. Her partner helps her with the butcher shop business that they have. They are the parents of two children who are seven and eight years old. María is a hardworking woman who breeds pigs to sell and to butcher. She is very well known in her community thanks to her business. Her partner helps her with the butchering and with cutting up the meat, and he also collects the money owed by customers.

María needs this loan to purchase pigs to sell, because this business generates the income necessary for covering the needs of her family. María's dream is to improve the quality of life of her children and help them to go to university and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to sell.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, 40 years old, is a farmer in the corn fields. She lives in Kang Meas district, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hard-working mother of three children. Her husband is also a farmer who has worked in the corn fields for more than 10 years. They can make a net profit of approximately USD 4 a day.

At this time, Phalla is facing a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy some farming materials, but she can’t afford them. Therefore, she would like to get a Kiva loan and she has decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to buy some corn seeds to use in her corn fields.

She is thankful to all lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy some corn seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Mafia

texts.en:
Mafia is a 30-year-old married mother of 4 children. She is working hard to fulfil their needs, including food, healthcare, clothing, and education.  

Along with her husband, Mafia has been practicing agriculture. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with support from the Kashf Foundation.

In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Mafia has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her grow more crops which will ultimately generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Elmer Alexander

texts.es:
Elmer, de 38 años de edad, es albañil, creció con sus padres quienes le formaron  y le dieron todo lo necesario para su educación; aprendió los trabajos de construcción gracias a su padre y adquirió experiencia, hoy en día se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, la cual sirve para llevar el sustento diario para su familia y también cumplir con sus obligaciones crediticias.

Elmer, se dedica a la albañilería desde que tenía 19 años actividad, decidido continuar con esa actividad porque le generaba buenos ingresos; también su esposa le da un aporte económico a su familia, pues ella se dedica a la venta en un cafetín en la escuela de su comunidad.

Elmer, necesita el dinero para comprar herramientas de construcción, de esta manera podrá realizar con más facilidad su trabajo y tendrá mejores ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. 

Elmer, sueña con tener una vivienda amplia e instalaciones más adecuadas para el almacenamiento de leña y adquirir un vehículo.
texts.en:
Thirty-eight year old Elmer is a bricklayer. He grew up with his parents who raised him and gave him what he needed for his education. He learned construction work thanks to his father, and gained experience. Today that has become his main source of income, which serves to bring daily sustenance home to his family and also to fulfill their loan obligations.

Elmer has been doing masonry since he was 19 years old. He decided to continue with this work because he made good income. His wife also contributes financially to the family since she is a vendor in the community school cafeteria.

Elmer needs money to purchase construction tools so that he will be able to perform his work more easily and make more income to satisfy his family's needs.

Elmer dreams of having a spacious home, a vehicle, and more appropriate storage facilities to store firewood.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de soya, servicio de transporte libre, venta de refrescos, venta de comida, venta de pan, venta medicamentos naturales. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de soya; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al ayudar a su cuñada y decide implementar su propio negocio hace varios años; en la actualidad quien le ayuda en la venta de soya es su hija.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de soya por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud  y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Flor Naciente [Budding Flower] communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer [Pro Woman], as part of the Pan-American Regional Office. The bank is comprised of eight members and is managed by a Board of Directors, of which Juana is President. The businesses that the members run are varied and include selling soy beans, soft drinks, food, bread, natural medicines, and offering private transportation services.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises, including Juana's. She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer upon the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently runs a business selling soy beans. She learned this trade from her sister-in-law and decided to start her own business several years ago. Her daughter currently helps her with the sales.

The loan she will take out is for increasing her capital (buying soy wholesale), which she will get from the vendors in the city of El Alto. She will then market them in her sales stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health center and the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase soy beans wholesale.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a diligent mother of three children. She is the wife of a taxi driver. He works day and night so that he can earn enough to fulfill the needs of his family. He wants to provide quality education and a bright future to his children.

Currently, the engine of his rickshaw has stopped working, due to which he is unable to continue his work. He is facing many financial issues. Because of this, he is unable to pay for monthly bills and the school fee of his children and cannot fulfill their daily basic needs.

Shahida wants to help her husband. Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will be helpful for her husband to continue generating income. She is thankful to KIVA and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo, de 35 años de edad, está casado, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la comunidad.
  
Eduardo, se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño, cuenta con mucho conocimiento y experiencia gracias a la enseñanza de su padre, actualmente se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles de esta forma puede satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. 

Eduardo, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos para la agricultura y comprar herramientas para sembrar hortalizas.

Eduardo, sueña con tener un sistema de riego en sus parcelas, para trabajar en época de verano y que le facilite la plantación de cultivos hortícolas.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 35 years-old, married, and has two children who go to school in the community.

Eduardo has been working in farming since he was a child. He has a great deal of knowledge and experience, thanks to the teachings of his father. He currently grows basic grains such as corn and beans, and in this way he is able to meet the needs of his family.

Eduardo needs the loan to purchase agriculture supplies and to buy tools for planting vegetables.

He dreams of having an irrigation system on his plots so that he can work in the summer season and in order to facilitate planting vegetable crops.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and to buy tools for planting vegetables.

loans.name: Mwarapitu

texts.en:
Mwarapitu is a married woman and a mother of three children. Two of them attend school and one hasn't yet attained school-going age. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For over two years she has been operating a grocery business, selling fruit and green vegetables at the market to the general public. Her aspirations are to buy a fridge, as her major challenge is food preservation.

Mwarapitu is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to buy sacks of tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale and fruit to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to have access to loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy sacks of tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Financial constraints and both the desire for a better life and good quality education for her 6 children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged Saeeda to start her livestock business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Saeeda is 45 years old and she is married. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices and then raises and sells them in the market for higher prices. She makes enough from her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income.

Saeeda needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR in order to purchase more animals and increase her sales.

Saeeda is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and increase her sales.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Joshua has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Joshua would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Joshua can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Joshua will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Joshua is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Aminu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Aminu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Aminu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Aminu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Rosas 25 De Julio 2015 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS 25 DE JULIO 2015” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), venta de pollos, venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de cajas para medidor de luz, venta de frescos, venta de carne de res, venta de salchipapa, venta de papa. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por una promoción de la institución que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cajas de medidor de luz; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando en empresa e implemento su propio negocio hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de cajas de medidor de luz por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferreterías de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración de cajas de medidor, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Roses of the 25th of July, 2015 ” communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer [Pro Woman], as part of the Pan-American Regional Office. The bank is comprised of nine members and is managed by a Board of Directors, of which Sonia is President. The businesses that the members run are varied and include selling the following: dehydrated potatoes, chickens, food, vegetables, light meter boxes, fresh juices, beef, potatoes, and salchipapa [a dish made of fried potatoes and sausage].

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-enterprises including Sonia's. She says that this is the first time she has been involved in Pro Mujer and that she joined because of a promotion the institution did in her area. She currently runs a business selling light meter boxes. She learned this trade working in a company and started her own business several years ago.

Her portion of the loan will be to increase her capital (to purchase the parts for light meter boxes wholesale), which she will get in the hardware stores of the city of El Alto. After producing them she will market them in her sales stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially since she is single and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase light meter boxes wholesale.

loans.name: Lozane

texts.en:
Lozane is a 31 year old, married, Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family, helping them live in good conditions. He has worked as a car dealer since 2013.

Today, given that her children are still attending school, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for their school fees. The parents’ only target is to provide them with a good educational path until graduation and help them be able to get good jobs that will give them a good income.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en:
Hamad is a Syrian citizen. He is 28, and a married father of one child.

Hamad has been working as a land space engineer for ten years with a limited monthly salary. He is working hard to develop his own business so that he can improve his family's living.

To take this step forward, Hamad has to buy a special land space measuring machine, but he needs financial support since he can't save the cost of it from his salary. That's why he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. He will invest his acquired loan in buying the necessary requested tool, and start his own business for a better income and better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a special land space measuring machine to start his own business.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ayuba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ayuba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ayuba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hagai

texts.en:
Hagai is a married man with children living in Fort Portal-Uganda. He operates a boutique selling new clothes and has been in business for two years.

Hagai does not complain about the progress of the business because he has got many customers and made friends. In spite of this he is faced with a challenge of limited capital to buy new stock for Christmas as clothes are very expensive.

He desires to have a bigger boutique with the latest fashions and designs. He is now requesting a loan to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Habila would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest in order to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing.
