With Babban Gona’s support, Habila will now store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Habila now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members and he would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa is a maize farmer from Bamiyayi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Inusa is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Inusa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Inusa can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Inusa is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shahzad

texts.en:
Day by day increasing expenditures compelled Shahzad to initiate her own business selling animals. She is a 38 year old, married woman and has been doing business with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 5 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
Barnabas is maize farmer from Ma'aji village. As a member of Babban Gona, Barnabas is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Barnabas would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Barnabas can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Barnabas is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Lado village. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Yakubu can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yakubu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Yakubu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en: Chenda’s group live in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia.  Chenda makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a young mother. She has carried responsibility since she was very young. Now Ibtesam has proved that she ‎can handle any difficulties and she is able to stand in front of obstacles without giving up. ‎

Ibtesam lives with her two kidsand her husband, who works as a policeman with a low income, in Ajloun in the north of ‎Jordan. Her youthful spirit made Ibtesam work hard to help her husband and provide her small family with a comfortable life. She started buying cleaning materials and air fresheners from the factories, then she packs them and sells them. ‎

Ibtesam started with a small quantity of products because she didn't have enough money, but when she saw that her business was ‎working well she decided to make more products to sell. That is why she is applying for a loan to help her buy more ‎cleaning materials and air fresheners to increase her income and be able to help her husband more and more.‎

‎

loans.use: buy more ‎cleaning materials and air fresheners to sell.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer from Daura village. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Haruna can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Haruna no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Haruna hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 34 years old. She is the mother of three children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a crockery shop for many years near his house and the business is operating very well.

According to the customer’s demand he wants to keep crockery stock in demand for several occasions. He does not want to refuse any products and disappoint any of his respected customers. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy the required crockery for his shop.

She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that her husband will successfully fulfill requests for any item and satisfy his customers.

Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's crockery business.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Liman village. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Yakubu can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yakubu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Yakubu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Saadeh

texts.en:
Saadeh is 24 years old and lives in Baqaa with his parents. He is working hard to provide a good life for his parents and to help his ‎siblings with their education. He does not want to see them in need of anything.

Saadeh started his own business when he ‎stopped his education which he was not able to complete because of his family's financial situation. He rented a barbershop, and he is happy with his work.

Now Saadeh is applying for a loan to buy more barber tools, do more promotion to attract more people and develop and expand his ‎shop more and more.

Saadeh is thinking of buying his own barber shop in the near future to expand the business even more.‎

loans.use: to buy more barber tools, do more promotion and develop and expand his ‎shop more and more.

loans.name: Awurade Ne Me Hewfo Group

texts.en:
The “Awurade ne me hewfo”group will start its fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is comprised of five members and it's led by a board of directors with Beatrice as the president. The businesses of the members of this group are diverse, such as jewelry sales, doughnut sales, lubricant sales and a grocery store.

The loan will benefit the small business owners, including Beatrice. She states this is the fourth time she will be part of ID-Ghana. She joined after being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. Beatrice currently sells jewelry, a business she started 17 years ago with her family's support.

She will use the loan to increase her capital (to buy jewelries) which she will buy from the wholesalers of Apaapi market of chorkor. She will sell the jewelries in her point of sales. This business allows her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has two children.

When asked why she likes ID-Ghana, she answers that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy jewelry and sell to customers.

loans.name: Norma Rubidia

texts.es:
Norma, de 32 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y muy solidaria con las personas de su comunidad y los rededores, creció con sus padres y sus hermanos, quienes se han dedicado toda la vida a realizar trabajos de agricultura y ganadería, de esta manera su padre ha podido apoyarle en los estudios hasta graduarse como doctora en medicina, ahora ha implementado su propio consultorio médico, en el cual presta servicios de consulta general. 

Norma, tiene 2 años de prestar sus servicios en su consultorio médico, tiene muchas personas que la recomiendan y de esta manera ella puede ayudar a satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y cumplir con sus obligaciones.

Norma, necesita el préstamo para comprar medicamentos para la venta, porque aparte de dar consultas también vende medicina y de esta manera dará un mejor servicio a sus pacientes, porque los que requieran un medicamento podrán adquirirlo en su mismo establecimiento. 

Norma, sueña con mejorar y ampliar su casa y también sueña con tener un vehículo que le sirva para viajar de su casa a su consultorio.
texts.en:
Norma, 32 years old, is known for being a hard worker and very supportive of people in her community and the surroundings. She grew up with her parents and her siblings, who have worked in agriculture and cattle raising all their lives. This way her father was able to help her with her studies until she graduated as a medical doctor. She now has started her own clinic where she practices general medicine.

Norma has been offering her services in her clinic for two years. She has many people who recommend her and that's how she can help meet the needs of her family and fulfill her duties.

Norma needs the loan to buy medicines to sell because, besides providing consults, she also sells medicines. This way she will provide a better service to her patients because those who need medicine will be able to acquire it in her own clinic.

Norma dreams of upgrading and expanding her house and she also dreams of having a vehicle that she can use to commute from her house to her clinic.

loans.use: to buy medicines to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a hardworking, 58 year old woman. She is successfully running a small general store. She has become popular in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough to meet the expenses of her children.

Currently, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers to generate a healthier source of income.

She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to the maximum customers for generating a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer from Bakutaje village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Usman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Usman can now store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price at a premium of up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Usman no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Usman hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Murtala has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Murtala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Murtala can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Murtala will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Murtala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is a 38-year-old married mother of two, who has been working as a hairdresser and make-up artist for nineteen years.

In 2012, Aline established her current business to support her family and help her husband in covering their children's increasing needs. Her long experience in this domain gave her customers' trust and support.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to add extra closets and mirrors in her salon and purchase newly released beauty cosmetics which are requested by her customers.

This is Aline's fifth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, her previously acquired loans were invested successfully in developing her business and she proved to be a borrower in good standing.

Aline is very optimistic about this loan, just like the previously acquired loans, since she managed to invest them in a successful way. She will work hard to keep on developing her business to make sure that she can stay capable of providing her children the best education and provide for their living needs.

loans.use: to change her salon's interior design, buy new make-up tools and newly released collections that are highly requested to develop her business and satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a beauty salon business, providing services to neighbors and friends from home. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanajuma dreams of opening another business like a retail shop in the future.

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting , she wants to purchase stocks of salon items including hair chemicals, shampoo, braids etc.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of salon items including hair chemicals, shampoo, braids etc.

loans.name: Lornah

texts.en:
Lornah is a 24 years old and supports one person in her family.

She sells fruit and vegetables, a business she has been doing for the last 10 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 18,000.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase additional stock of fruit and vegetables.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Hamdah

texts.en:
Hamdah is a 21-year-old married mother of 3, living in Dair Alla. Due to her poor financial situation, she started selling household supplies 2 years ago to help her husband ‎cover the needs and expenses of their children.

Today Hamdah is acquiring a Youth Loan to increase her product inventory with more kitchen and household supplies so she can ‎serve more customers. She is a very ambitious and hardworking woman who is managing her business well and becoming well-known in her ‎region.

Hamdah hopes to expand her business in the future in order to increase her income and provide her family with ‎decent living conditions. ‎

loans.use: to increase her product inventory with more kitchen and household supplies.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is 32, and resides with her husband in a small town of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is very energetic and manages her clothes stitching business with her excellent communication skills.

With these qualities Rizwana carters to a lot of orders at a time but now she thinks that she requires another machine to get her stitching done with effectiveness and efficiency. Therefore she applied for a Kiva loan to help herself proceed with her orders in less time.

She is obliged to the Kiva team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her tailoring services business.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Xinavane distrito de Manhiça província de Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar na Hluvuku em 2008, este é o seu 10º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo: feijão e amendoim para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negócio e adquirir uma viatura. O seu maior desafio é concluir a sua obra de residência.
texts.en:
Esperança comes from Xinavane, district of Manhiça, province of Maputo. She's 42 years old. She's in a common law marriage and has four children who attend school. She's not responsible for anyone else.
She started working with Hluvuku in 2008. This is her 10th loan with Hluvuku. With it she intends to increase turnover in her business by purchasing beans and peanuts so that she can meet her customers' needs.
In the future she intends to expand her business and buy a vehicle. Her biggest challenge is finishing the construction of her home.

loans.use: to purchase beans and peanuts so she can meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ali would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Ali can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later on in the season when he can obtain the best price of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ali no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Ali hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old, married man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support. Mohammad has a grocery store in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of the latest conflict.

Mohammad took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new goods and inventory for his grocery store. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to open a second branch.

loans.use: to buy new goods and inventory for his grocery store.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, tiene como fuente de ingresos la venta de sorbete, está practicando está actividades desde hace cinco años, tiene un horario de diez de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, su mayor ventaja es que en la zona es muy reconocido y los clientes prefieren sus productos y buen servicio que brinda. Edwin ya ha formado su propia familia, vive con su esposa y una pequeña hija, él es el único que trabaja para sostener su hogar, tiene otros ingresos producto de ayuda familiar.
El crédito que solicita en Padecomsm le servirá exclusivamente para comprar una refrigeradora en la que podrá almacenar mayor cantidad de sorbete, también dará mantenimiento a una motocicleta que utiliza para realizar sus actividades, el objetivo de Edwin es seguir trabajando para progresar y darle a su familia mejores circunstancias de vida.
Dentro de los sueños que él tiene está tener un local propio para su negocio y continuar vendiendo sorbete de forma ambulante para contar con nuevos clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Edwin earns a livelihood by selling ice cream. He has been in this line of work for five years. His work hours are from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. His biggest advantage is the fact that he's very well-known in the area and the customers prefer his products and the good service he provides. Edwin has already started his own family. He lives with his wife and a young daughter, and he's the sole breadwinner of the household. He has additional income due to help from his family.
The loan he requests from Padecomsm will be exclusively used to purchase a refrigerator in which he'll be able to store a larger amount of ice cream, and also to do maintenance on a motorcycle that he uses in his business. Edwin's goal is to keep on working so that he can make progress and improve his family's living conditions.
One of his dreams is to have a proper venue for his business and continue selling ice cream as a traveling vendor in order to gain new satisfied customers.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to store more ice cream and to maintain a motorcycle that he uses in his business.

loans.name: Mana's Group

texts.en:
Mana is an enterprising and charming lady standing to the right hand side in the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Banarpal, Odisha, India. She has a family of three, consisting of her husband and her daughter. Mana is a grocer by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and fulfill all the basic necessities.

The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend to nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is a very concerned lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation.

So, in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group member, is requesting a loan amount of 40,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and incorporate water pipes to it to increase her convenience.

The loan amount will ultimately help her to safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet in her home and incorporate water pipes to it to increase her convenience.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer from Tube village. As a Babban Gona member, she is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest time, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Saratu can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until later on in the season when she can obtain the best price of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time.

Thanks to the support of Babban Gona’s marketing services, Saratu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Saratu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman and a mother of four children, three of whom are in school and one of whom is still young. She’s a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Amina owns a cafe which she has operated for three years, selling from home to neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from others in the same business and her aspirations are to start another business in the near future.

Amina is borrowing this loan to buy food for her cafe during this festive season. She is grateful for this opportunity that will help her very much. She joined Yehu to have access to loans which will help her expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food for her cafe during this festive season.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village. As a member of Babban Gona, he is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support Nuhu has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at harvest time when prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Now, with Babban Gona’s support, he can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time.

Nuhu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Damayanti's Group

texts.en:
Damayanti, standing to the left hand side in the photograph, is a humble and simple lady. She hails from a small village of Banarpal, Odisha, India. Damayanti is a married lady and is a blessed mother of two sons who are currently studying in a primary school. Her household income is very low, and the income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses.

For this reason, she was never able to afford to build a toilet at her home. The absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible enough, as she can sense the danger of crime, animal bites, and molestation.

Therefore, she, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 40,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a well-equipped and hygienic toilet and install a commode and shower in it.

Your loan will help her family to enjoy good health and promote cleanliness in the community. Damayanti is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help her and her family.

loans.use: to build a well-equipped and hygienic toilet and install a commode and shower in it.

loans.name: Tuni's Group

texts.en:
Tuni, standing to the extreme right hand side in the photograph, is a simple and sensible lady who hails from a very poor and low-income household from a small village of Banarpal, Odisha, India. She is a married lady and resides with her husband and two sons and two daughters. Her husband is the sole earner in her family and works very hard to be capable enough to let ends meet for her family. The income earned by her husband is only hand to mouth for them.

Unfortunately, Tuni does not have an appropriate toilet facility at her home and has to walk long distances in order to relieve herself in dense bushes late at night and early in the evening. She finds this practice very dangerous, as she feels the risk of insect and animal bites and she is vulnerable to crimes.

In order to restore her privacy and maintain proper hygiene, Tuni, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to install a commode and a hand pump, and build a toilet in her house.

Your loan will help Tuni to enjoy a healthy and disease-free life. She is eagerly awaiting your generous hearts to help her.

loans.use: to install a commode and a hand pump, and build a toilet in her house.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Sha Labari village. As a Babban Gona member, he is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Ibrahim can now store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain the best price at a premium of up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Mamilata's Group

texts.en:
Mamilata, standing to the right hand side in the photograph, is a mother of two children. She, her husband, and her children reside in a small village of Banarpal, Odisha, India. Every month she is forced to fork out a certain amount of money towards her family’s medical expenses as a result of the sanitation crisis they face.

Like many Indians, Mamilata and her family still do not have access to modern sanitation, and are forced to defecate in the open. Open defecation is disastrous, as it is impossible to keep human feces away from crops, wells, food, and children. According to studies, hundreds of children die every year due to preventable sanitary-related diseases. Lack of sanitation facilities also means trekking at least a kilometer to relieve themselves. And women like Mamilata bear the brunt, as they are mostly attacked and assaulted when they step out early in the morning or late in the evening.

In order to improve their sanitation facilities, Mamilata, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 40,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to construct a toilet at home and install a hand pump.

Your loan will help Mamilata and her family to improve the quality of their lives.

loans.use: to construct a toilet at home and install a hand pump.

loans.name: Gabriela Julissa

texts.es:
Gabriela, es una joven de veinte y tres años de edad, muy entusiasta y dedicada a su vida académica, ella está en quinto año de la Licenciatura en Contabilidad, dado que le apasionan los números y el trabajo con ejercicios económicos, ella cuenta principalmente con la ayuda de su esposo y sus padres, como un ingreso extra ayuda a una hermana en su negocio. 
Ella ha descubierto en Kiva junto MiCrédito una oportunidad que no puede dejar pasar, dado que ya está a puertas de ver coronada su carrera y de insertarse al mundo laboral, por lo tanto ella ha solicitado un financiamiento que le permita pagar sus módulos de titulación, luego de obtener su primer título ella desea hacer un postgrado en gerencia financiera y espera contar con la ayuda de nuestras organizaciones.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 23 year old young woman who is very enthusiastic and dedicated to academic life. She is in her fifth year of an Accounting degree based on her passion for numbers and work with financial exercises. Gabriela is supported by her husband and her parents and she helps her sister with her business for some extra income.

Gabriela discovered Kiva through MiCrédito. She couldn't let this opportunity pass her by because she is about to finish up her degree and enter into the workforce, so she has applied for a loan that will allow her to pay for her course modules and obtain her first degree. After that she would like to do a postgraduate course in Financial Management and she hopes she will be able to count on the support of this organisation to do so.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Sufala's Group

texts.en:
Sufala, standing to the extreme left hand side in the photograph, is a married woman from a small village in Banarpal, Odisha, India. There are five members in her family. Sufala lives in a home with no access to a closed toilet, which is forcing the family members to use the outdoors for defecation and to relieve themselves. They are forced to travel long distances at odd hours of the night sometimes.

Building a private toilet in the house will help prevent diseases that are caused from open defecation and promote a healthier lifestyle. In addition to this, having a toilet will save them a certain portion of their money every month, which they are spending on diseases caused by open defecation.

Therefore, Sufala, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a well-sanitized toilet and install a hand pump in it.

This loan will facilitate access to a better, safer, healthier quality of life.

loans.use: to build a well-sanitized toilet and install a hand pump in it.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman and a mother of four children, three of whom are in school and one is still young. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She owns a food cafe that she has operated for five years, selling at home to neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition from fellows in the same business. Her aspirations are to expand her business in the near future.

Mejumaa is borrowing this loan to buy foodstuffs for her cafe during this festive season. She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much. She joined Yehu to have access to loans, which will help in expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for her cafe during this festive season.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Isiyaku no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Isiyaku hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
A 48-year-old married mother of one child, Layla has been working from her house selling accessories and beauty cosmetics since 2007, with 14 years of experience in her domain. She is a hardworking lady who is putting so much effort into supporting her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.

Today, because Layla's income combined with her husband's is barely enough to cover their family's living expenses, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to purchase newly released accessories and cosmetics especially for the coming Christmas season. Layla is planning to open a retail shop in the future, and hopes that this development will be soon.

loans.use: to  purchase newly released accessories and cosmetics especially for the coming Christmas season.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 53 years old and lives in Southern Ghour. She is a married woman with five children. Fatima is a responsible, welcoming and ‎pleasant woman. She is working hard to help her husband with the household expenses. She started her business, which ‎is selling household supplies and cleaning materials. She has applied for a loan in order to improve her business and buy ‎new products to sell to increase her income. Please help Fatima to meet her goals; she needs your support.‎

loans.use: to buy ‎new products to sell, such as household supplies

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 49-year-old woman supporting three people in her family. She sells secondhand clothes, a business she has been doing for the last 25 years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more stock. She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.ru: Эту милую леди зовут Мукадас. Ей 51 год. Ее семья состоит аз ее мужа, сына, невестки и двоих внуков. Сейчас много забот обрушились на хрупкие плечи Мукадас. Ее супруг серьезно болен, его срочно нужно реабилитировать. Для реабилитации, получения комплексного лечения и на медикаменты она просит кредит. Она верит, что она сможет получить эти деньги и скорее положить своего мужа в больницу на лечение.
texts.en: Meet Mukadas, a kind 51-year-old woman.  Her family consists of her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren.  Many concerns have recently fallen on her frail shoulders.  Her husband is seriously ill and he needs medical treatment as soon as possible.  His recovery will involve a complex treatment as well as the intake of medications.  Mukadas is taking this loan to pay for her husband's treatment and medications.  She is confident that she will receive the money that she needs and that she will be able to have her husband hospitalized as soon as possible so that he can get better.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's medical treatment.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a forty nine year old widow living in Masindi-Uganda. She deals in cattle trading, has lodges and operates a restaurant as businesses that bring her income. She is responsible for taking care of five children. Being a single parent, she also has the responsibility of sustaining her family. She has built a house for rent to add to her income. She hopes to educate her children to university level so that they can get employment.

Due to the fact that we have approached the festive season, Betty wants to buy many cows for trading. The money she has at hand is not enough to do so, therefore she is requesting a credit facility to buy cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Hajiya

As a Babban Gona member, Hajiya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

As a Babban Gona member Hajiya can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hajiya no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Hajiya hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to purchase a motorbike for business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mathew is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Mathew would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Mathew will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per Hectare of land, Mathew now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members, and would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela works as a photographer and she also makes wedding videos. She pays a rent and she offers her services at the newspaper. She needs a loan to buy a new camera.

Adela is mother of one kid and she is the only support for her family. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a new camera

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 35 years old and supports 6 people in his family.

He sells chicken eggs, a business he has been doing for the last 12 years and gets a monthly income of KESs 20,000.

He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase more stock farm eggs for resale during this festive season.

He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock farm eggs for resale during this festive season

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 47-year-old single lady, who has been working as a cashier in a bakery since 2011 with a limited monthly salary to make her living.

Her monthly income is barely enough to cover her daily living needs, thus any unexpected need is hard to achieve or fulfill. That's why Tahira is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for a necessary urgent dental surgery she has to undergo.

She hopes to improve her living and accomplish a career of her own.

loans.use: to pay for a necessary, urgent dental surgery she has to undergo.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José agradece mucho la ayuda que Padecomsm le brinda atreves de los créditos Kiva, comenta que en la actualidad ha logrado tener una buena cosecha, pues ha aumentado el área de siembra, además su situación económica es favorable y con ello pueda dar mejores circunstancias de vida a su familia.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para poder cancelar la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos, además comprara sacos para almacenarlo, se mantienen entusiasmado para seguir trabajando y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
José is very grateful for the support that PADECOMSM has offered him through Kiva loans. He reports that he has had a very good harvest since he increased the area where he planted crops. In addition to that his financial situation is favourable and because of this he can provide his family with better living conditions.

José is applying for a loan to pay for the harvest of his staple grains crop as well as to purchase bags to store them in. He is enthusiastic about continuing to work and to make progress with his family.

loans.use: to pay for the harvest of his staple grains crop as well as to purchase bags to store them in.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but doesn't have piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanamisi has operated coconut and charcoal businesses for the past two years, selling from home to friends and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her goals are to expand her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more coconut and charcoal supplies for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut and charcoal supplies for resale

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en:

As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a 27-year-old woman supporting 3 people in her family.

She sells secondhand clothes, a business she has been doing for the last 12 years, and gets a monthly income of KES 25,000. She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more stock of clothing.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothing

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad lives in northern Jordan in Ajloun and he is working as a chef in restaurant, but his income is enough to ‎cover his needs, and he did not complete his education because of the financial situation of his family. 

Mohammad started his business, which is a shop on a busy street selling coffee and other products such as biscuits, chips, and ‎chocolate.   He requested a loan because he wants to pay for new products, such as food supplies ‎and snacks, and new coffee machine to increase his income.

He dreams that his children grow up with a good education and that they obtain good jobs so that they become good, ‎respectable people that have a good quality of life.‎

loans.use: to pay for new products, such as food supplies ‎and snacks, and new coffee machine to increase his income.

loans.name: Dauglas

texts.en:
Dauglas is 24 years old. He is married with 2 children. He has had a motorcycle transport business for 3 years and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle for a transportation business and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to educate his children.
His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his motorcycle transport business, make more income, and be able to educate his children at the university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for a transportation business and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to educate his children.
